column3: 著名的费多尔的摄影作品

column2:
Grapple
Attempts to grab the target and engage in grappling.
Both get restricted combat moves.
Must see target.
Chance of being detected if hidden.
column3: 擒抱 试图抓住目标并进行擒抱。两者都受到限制的战斗动作。必须看到目标。如果隐藏，有被发现的机会。

column2:
Break free
Attempts to escape the grappling hold.
Both get a chance of getting knock down, injured, and forced to lose next turn.
Only available if not in control of the grappling hold.
Not always available.
column3: 挣脱 试图脱离扭打。两人都有几率被击倒，受伤并被迫在下一回合失败。仅在厮打时可用。并非总是可用。

column2:
Release
Releases target from the grappling hold.
Target gets a chance of getting knocked down, injured, and forced to lose next turn.
Must have control of the grappling hold.
column3: 放手 从擒抱中释放目标。目标有几率在下一回合被击倒、受伤并被迫丢失一个回合。必须是擒抱目标。

column2:
Struggle Back
Attempts to hit the target while grappling.
Can also be done while being held back.
Unarmed attacks only while in a grappling hold.
Chance for the target to drop a weapon from either hand.
Not always available.
column3: 背摔 试图在扭打时背摔目标。也可以在被拖住时进行。只有在擒抱时才能进行的摔角攻击。有几率让目标的任何一只手上的武器掉落。并非总是可用。

column2:
Struggle Hit
Attempts to hit the target while grappling.
Unarmed attacks only while in a grappling hold.
Chance for the target to drop their weapons and vehicle.
Always available if in control of the grappling hold.
column3: 挣扎打击 试图在格斗中击中目标。仅在擒抱中进行徒手攻击。有几率让目标放下武器和载具(车辆)。如果被擒抱，则始终可用。

column2: <us> gains the upper hand while grappling <them>!
<us> fails to gain control of the situation!

Gain Control
Attempts to gain control of the grappling hold.
Switches grappling/grappled position with the target.
Available when only the target is fallen.
column3: 获得控制权 试图控制擒抱。切换与目标的擒抱/被擒抱位置。只有目标倒下时可用。

column2: <us> fails to take <them> down and loses balance!
column3: <us> 没能让 <them> 失去平衡摔倒!

column2:
Takedown
Attempts to damage the target by driving them down with you.
Must have no vehicles equipped.
Must be skilled in hand-to-hand combat.
Not always available.
column3: 前摔 试图通过你击倒目标来伤害他们。必须没有装备载具(车辆)。必须精通肉搏战。并非总是可用。

column2: <us> is having a hard time hitting <them>.

Knee Strikes
Attempts to hit the target multiple times while grappling.
Unarmed attacks only while in a grappling hold.
Cannot be used with a crippled leg.
column3: 膝盖撞击 在厮打中多次尝试击中目标。仅在擒抱中进行的近距离格斗。有腿伤不能使用。

column2: <us> is having a hard time hitting <them>.

This move breaks the grappling hold.

Both get even more restricted combat moves.

Drain fatigue until the target blacks out.

column2:
Bite 
Bite the target while they're down.
Injures target, plus keep them fallen and force them to lose next turn.
Must be in melee range.
Must see target.
High chance of being detected if hidden.
Not always available.
column3: 撕咬 在目标倒下时撕咬。伤害目标, 并迫使对方保持倒地且下一回合无法行动。必须在近战范围内。必须看到目标。如果隐藏，被发现的可能性高。并非总是可用。

column2: <us> stands down and leaves the area.

Identify Target
Make yourself visible to target.
Make yourself known to target.
Regarded as unwillingness to fight.

column2:
Charge! 
Moves 4-6 spaces towards target.
Must be 5 spaces away.
Must see target.
Removes cover.
Makes you vulnerable.
High chance of being detected if hidden.
column3: 冲锋!向目标移动 4-6 个距离。必须相距 5 个距离外。必须看到目标。移除掩护。使你露出破绽。如果隐藏，被发现的可能性高。

column2:
Withdraw! 
Moves 4-8 spaces away from target.
Must see target.
Must be 5 spaces away.
Removes cover.
Makes you vulnerable.
High chance of tripping on terrain.
High chance of being detected if hidden.
column3: 退避!向目标远离 4-8 格。必须看到目标。必须相距 5 个距离外。移除掩护。使你露出破绽。在地形上跌倒的机会高。如果隐藏，被发现的可能性高。

column2:
Escape 
Vanishes from sight and leaves the area.
Must be hidden.
column3: 逃脱 从视线中消失并离开该区域。必须隐藏。

column2: <us> is eating <them> alive while they're down!

column3: 活吞 吃掉无防备的存活目标。必须在近战范围内。必须看到目标。当目标因休克而昏迷时可用。

column2:
Farmers in the suburbs had to abandon their farming plots in the collapse. Farm animals were the first victims of the creatures, which then started to stalk and ambush the farmers from their own crops.

Still, these plots are quite big, and some of the produce might have been missed by scavengers.
column3: 郊区的农民在坍塌中不得不放弃他们的耕地。农场动物是这些生物的第一批受害者，然后它们开始从农民自己的庄稼上偷袭和伏击农民。尽管如此，这些地块还是很大的，有些农产品可能被拾荒者遗漏了。

column2: Use knowledge of plants to find better plant-based loot.
column3: 利用植物知识更好地找到植物战利品。

column2:
You examine the metal locker, which has clear signs of failed attempts to be opened by force. A heavy locker of this kind has probably something of value inside. Could it be money? Or maybe guns...
			
The real question is, can you get past the lock?
column3: 你检查了金属储物柜，上面有明显的强行打开尝试失败的迹象。这种沉重的储物柜里面可能有一些有价值的东西。会不会是钱？或者枪...或者也许是枪... 真正的问题是，你能打开锁吗？

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2: On second thought, you decide to leave the locker alone.
column3: 再三考虑，你决定不理会储物柜。

column2:
This auto repair shop seems to have been abandoned even before the collapse. The place is littered with scrap metal, old car parts and other garbage.

Maybe there are tools or forgotten equipment in all this mess, hopefully.
column3: 这家汽车修理店似乎在倒闭之前就已经被废弃了。这个地方到处都是废金属、旧汽车零件和其他垃圾。希望在一团糟中有工具或被遗弃的设备。

column2:
This place used to be filled with people looking to buy pretty much anything, from food to guns. Now it's a haunting looking building surrounded by smashed up vehicles in its parking lots and with debris and garbage scattered inside.

You would be pretty lucky to find something that can be used in this forsaken place.
column3: 这个地方曾经挤满了想要购买几乎任何东西的人，从食物到枪支。现在它看起来是一栋阴森恐怖的建筑，周围的停车场里是被砸毁的车辆，里面散落着碎片和垃圾。你会很幸运地在这个被遗弃的地方找到有用的东西。

column2:
This pharmacy was probably one of the first shops looted when things started to go bad. All is in disarray inside and most of the stuff seems to have been cleared out in a hurry.

It might be still worth searching, though. Who knows if there's still something under the collapsed shelves and piles of bricks and broken furniture.
column3: 当一切开始变得糟糕时，这家药店可能是最早被洗劫的商店之一。里面一片狼藉，大部分东西似乎都被匆忙清理干净了。不过，它仍然值得搜索。谁知道在倒塌的架子和成堆的砖块和破家具下还有什么东西。
搜刮被洗劫的枪支商店

column2:
This gun store was obviously one of the first shops looted around here. Something bad happened inside... the walls are riddled with bullet holes and there's old blood stains all over the place. No corpses, though.

Still, is not a bad idea to search around. Who knows if there's still something under the collapsed shelves and piles of bricks and broken furniture.
column3: 这家枪店显然是这里最早被抢劫的商店之一。里面发生过不好的事情……墙壁上布满了弹孔，到处都是旧血迹。不过没有尸体。尽管如此，四处搜索也不是一个坏主意。谁知道在倒塌的架子和成堆的砖块和破家具下还有什么东西。
带有沙丁胺醇罐的 药康 吸入器 - $90

column2:
Patient will receive an inhaler for respiratory disorders with 15 doses.

Cost: $90
column3: 患者将接受 15 剂用于呼吸系统疾病的吸入器。 费用：$90

column2: "Very well. The dispensary should have it prepared any minute now."
column3: "很好。药房应该马上就能准备好。"

column2: A barricaded gun store could be either a good sign or a bad one. There's probably stuff inside but there could also be someone or something in there too. There's only one way to know for sure and that way involves a crowbar.
column3: 被加固的枪支商店可能是一个好兆头，也可能是一个坏兆头。里面可能有宝贝，但里面也可能有人或其他玩意。只有一种方法可以确定，那就是用撬棍试试。

column2: Force your way past the boards

Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2:
As soon as you are about to enter the area, you hear something open with a creaking sound. You then hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You brace yourself as you realize something is coming for you.
column3: 刚要进入这建筑，就听到有什么东西打开了，发出咯吱咯吱的声音。然后你听到脚步声在向你快速接近。你意识到有什么东西要来了，不过你已经为此做好准备。

column2:
A few moments after you start to remove the boards, you see something moving inside. You quickly step back when it starts moving towards you.

You brace yourself as you realize you just released something else trapped in here.
column3: 在你开始拆除木板片刻之后，你会看到里面有东西在移动。当它开始向你移动时，你迅速后退。你意识到你刚刚释放了被困在这里的东西时，你得打起12分精神来。

column2:
As soon as you are about to enter the building, you hear something open with a creaking sound. You then hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You brace yourself as you realize something is coming for you.
column3: 刚要进入这建筑，就听到有什么东西打开了，发出咯吱咯吱的声音。然后你听到脚步声在向你快速接近。你意识到有什么东西要来了，不过你已经为此做好准备。

column2: After a while of just staring at the damn thing, you decide to just forget about it and move on.
column3: 在盯着这该死的东西看了一会儿之后，你决定忘记它并继续前进。

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2:
As you are about to go start looking for something to scavenge, you see something moving fast at the distance. You quickly move from sight without thinking twice.

You brace yourself as you realize someone is coming for you.
column3: 当你开始寻找某些能搜刮的东西时，你看到远处有什么东西在快速移动。你想都没想就迅速地避开了它的视线。你意识到有什么东西要来了，不过你已经为此做好准备。
使用 GPS 应用程序

column2: Even after civilization has crumbled, some of the GPS satellite network remains operational.
column3: 即使在文明崩溃之后，一些 GPS 卫星网络仍然可以运行。

column2: Discover nearby hexes and scavenge sites
column3: 定位附近的格子和可搜刮的地方。

column2: After acquiring satellites, the computer locates your position, and displays cached map data. Not all of it is up-to-date, unfortunately, but it's better than nothing.
column3: 在链接卫星后，计算机会定位你的位置，并显示缓存的地图数据。不幸的是，并非所有的数据都是最新的，但总比没有好。

column2: Use GPS to look up Saginaw
column3: 使用 GPS 定位萨吉诺

column2: It takes some time acquiring satellites in the crumbling system, but the computer locates your position, and displays route info. (See minimap.)
column3: 在不稳定的系统中链接卫星需要一些时间，但计算机会定位你的位置，并显示路线信息。(见小地图。)

column2: It takes some time acquiring satellites in the crumbling system, but the computer locates your position, and displays route info. (See minimap.)
column3: 在不稳定的系统中链接卫星需要一些时间，但计算机会定位你的位置，并显示路线信息。(见小地图。)

column2:
It takes some time acquiring satellites in the crumbling system, but the computer locates your position, and displays the nearby area.

You recognize Detroit, even if everything else in your memory is missing. As cities go, it's one of the bigger ones.

You trace a route from where you are to the city. (See minimap.)
column3: 在不稳定的系统中链接卫星需要一些时间，但计算机会定位你的位置，并显示附近区域。你认出了底特律，即使你记忆中的其他东西都没了。但你依旧记得它作为城市之一算比较大的了。你导航一条从你所在的地方到城市的路线。(见小地图。)

column2:
"Oh, you mean this one?" you nonchalantly ask while revealing the very urn he had mentioned.
			
Hatter leans forward, tilting his head just enough to peer at you from under his brim. "Hm," he contemplates, reclining in his creaky chair.
			
"Perhaps you *are* worth the extra attention you seem to have garnered." Hatter remarks as you hand him the urn. He then places it in a safe, then locks it.

He reaches into a desk drawer, and produces a black wristband. "As agreed, your visitor's pass."

As you ride the elevator car down through the building's innards once more, you wonder what to expect beyond DMC's imposing gates.
column3: “哦，你是说这个？”你漫不经心地问，同时展示了他提到的骨灰盒。帽匠身体前倾，歪着头，刚好能从帽檐下窥视你。“嗯，”他斜靠在吱吱作响的椅子上沉思着。“也许你值得你似乎获得的额外关注。”当你把骨灰盒递给哈特时，他说。然后他把它放在保险箱里，然后锁上。他从办公桌抽屉里拿出一个黑色手环。“按照约定，你的访客通行证。”当你再次乘坐电梯穿过大楼内部时，你不禁想象在 DMC 巨大的大门之外会有什么等着你。

column2:
You find yourself crossing a busy street, along with a river of other people in different attires. Someone suddenly bumps into you and you turn to face them. You freeze in place as a sense of dread invades you. You could swear it was someone wearing the burlap hood.
			
Not long after that, someone else bumps into your prompting you to keep walking. You quickly make your way to a spot away from the endless stream of pedestrians.

As you recover from the fright, you start to scan the direction the strangler went but it was simply impossible to spot an specific individual. After getting your bearings, you join the other pedestrians and being to walk again. The sense of dread remains.
column3: 你发现自己穿过一条繁忙的街道，和一大群穿着不同服装的人在一起。有人突然撞到你，你转身面对他们。当一种恐惧感侵入你时，你僵在原地。你可以发誓是有人戴着粗麻布兜帽。不久之后，有人撞到你，提示你继续走。你很快来到一个远离川流不息的行人的地方。当你从恐惧中恢复过来时，你开始扫描扼杀者去的方向，但根本不可能发现一个特定的人。确定方位后，你加入其他行人的行列，重新开始行走。恐惧感依然存在。

column2: Enter the antechamber and face the creature.
column3: 进入前厅，面对这个生物。

column2:
Or maybe you are. It has been a while since you last tried to enter this place... You take a deep breath and make your way to the entrance. You see the familiar rectangular lobby. You scan the room from side to side for the creature. You stare at the door at the far end for a moment, trying to ignore the clear signs of violence and decay. 

The smell is not helping.
column3: 或者也许你是。自从你上次试图进入这个地方已经有一段时间了...你深呼吸，走向入口。你会看到熟悉的长方形大厅。你从一边到另一边扫描房间寻找那个生物。你盯着远端的门看了一会儿，试图忽略暴力和腐烂的明显迹象。气味没有帮助。

column2:
You examine the metal locker, which has clear signs of failed attempts to be opened by force. A heavy locker with a computerized lock of this kind has probably something of value inside. Could it be money? Or maybe guns...
			
The real question is, can you get past the electronic lock?
column3: 你检查了金属锁柜，上面有明显的强行打开尝试失败的迹象。带有这种电脑锁的重型储物柜可能里面有一些有价值的东西。会不会是钱？或者枪...或者也许是枪... 真正的问题是，你能打开电子锁吗？

column2: Use an RFID spoofer to open the lock.
column3: 使用 RFID 欺骗软件开锁

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion. You launch the software in "brute" mode, and start running codes. After a while, the software registers a hit, and the lock clicks open.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。你启动软件的“暴力”模式，并开始运行代码。过了一会，软件运算出答案，锁就咔嚓一声打开了。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2: On second thought, you decide to leave the locker alone.
column3: 想了想，你决定不理会储物柜。

column2:
Patient will receive a stack of 10 sealed bandages.

Cost: $200
column3: 患者将得到一叠 10 条密封绷带。 费用：$200

column2: "Very well. The dispensary should have them prepared any minute now."
column3: "很好。药房应该马上就能准备好。"

column2: Hack the console for a full door override.
column3: 破解控制台以获得完整的门控制权限.

column2:
Using all your knowledge, you quickly manage to override the security system and gain full control of the door mechanism. You suddenly freeze in place as a shadow appears at the other side of the doorway. You find yourself unable to do anything but to stare at the darkness.
			
Luckily, as soon as the creature reveals itself, you manage to react and hit the controls, forcing the door to close. With the basic safety protocols deactivated, the door is unable to detect an obstruction in its way, and traps the creature as it moves towards you. The creature howls madly as it tries to fight the crushing force of the door but all suddenly stops with a cracking sound.
			
The motionless creature starts to bleed as the door continues to crush it, so you hit the button to stop the horrible sound of the crushing of bone and flesh.
column3: 利用你所有的知识，你很快设法越过安全系统并完全控制大门。当一个影子出现在门口的另一边时，你突然僵住了。你发现自己除了盯着黑暗什么也做不了。幸运的是，一旦这个生物露面，你就会做出反应并按下控制按钮，强行关闭门。禁用安全协议后，这扇门将无法检测到它前面的障碍物，并在生物向你移动时将其困住。这生物疯狂地嚎叫着，试图对抗门的压迫，但一切在突然一声碎裂下停止了。当门继续压碎它时，一动不动的生物开始流血，于是你按下按钮停下了骨头与肉的糟糕碾碎声。

column2: This stretch of forest seems to almost flourish in the absence of human life. There's a good chance one could find raw materials in here if they knew what to look for.
column3: 在没有人类生活的情况下，这片森林似乎几乎蓬勃发展。如果人们知道要寻找什么，他们很有可能在这里找到原材料。

column2:
Finding twigs and bark is pretty easy. It's all over the place. Branches are not as common so it takes you a bit more time to gather.

After a while, you managed to gather some with no problems.
column3: 寻找树枝和树皮非常容易。到处都是。树枝并不常见，因此你需要更多时间来收集。过了一会儿，你设法收集了一些。

column2: Get a large branch from a tree

Large branches can be really useful for a number of reasons, including crude weapons. Getting a good one would need a bit of searching and work.

After a while, you find one that looks about right but it takes some effort to remove from the tree. You end up a bit tired and wished you had tools for this.
column3: 大树枝确实可以用在很多方面，包括粗制武器。要获得一根质量好的，得需要努力点找。过了一会儿，你发现一根看起来不错，但需要费些力气才能从树上移除。你最后有点累了，希望你有工具来做这件事。

column2:
Lakes like this one are a beautiful sight. You stand at the edge of it and see some ripples widening out on the surface. For a moment, it manages to make you forget what you came here for.

But then you realize how quiet the whole place is. It suddenly gets so eerie you don't want to spend more time in there anymore.
column3: 像这样的湖泊是一道美丽的风景。你站在它的边缘，看到一些涟漪在表面扩大。有那么一瞬间，它让你忘记来这的目的了。但后来你意识到整个地方是如此安静。它突然变得如此毛骨悚然，你不想再在那里花更多时间了。

column2: The water is cold to the touch and doesn't look visibly contaminated.
column3: 水摸起来很冷，看起来没有明显的污染。

column2: This place is teeming with life. The sound of insects gets louder the closer you get to the wetland. The vegetation here is dense, even in the water, which looks a bit nasty, to say the least.
column3: 这个地方充满了生机。你越靠近湿地，昆虫的声音就越大。这里的植被很茂密，甚至在水中也是，可以说，这看起来有点恶心。

column2: This water looks ok enough to be used for purposes other than drinking.
column3: 这种水看起来可以用于饮用以外的用途。

column2: The river in this place is so clear you can actually see the stones underneath. The stream is not even turbid or deep so you can easily cross from one side to another.
column3: 这个地方的河流是如此清澈，实际上还可以看到水下的石头。溪流既不混浊也不深，因此您可以轻松地从一侧穿越到另一侧。

column2: The stream is pristine and cool. It makes you want to cup your hands and get a drink from it.
column3: 溪流纯净而清爽。它让你想用手捧着喝上一口。

column2: Hack a large branch from a tree
column3: 从树上砍下一根大树枝

column2:
Large branches can be really useful for a number of reasons, including crude weapons. Getting a good one would need a bit of searching and work.

After a while, you find one that looks about right. Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion and managed to hack the branch from the tree without major complications.
column3: 大树枝确实可以用在很多方面，包括粗制武器。要获得一根质量好的，得需要努力点找。过了一会，你发现一根看起来不错。幸运的是，你为这种情况做好了准备，并设法从树上砍下树枝，没有什么大麻烦。

column2:
You also see rocks of different sizes all around the place. Pebbles mostly.  
			
You decide to gather some of them.
column3: 您还可以在各处看到大小不一的岩石。鹅卵石居多。你决定收集其中的一些。

column2: Actually, you have better things to do. You decide to leave the area for now.
column3: 事实上，你还有更重要的事情要做。你决定暂时离开该地区。

column2:
You look up in hopes to see something but the treetops are too high above the ground, and the branches and leaves block your vision. The song of birds and the occasional sound of movement keep your hopes high, though.

It could be dangerous to climb up trees to search for bird nests but eggs are not so bad of a meal, specially if you find more than one.
column3: 你抬头希望看到什么，但树梢离地太高，树枝和树叶挡住了你的视线。不过，鸟儿的歌声和偶尔的运动声让您寄予厚望。爬上树去寻找鸟巢可能很危险，但鸟蛋并不是那么糟糕的食物，特别是如果你找到不止一颗鸟蛋的话。

column2: Use skill in tracking to have better chances to find loot.
column3: 使用追踪技巧有更好的几率找到战利品。

column2:
You fell down the tree!

While carefully climbing a tree, you suddenly slip and tumble to the bottom. In the fall, you get banged up and bruised, but thankfully, you were just climbing the tree so nothing more serious happened.
column3: 你从树上掉下来了！在你小心翼翼地爬上一棵树时，你突然滑倒并跌落到树底。在坠落过程中，你被撞得鼻青脸肿，但幸运的是，你爬的是树，所以没有发生更严重的事情。

column2:
You fell down the tree!

While carefully climbing a tree, you suddenly slip and tumble to the bottom. In the fall, you get banged up and bruised. The impact below knocks the wind out of you. There's a taste in your mouth like iron, and your nose tingles painfully.
column3: 你从树上掉下来了！在你小心翼翼地爬上一棵树时，你突然滑倒并跌落到树底。在坠落过程中，你被撞得遍体鳞伤。落地的冲击力心神不宁。你的嘴里有股铁一样的味道，鼻子一阵刺痛。

column2: Use skill in tracking to be able to find animal-based loot.
column3: 使用追踪技能找到基于动物的战利品。

column2: Use skill in tracking to be able to find animal-based loot.
column3: 使用追踪技能找到基于动物的战利品。

column2:
Might be half the reason anyone comes here. It's really cheap so it's probably of poor quality.

You squeeze yourself up to the counter, and do your best to out-wave, out-glance, and outmaneuver the dirty masses around you.

Minutes later, you sidestep back into the crowd, holding a dirty plastic cup with a urine colored liquid that you hope is beer.
column3: 这可能是人们来这里的一半原因。它真的很廉价，所以它可能质量很差。你挤到柜台前，尽你最大的努力去挥手并避开你周围的肮脏人群。几分钟后，你侧身退到人群中，拿着一个邋遢的塑料杯，杯子里装着一种你希望是啤酒的尿色液体。

column2: Mod iSlab Lamp App to work on a smartphone.
column3: 修改iSlab灯应用程序并在智能手机上运行。

column2: Editing software for mobile devices is a simple task for you. You start messing around with the files and coding needed to modify this iSlab software and allow it to work on a smartphone.
column3: 编辑移动设备的软件对你来说是一件简单的事。你开始捣鼓修改这个iSlab软件所需的文件和编码，让它能在智能手机上运行。

column2: Mod smartphone Lamp App to work on an iSlab.
column3: 修改智能手机灯应用程序并在iSlab上运行。

column2: Editing software for mobile devices is a simple task for you. You start messing around with the files and coding needed to modify this smartphone software and allow it to work on an iSlab.
column3: 编辑移动设备的软件对你来说是一件简单的事。你开始捣鼓修改这个智能手机软件所需的文件和编码，让它能在iSlab上运行。

column2: Mod iSlab GPS App to work on a smartphone.
column3: 修改iSlab GPS 应用程序并在 智能手机 上运行。

column2: Editing software for mobile devices is a simple task for you. You start messing around with the files and coding needed to modify this iSlab software and allow it to work on a smartphone.
column3: 编辑移动设备的软件对你来说是一件简单的事。你开始捣鼓修改这个iSlab软件所需的文件和编码，让它能在智能手机上运行。

column2: Mod smartphone GPS App to work on an iSlab.
column3: 修改 智能手机 GPS 应用程序并在iSlab上运行。

column2: Editing software for mobile devices is a simple task for you. You start messing around with the files and coding needed to modify this smartphone software and allow it to work on an iSlab.
column3: 编辑移动设备的软件对你来说是一件简单的事。你开始捣鼓修改这个智能手机软件所需的文件和编码，让它能在iSlab上运行。

column2:
You've returned to the mini trash alley that leads to the Isotope Mine.

It doesn't look like anyone's home, but you know that's not the case. You can hear Gertrude inside, guarding the antechamber.
column3: 你回到了通往同位素矿的迷你垃圾巷。它看起来不像任何人的家，但你知道不是这样的。你可以听到格特鲁德在里面守卫前厅。

column2:
You gingerly open the door to the mine antechamber. It appears to be empty. No sign of Gertrude... at least at first.

As soon as you make your way to the door at the other side, You see the metal creature heading your way. Suddenly, the creature stops and shuts down.

You see a red light from a security camera flickering on and off just above the doorway and soon after, the door opens.
column3: 你小心翼翼地打开矿井前厅的门。它似乎是空的。没有格特鲁德的踪迹...至少一开始是这样。当你走到另一边的门时，你会看到那个金属生物向你走来。突然，这个生物停下来，关闭了。你看到一个安全摄像头发出的红灯在门口上方忽明忽暗，不久之后，门打开了。

column2: Mod iSlab RF1:D RFID spoofer software to work on a smartphone.
column3: 修改iSlab RF1:D 射频识别欺骗软件并在智能手机上运行。

column2: Editing software for mobile devices is a simple task for you. You start messing around with the files and coding needed to modify this iSlab software and allow it to work on a smartphone.
column3: 编辑移动设备的软件对你来说是一件简单的事。你开始捣鼓修改这个iSlab软件所需的文件和编码，让它能在智能手机上运行。

column2: Mod smartphone RF1:D RFID spoofer software to work on an iSlab.
column3: 修改 智能手机 RF1:D 射频识别欺骗软件并在iSlab上运行。

column3: 编辑移动设备的软件对你来说是一件简单的事。你开始捣鼓修改这个智能手机软件所需的文件和编码，让它能在iSlab上运行。
使用 Mock1ngb1rd 应用程序

column2: You run the signal hacking app and it immediately starts scanning for DMC comms signals.
column3: 你运行信号黑客应用程序，它会立即开始扫描 DMC 通信信号。
使用 Mock1ngb1rd 应用程序

column2: You run the signal hacking app and it immediately starts scanning for DMC comms signals.
column3: 你运行信号黑客应用程序，它会立即开始扫描 DMC 通信信号。

column3: 修改 智能手机 Mock1ngb1rd 软件并在iSlab上运行。

column2: Using your knowledge in software and hacking, you managed to open the file using another file extension and tricked DTM into downloading the data anyway.
column3: 利用您在软件和黑客方面的知识，您设法使用另一个文件扩展名打开文件，并诱骗 DTM 下载数据。

column2:
*Nan00 App Creation Kit*

Reading...
Drone Data files selected.

You load the files and start using the App Maker. After a while of file editing, you end up creating an app that can intercept DMC comms signals and mimic a drone support call.
column3: *Nan00 应用创建工具包* 阅读... 已选择无人机数据文件。选定无人机数据文件。您加载文件并开始使用 App Maker。经过一段时间的文件编辑，您最终创建了一个可以拦截 DMC 通信信号并模仿无人机支援呼叫的应用程序。
ATN 猎手 对话(简短谈话)

column2:
"I spotted you from miles away, stranger," he says, as he shakes his head in disapproval.

"Leave this place as soon as you can. The Windigoo lurk and hunt us in these lands, and you are too clumsy to remain hidden," he warns as he walks past you.
column3: "陌生人，我在几英里外就发现你了。他一边说，一边不赞成地摇头。"尽快离开这个地方。温迪戈在这些土地上潜伏并猎杀我们，而你太笨拙，无法隐藏," 他从你身边走过时警告你。

column2: ATN Slayer Conversation (hiding and tracking skills, talk)
column3: ATN 猎手 对话(隐藏和跟踪技巧，谈话)

column2:
"I usually see travelers from miles away or hear them before I spot them but you are cautious and quiet," he says, paying more attention to something beyond you.

"Beware of the Windigoo, traveler. They lurk and hunt us in these lands," he warns you as he checks the surroundings.
column3: "我通常能发现几英里外的旅行者，或者在发现他们之前听到他们的声音，但你很谨慎和安静," 他说，要多关注除你以外的东西。"“当心温迪戈，旅行者。他们潜伏在这些土地上并猎杀我们，” 他在检查周围环境时警告你。

column2:
"The Windigo?" you ask as you look around worried.

"The Windigoo seek to possess those who have tasted the flesh of another person. It does not matter if you are strong or skilled, there is no way to protect yourself against these cursed spirits once you have indulged in eating human flesh. The possessed will start to change both in appearance and behaviour. They start to crave for human flesh more and more but will be unable to be sated for long. As the spirit grows stronger, the skin of the possessed will begin to turn pale, the body will turn skeletal and the eyes pushed back deep into their sockets. They finally turn into desiccated-looking monsters, feral enough to eat the meat raw from their victims, who are sometimes still alive," he explains without even looking at you but the area around.

"You should be wise and leave this place, traveler," he warns.
column3: " 温迪戈？” 你担心地环顾四周并问道。"“温迪戈会试图夺舍那些吃过人肉的人。无论你是否强壮或有能，一旦你沉溺于吃人肉，就没有办法保护自己免受这些被诅咒的灵魂的伤害。被附身的人会开始改变外表和行为。他们开始越来越渴望人肉，但无法长时间满足。随着邪灵变得越来越强大，被附身者的皮肤会开始变白，身体会变得骨瘦如柴，眼睛会深深缩进眼窝里。随着灵魂变得越来越强大，被附身的人的皮肤会开始变得苍白，身体会变得骨瘦如柴，眼睛会被深深地推回到眼窝里。他们最终会变成看起来干瘪的怪物，野性足以生吃受害者的肉，而受害者有时还活着，”他解释道，甚至没有看你，只看周围的区域。"“你应该离开这个地方，旅行者，聪明点，” 他警告说.

column2:
"...So, how do I defend myself against them? Any tips you could share?"

"Well, the Windigoo will usually hunt at night. They seem to prefer hunting alone too... probably to avoid sharing the meal with other Windigoo. They are really good at tracking you once they spot you and will give chase until they get to you. Oh, and most importantly... do not underestimate them, traveler. They might look weak and fragile but, I assure you, they are not. They are vicious fighters and tough to hurt so it is best to slay them with a bow, a gun or anything that can be used from a distance," he instructs.

"Anyways, be always vigilant. We must part ways now," he says as he quickly leaves you behind.
column3: "...那么，我该如何保护自己?有什么建议可以分享吗?" "听着，温迪戈通常在晚上狩猎。它们也似乎更喜欢单独狩猎……可能是为了避免和其他温迪戈共享佳肴。一旦发现你，它们就会紧紧追踪你，直到它们找到你为止。噢，最重要的是……旅行者，不要低估他们。他们可能看起来很虚弱，但我向你保证，他们不弱。它们是凶猛的战士，很难被伤害，所以最好用弓、枪或任何可以在远处杀死它们的东西，" 他指示。"无论如何，要时刻保持警惕。现在我们必须得分开了。他说，很快他就将你留在身后。

column2: ATN Slayer Conversation (windigo player, no talk)
column3: ATN 猎手 对话(温迪戈玩家，不说话)

column2:
"You stink of human rot," he spits. "Begone, windigoo. You will soon turn feral and I will have no choice but to put you down."

He seems ready to fight.
column3: "你身上有一股腐烂人类的臭味。”他吐了口唾沫。“消失,温迪戈。你很快就会变成野性，到时我别无选择，只能把你杀了。"他似乎做好战斗准备了。

column2: ATN Warrior Conversation (Red Hoodie, no talk)
column3: ATN 战士对话(红色连帽衫，无对话)

column2:
"Your ways will be the end of you all," the ATN warrior spits from the distance.

Seems ready to fight so you decide to just leave.
column3: "你们的行径将是你们所有人的末日，” ATN战士从远处啐了口唾沫。见来势汹汹，你决定先走为上。

column2: DMC Guard Conversation (Red Hoodie, no talk)
column3: DMC 警卫对话(红色连帽衫，无对话)

column2:
"Looking for trouble? You, cannibalistic bastard," the guard spits from the distance.

Seems ready to fight so you decide to just leave.
column3: "想找麻烦?你，吃人的混蛋," 警卫从远处啐了一口唾沫。见来势汹汹，你决定先走为上。

column2: Martha's Army Soldier Conversation (Red Hoodie, no talk)
column3: 玛莎军团士兵对话(红色连帽衫，无对话)

column2:
"One more step and you will regret it, Bad Mutha," the soldier spits from the distance.

Seems ready to fight so you decide to just leave.
column3: "再走一步你会后悔的，摇滚帮," 士兵从远处啐了口唾沫。见来势汹汹，你决定先走为上。

column2: Bad Mutha Conversation (Red Hoodie, no talk)
column3: 摇滚帮对话(红色连帽衫，无对话)

column2:
"You think you can fool us, don't you? Get lost before I change my mind, meat," the Bad Mutha spits from the distance.

Seems ready to fight so you decide to just leave.
column3: "你以为你能耍我们，是吗？在我改变主意之前滚，肉," 摇滚帮从远处吐了口唾沫。见来势汹汹，你决定先走为上。
拾荒者对话(红色连帽衫，无对话)

column2:
"Get away from me, freak!" the looter cries from the distance.

You decide to just leave.
column3: "离我远点，怪胎!" 拾荒者在远处哭着喊。你决定离开。

column2:
The warrior just presses a finger to his lips, signaling silence. 

Then, he quickly turns his attention back to the area around you, seemingly stalking something.
column3: 战士只是将一根手指放在嘴唇上，表示安静。然后，他迅速将注意力转向你周围的区域，看起来是在跟踪什么。

column2:
You look up at the nest but it seems to be deserted since there's an evident lack of activity. Not a single bee can be seen around either. 

It might still be worth a shot, though.
column3: 你抬头看了看蜂巢，但它似乎被遗弃了，因为那里没有明显痕迹。周围也看不到一只蜜蜂。不过，它仍然值得一试。

column2:
You can actually reach for it but as soon as you start manipulating the nest, a bee flies past you. It turns out the nest was not really abandoned and you decide to leave, fast. Not even a second later, bees start to gather around you and start attacking the intruder.
			
After a lot of running away and swatting, you managed to escape. Luckily for you, the attack was not as bad as it could have been.
column3: 实际上你可以伸手够到它，但当你开始摆弄蜂巢时，一只蜜蜂从你身边飞过。事实证明，巢穴并没有真正被遗弃，你决定赶紧离开。不到一秒钟，蜜蜂就开始聚集在你周围并开始攻击入侵者。在不停逃跑和追逐之后，你设法逃脱了。幸运的是，这次攻击并没有想象中那么糟糕。

column2:
You decide to stay away from the nest and try something. You grab some rocks and decide to start throwing them at the nest from afar. After some failed attempts, you managed to hit it. It was at this moment, you realized it was not the smartest idea. A disturbed swarm of angry bees quickly flies at you. You reaction was to panic and run away as fast as you can.
			
After a lot of running away and swatting, you managed to escape. The bees were vicious, but you survived.
column3: 你决定离蜂巢远点并尝试这样。你抓起一些石头，决定从远处向蜂巢扔去。经过几次扔空，你成功砸中了它。就在此时此刻，你意识到这可不是最聪明的主意。一群愤怒的蜜蜂迅速向你飞来。你惊慌失措并以最快的速度跑开。在不停逃跑和追逐之后，你设法逃脱了。蜜蜂很凶猛，但你还活着。

column2:
The nest is out of reach so you decide to climb the tree. As you are making your way towards it, you slip onto the branch holding the nest and disturb it. You realize the nest is not abandoned when a bee flies past you. You panic and, as you try to jump down, you slip and tumble to the bottom instead. As you are getting up, bees start to gather around you and start attacking the fallen intruder.
			
After a lot of running away and swatting, you managed to escape. Luckily for you, the attack was not as bad as it could have been.
column3: 蜂巢太远了，所以你决定爬上树。当你朝它靠近时，你摔倒在支撑着蜂巢的树枝上并惊动了它。当一只蜜蜂从你身边飞过时，你意识到蜂巢并没有被遗弃。你惊慌失措，你本想跳下去却反而滑倒了。当你起身时，蜜蜂开始聚集在你周围，开始攻击倒下的入侵者。在不停逃跑和追逐之后，你设法逃脱了。幸运的是，这次攻击并没有想象中那么糟糕。

column2:
You manage to approach the nest, torch in hand. The nest is within arm reach so you decide to work fast. The torch is not making much smoke so you start to gather flammable things under the nest. Hopefully, these will make more smoke.
			
			At first, it seems to be working just fine but you soon realize you put too much flammable garbage and is all on fire now, and before you know it, so is the nest and then the tree. 
			
As you step back from the raging fire, you can't help but smile in disbelief, thinking how much of a failure you are. After a moment of contemplation, you just turn around and leave.
column3: 你设法靠近蜂巢，手里拿着火把。蜂巢已触手可及，你决定快速行动。火把没有产生太多的烟，所以你开始在蜂巢下面收集易燃物品。希望这些能产生更多的烟雾。起初，它似乎效果很好，但很快你意识到易燃的垃圾放的太多，现在全都着火了，不知不觉，蜂巢和树也着火了。当你从熊熊烈火前退后一步时，你情不自禁地微笑着，想着自己是多么的失败。沉思片刻后，你转身离开了。

column2: Use a torch to smoke the bees, lowering your chances of triggering them.
column3: 使用火把烟熏蜜蜂，降低触动它们的几率。

column2:
You carefully approach the abandoned car. There's evident damage and rust all over it so it's been here for quite a while.

Someone probably looted it already but it might still be worth a shot.
column3: 你小心翼翼地靠近那辆废弃汽车。那车到处是明显的损坏和锈迹，所以它在这里有一段时间了。有人可能已经搜刮过了，但还是值得一试。

column2: Use knowledge in mechanics to find better tool-based loot.
column3: 使用机械知识找到更好的基于工具的战利品。

column2: Use a monkey wrench to scavenge specific loot from vehicles.
column3: 使用活动扳手从车辆中搜刮到特定的战利品。

column2: Use a crowbar to pry open extra compartments during scavenging.
column3: 在搜刮过程中使用撬棍撬开额外的隔间。
ATN 猎手对话(没空，无对话)

column2: "This is not the place for talking," he says, paying more attention to something beyond you.
column3: "这里不是说话的地方," 他说，并更多地关注你以外的东西。

column2:
Patient will be screened for eligibility in heavy muscle enhancement.

If eligible, the patient will have their muscle tissue perforated and interlinked with the Rose Augmentations RA:024 Synthetic Muscle, which enhances the muscle to exceed in overall limb and back strength. The anchor points are additionally reinforced with an elastic collagen enhancement to prevent tissue tearing.

The RA:024 fiber is a carbon weave 100% compatible with organic muscle tissue. As such, it requires no additional treatment sessions for tissue adaptability as it reinforces the user's natural biomechanical structure.

Cost: $7600
column3: 将筛选患者是否有资格进行重度肌肉增强。如果符合条件，患者的肌肉组织将被穿孔，并与玫瑰增强 RA:024 合成肌肉相连，该肌肉增强了整体肢体和背部的力量。锚点还用弹性胶原蛋白增强剂加固，以防止组织撕裂。RA:024 纤维是一种与有机肌肉组织100%兼容的碳纤维织物。因此，它不需要额外的组织适应性治疗，因为它加强了使用者的自然生物力学结构。 费用：$7600

column2:
After verifying there is no danger of synthetic rejection, you're escorted to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under general anesthesia.

The procedure will be lengthy and extremely complex, requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work will be done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature. Luckily, you'll be unconscious during this procedure.

When you wake up, there's a single but violent spasm in all of your limbs as soon as you tried to move. For several minutes, a mild pain and small involuntary spasms happen as the nurse checks your restraints and tries to calm you down. You feel some anxiety at the lack of control.

Finally, the spasms pass and you are at least able to move your fingers at will.

You are finally released from the operating table.
column3: 在确认没有合成排斥的风险后，你将被护送到手术室，进行液体和营养静脉注射，并置于全身麻醉下。这个过程将是漫长且极其复杂的，需要在微观尺度上对组织进行精确操作。大部分工作将通过计算机辅助远程手术电枢完成。幸运的是，在全过程中你会失去知觉。当你醒来时，只要你试图移动，你的所有四肢都会出现一次剧烈的痉挛。几分钟后，护士会检查你的束缚并试图让你平静下来，你会出现轻微的疼痛和轻微的不自主痉挛。并对缺乏控制而感到有些焦虑。最后，痉挛过去了，你至少能随意运用手指了。终于，你从手术台上下来了。

column2:
There's a mild aching, and your entire body feels weaker. What's more, as you walk the room, steadied by the nurse, your limbs seem to move further away than you intended. 

You're told it's a sensation that will pass with time. Your muscles will adjust to the slight differences in balance, and the movement will become less unsettling.

After some time resting and working with therapists, you feel able to move again normally.

You're taken to collect your things, and you get dressed.
column3: 这有点轻微的疼痛，你的整个身体感觉更虚弱。更重要的是，当你在护士的搀扶下走进房间时，你的四肢似乎比你预想的运动地更远。你被告知这种感觉会随着时间的流逝。你的肌肉将适应平衡的细微差异，并且运动起来不会那么不自在。经过一段时间的休息和与治疗师的复健后，你感觉能够再次正常活动了。你被带去领走自己的东西，然后穿好衣服。

column2:
Patient will be screened for eligibility in heavy dermal enhancement.

If eligible, the patient will have their outer layer tissue woven with the Rose Augmentations RA:022 Synthetic Skin, which enhances the tissue with increased pain tolerance and wound recovery speed.

The RA:022 weave also induces increased keratin production, strengthening all epithelial tissues in the body. As such, it also increases environmental resistance against sickness and weak toxins.

Cost: $7500
column3: 将筛选患者是否有资格进行重度真皮增强。如果符合条件，患者的外层组织将与玫瑰增强 RA:022 合成皮肤编织在一起，从而增强组织，增加疼痛耐受性和伤口恢复速度。RA:022 编织还促使角蛋白生成增加，增强体内所有上皮组织。因此，它还增加了对疾病和弱毒素的环境抵抗力。 费用：$7500

column2:
After verifying there is no danger of synthetic rejection, you're escorted to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under general anesthesia.

The procedure will be lengthy and extremely complex, requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work will be done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature. Luckily, you'll be unconscious during this procedure.

When you wake up, you notice there's a particular mild pain. It almost feels like your whole body is being punctured with a hundred needles. This lasts for several minutes, and gets a bit more painful but as soon as you are about to mention it, the nurse is instructed to give you another dose of anesthesia. You feel relieved.

Finally, the pain and the effects of the anesthesia pass. You are screened a second time at the table.

After a brief moment, you are finally released from the operating table.
column3: 在确认没有合成排斥的风险后，你将被护送到手术室，进行液体和营养静脉注射，并置于全身麻醉下。这个过程将是漫长且极其复杂的，需要在微观尺度上对组织进行精确操作。大部分工作将通过计算机辅助远程手术电枢完成。幸运的是，在全过程中你会失去知觉。当你醒来时，你会注意到有一种特别轻微的疼痛。感觉就像你的整个身体被一百根针扎了一样。这种情况持续了几分钟，而且会变得更疼，但就在你要提起它的时候，护士就被指示给你另一剂麻醉。你感到如释重负。最后，疼痛和麻醉的效果消失了。你在手术台上进行第二次检查。片刻之后，你终于从手术台上下来了。

column2:
Your entire body feels weird. What's more, as you touch the skin around your arms and chest, you notice it feels like you are touching someone else, as you can't completely feel the touch on the enhanced skin. 

You're told it's a sensation that will pass with time. You will adjust to the slight differences in the tissue, and the skin will feel less unsettling at the touch.

After some time resting and working with therapists, you feel you are ready to go.

You're taken to collect your things, and you get dressed.
column3: 你的整个身体都感觉很奇怪。更重要的是，当您触摸手臂和胸部周围的皮肤时，你会发现感觉就像在摸其他人，因为你无法完全感受到增强后的皮肤上的触感。你被告知这种感觉会随着时间流逝。你将适应组织中的细微差异，并且在触碰皮肤时不会那么不自在。经过一段时间的休息并与治疗师一起复健后，你觉得已经准备好出发了。你被带去领走自己的东西，然后穿好衣服。

column2:
Patients who have already received the RA:024 Synthetic Muscle enhancement can have their muscles upgraded with the Rose Augmentations RA:025 Microfiber Muscle, which increases their capabilities even further.

The procedure is rather complicated and lengthy, requiring the patient to spend hours on the operation table again.

Cost: $1300
column3: 已经接受 RA:024 合成肌肉增强的患者可以使用玫瑰增强 RA:025 超细纤维肌肉来升级他们的肌肉，从而进一步提高他们的能力。该过程相当复杂和冗长，需要患者再次在手术台上花费数小时。 费用：$1300
订购超细纤维肌肉升级.

column2:
For the upgrade, you're led to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under general anesthesia.

The procedure will be lengthy and extremely complex, requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work will be done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature. Luckily, you'll be unconscious during this procedure.

When you wake up after the operation is finished, a mild pain and a number of small involuntary spasms happen as the nurse releases you from the restraints.

Finally, the spasms pass and you are able to move normally.

You are finally released from the operating room.
column3: 为了升级，你将被带到手术室，进行液体和营养静脉注射，并置于全身麻醉下。这个过程将是漫长且极其复杂的，需要在微观尺度上对组织进行精确操作。大部分工作将通过计算机辅助远程手术电枢完成。幸运的是，在全过程中你会失去知觉。当你在手术完成后醒来时，护士将你从束缚中释放，你会出现轻微的疼痛和一些不自主的小痉挛。最后，痉挛过去了，你可以正常运动了。终于你从手术室里出来了。

column2:
There's no pain at all now, and your entire body feels stronger already. You feel like you could lift that couch in the corner but the nurse in the room gives you a look, as if she read your thoughts somehow. 

You're told it's a sensation that will pass with time. Your muscles will adjust to the slight differences in balance, and the movement will feel less empowering.

After a brief time resting and working with therapists, you feel it's time to leave already.

You're taken to collect your things, and you get dressed.
column3: 现在一点都不痛了，整个人都感觉更强壮了。你觉得你可以抬起角落里的沙发，但房间里的护士看了你一眼，好像她以某种方式懂了你的想法。你被告知这种感觉会随着时间流逝。你的肌肉会适应平衡的细微差异，运动会感觉不那么费力。在短暂休息并与治疗师一起复健后，你觉得是时候离开了。你被带去领走自己的东西，然后穿好衣服。

column2:
Patients who have already received the RA:022 Synthetic Skin enhancement can have their skin upgraded with the Rose Augmentations RA:023 Dermal Lattice, which increases their capabilities even further.

The procedure is rather complicated and lengthy, requiring the patient to spend hours on the operation table again.

Cost: $1400
column3: 已经接受 RA:022 皮肤增强的患者可以使用玫瑰增强 RA:023 真皮升级他们的皮肤，从而进一步提高他们的能力。该过程相当复杂和冗长，需要患者再次在手术台上花费数小时。 费用：$1400

column2:
For the upgrade, you're led to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under general anesthesia.

The procedure will be lengthy and extremely complex, requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work will be done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature. Luckily, you'll be unconscious during this procedure.

When you wake up, you notice there's a particular mild discomfort. It almost feels like your whole body is burning slightly. This lasts for several minutes but it doesn't get worse with time, it starts to fade away. You feel relieved.

Finally, the mild effects pass and you are screened a second time at the table.

After a brief moment, you are finally released from the operating table.
column3: 对于升级，你将被带到手术室，进行液体和营养静脉注射，并置于全身麻醉下。这个过程将是漫长且极其复杂的，需要在微观尺度上对组织进行精确操作。大部分工作将通过计算机辅助远程手术电枢完成。幸运的是，在全过程中您会失去知觉。当你醒来时，你会注意到有一种特别轻微的不适。几乎感觉你的整个身体都在轻微燃烧。这会持续几分钟，这种感觉不会随着时间的推移变得更糟且开始逐渐消失。你感到如释重负。最后，轻微的影响消失了，你在手术台上第二次接受检查。片刻之后，你终于从手术台上下来了。

column2:
Your entire body feels weird. As with the previous skin enhancement, your skin feels like it belongs to someone else, as you can't completely feel the touch on the upgraded skin. 

You're told it's a sensation that will pass with time. You will adjust to the slight differences in the tissue, and the skin will feel less unsettling at the touch.

After some time resting and working with therapists, you feel you are ready to go.

You're taken to collect your things, and you get dressed.
column3: 你的整个身体都感觉很奇怪。与之前的皮肤增强一样，你的皮肤感觉像是属于别人的，因为您无法完全感受到升级后的皮肤的触感。你被告知这种感觉会随着时间流逝。你将适应组织中的细微差异，并且在触碰皮肤时不会那么不自在。经过一段时间的休息并与治疗师一起复健后，你觉得已经准备好出发了。你被带去领走自己的东西，然后穿好衣服。

column2:
Patients who have already received the RA:022 Synthetic Skin enhancement can have the Rose Augmentations RA:024 Subdermal Plating installed, which adds a synthetic armor under the skin.
			
The subdermal plating is a tough carbon filament that acts as a second skin, lying just beneath the outer layer of the RA:022 Synthetic Skin.

The procedure is rather complicated and lengthy, requiring the patient to spend hours on the operation table again.

Cost: $2200
column3: 已经接受 RA:022 合成皮肤增强的患者可以安装玫瑰增强 RA:024 皮下电镀，在皮肤下添加合成装甲。皮下镀层是一种坚韧的碳丝，充当第二层皮肤，位于 RA:022 合成皮肤的外层下方。该过程相当复杂和冗长，需要患者再次在手术台上花费数小时。 费用：$2200

column2:
For the upgrade, you're led to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under general anesthesia.

The procedure will be lengthy and extremely complex, requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work will be done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature. Luckily, you'll be unconscious during this procedure.

When you wake up, you notice there's a mild discomfort. You can actually feel the filament layer under the skin. It doesn't hurt but feeling something under your skin is a bit unsettling.

Finally, you are screened a second time and after a brief moment, you are finally released from the operating table.
column3: 对于升级，你将被带到手术室，进行液体和营养静脉注射，并置于全身麻醉下。这个过程将是漫长且极其复杂的，需要在微观尺度上对组织进行精确操作。大部分工作将通过计算机辅助远程手术电枢完成。幸运的是，在全过程中你会失去知觉。当你醒来时，你会注意到有轻微的不适。你实际上可以感觉到皮肤下的细丝层。它不痛，但感觉皮肤下有东西有点不自在。最后，你进行了第二次检查，片刻之后，您终于从手术台上下来了。

column2:
You are kept in the room for a little longer and you still can't get over how weird your entire body feels. Hopefully, it won't affect your speed or anything, right? 

You're told it's a sensation that will pass with time. You will eventually adjust to the feeling of having a second skin layer. You're also told it won't affect your agility in any way, upon asking about it.

After some time resting and working with therapists, you feel you are ready to go.

You're taken to collect your things, and you get dressed.
column3: 你在房间里呆了一会儿，你仍然无法适应整个身体的奇怪感觉。希望它不会影响你的速度或其他什么，对吧？你被告知这种感觉会随着时间流逝。最终你会适应拥有第二层皮肤的感觉。在询问时，你还被告知它不会以任何方式影响您的敏捷性。经过一段时间的休息并与治疗师一起复健后，你觉得你已经准备好出发了。你被带去领走自己的东西，你穿好了衣服。

column2:
Patient will be screened for eligibility in Artificial Lung replacement, including immunoreactivity.

If eligible, the patient will have their natural lungs removed and replaced with the Rose Augmentations RA:068 Synthetic Lungs, which work like their natural counterparts but with an extended operational lifetime, which is expected to exceed their host.

The RA:068 lungs are made of a synthetic fiber that makes them as fragile as natural ones but prevent lung related illnesses such as pneumonia.

Cost: $7500
column3: 将筛选患者是否有资格接受人工肺置换术，包括免疫反应性。如果符合条件，患者的自然肺将被移除并替换为 玫瑰增强 RA:068 合成肺，其工作方式与自然肺相似，但使用寿命更长，预计将超过其宿主。RA:068 肺由合成纤维制成，使其与天然肺一样脆弱，但可预防肺炎等肺部相关疾病。$7500

column2:
After verifying there is no danger of synthetic rejection, you're escorted to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under general anesthesia.

The procedure will be rather simple, but still requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work will be done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature. Luckily, you'll be unconscious during this procedure.

When you wake up, you notice there's this particular feeling. It almost feels like your breathing is heavier and it requires actual effort to do so. You try to take a deep breath but you instantly start coughing. The nurse in the room turns to you and instructs you just to not do that. This lasts for several minutes, but the coughing becomes less frequent as the time passes.

After a brief moment, you are finally released from the operating table.
column3: 在确认没有合成排斥的危险后，你将被护送到手术室，进行液体和营养静脉注射，并置于全身麻醉下。该过程将相当简单，但仍需要在微观尺度上对组织进行精确操作。大部分工作将通过计算机辅助远程手术电枢完成。幸运的是，在全过程中你会失去知觉。当你醒来时，你注意到有种特殊的感觉。感觉就像你的呼吸变重了，需要更用力才能做到这一点。你试着深呼吸，但你立即开始咳嗽。房间里的护士转向你并指示不要那么做。这会持续几分钟，但随着时间的推移，咳嗽的频率会降低。片刻之后，你终于从手术台上下来了。

column2:
Even though it is less frequent, the coughing still persists. The nurse hands you a glass of water, which you immediately proceed to chug down. It helps a bit.

You're told the coughing is normal and will pass with time. You should adjust to the heavy breathing sensation in a week or so.

After some time resting and working with therapists, you feel you are ready to go.

You're taken to collect your things, and you get dressed.
column3: 尽管频率降低了，但仍然有在继续咳嗽。护士递给你一杯水，你立刻喝了下去。这有点帮助。你被告知咳嗽是正常的，并且会随着时间而消失。你应该在一周左右的时间内适应沉重的呼吸感。经过一段时间的休息并与治疗师一起复健后，你觉得你已经准备好出发了。你被带去领走自己的东西，你穿好了衣服。

column2: You feel something scurrying away from you!
column3: 你觉得有什么东西从你身边匆匆离开!

column2: You feel something scurrying away from you!
column3: 你觉得有什么东西从你身边匆匆离开!

column2: Use knowledge of plants to find better plant-based loot.
column3: 利用植物知识更好地找到植物战利品。
蔓延者对话(红色连帽衫，无对话)

column2:
"Get away from me, freak!" the sprawler cries from the distance.

You decide to just leave.
column3: "离我远点，怪胎!" 蔓延者从远处哭喊。你决定离开。
医疗保健近视矫正眼镜 - $150

column2:
Patient will receive a pair of glasses with myopia correction lens specifically made for their eyes.

Cost: $150
column3: 患者将获得一副专门为他们的眼睛设计的带有近视矫正镜片的眼镜。 费用：$150

column2: "Very well. The dispensary should have it prepared any minute now."
column3: "很好。药房应该马上就能准备好。"

column2:
As you make your way to one of the huge structures you saw from the distance, you notice this one is fashioned of stacked, rusted shipping containers and heavily guarded. You see emaciated people in threadbare coats around the structure, but the guards don’t seem to pay them any mind. People carrying boxes exit the structure through a doorway on one side so you decide to use it to enter. 

When you step inside, you notice some of the people scattered around the place survey you but they quickly lose interest and go back to minding their own business. This is a bazaar, it seems. Most of the traders seem to be covered in grease, blood, mud, or all three and the air is thick with the acrid smell of burned electronics and overcooked barbecue.

This is ZZ's trading post, the sketchiest swap meet this side of the Mississippi. 

Pick up items to purchase them, or drop items to sell them.
column3: 当你前往从远处看到的巨大建筑之一时，您会注意到它是由堆叠的、生锈的集装箱制成的，并且戒备森严。你会在建筑物周围看到穿着破旧外套的憔悴的人，但守卫似乎并不在意他们。携带箱子的人通过一侧的门口离开结构，因此您决定使用它进入。当你走进去时，你注意到一些分散在周围的人在打量你，但他们很快就对你没了兴趣，并回到自己的事情上。这似乎是一个集市。似乎大多数交易者身上沾满了油渍、血迹、泥巴，或者三者皆有，空气中弥漫着烧焦的电器和烤过头的烧烤的刺鼻气味。这是僵僵交易站，密西西比河这最简陋的交易点。拿起物品来购买它们，或者放下物品来出售它们。

column2: You head down one of the crowded aisles...
column3: 你走进其中一条拥挤的过道...

column2:
Hardware/Software:
If hardware/software is not switched on and unlocked, vendors will only pay the hardware's value as if it were empty.

Items in Containers:
If you can't afford the items inside a container, you are not allowed to pick the container up. Also, you can only empty out items you can afford from the containers.

Unidentified Items:
Vendors will only pay a nominal fee for unidentified items, no question asked.

Store Availability:
There will be times the trading post will be closed to the public for an entire day. Vendors will resume activities the next day so it's advised not to leave items in the area.

When in doubt, verify the vendor's purchase price before surrendering items to them. All sales final!
column3: 硬件/软件：如果硬件/软件没有打开和解锁，供应商只会支付硬件的价值，就好像它是空的一样。容器中的物品：如果你买不起容器内的物品，则不允许拿起容器。此外，你只能从容器中清空你负担得起的物品。不明物品：供应商只会为未辨别的物品支付象征性的费用，这毫无疑问。商店工作性:有时交易站将对外关闭一整天。小贩们将在第二天恢复活动，所以建议不要在该地区留下物品。如果有疑问，在把物品交给小贩之前，先核实他们的购买价格。一律概不退换!

column2: Gathering your things, you exit the structure and set out into the wilderness beyond.
column3: 收拾好你的东西，你离开了建筑并向远处的荒野前进。

column2:
You are inside the structure of stacked, rusted shipping containers used as a trading post.

You notice some of the people scattered around the place survey you but they quickly lose interest and go back to minding their own business. Most of the traders seem to be covered in grease, blood, mud, or all three and the air is thick with the acrid smell of burned electronics and overcooked barbecue.

This is ZZ's trading post, the sketchiest swap meet this side of the Mississippi.
column3: 你在堆叠的生锈的集装箱结构内，这些集装箱被用作贸易站。当你走进去时，你注意到一些分散在周围的人在打量你，但他们很快就对你没了兴趣，并回到自己的事情上。似乎大多数交易者身上沾满了油渍、血迹、泥巴，或者三者皆有，空气中弥漫着烧焦的电器和烤过头的烧烤的刺鼻气味。这是僵僵交易站，密西西比河这最简陋的交易点。

column2: Gathering your things, you exit the structure and set out into the sprawl.
column3: 收拾好你的东西, 你离开了建筑并向荒野前进。

column2:
You are inside a structure fashioned of shipping containers.

You can see a thriving bazaar where people trade scavenged items in the light of a thousand lanterns and bug zappers. The air is thick with sweat, smoke, and the smell of barbecue and spices.

This is the Sprawl's notorious Junk Market.
column3: 你在一个由集装箱组成的建筑里。你可以看到一个繁荣的集市，人们在上千盏灯笼和去虫灵的灯光下交易捡来的物品。空气中弥漫着汗水、烟雾、烤肉还有香料的味道。这是延展区臭名昭著的垃圾市场。
搜刮一辆废弃的消防车

column2:
You approach the abandoned fire truck you spotted some distance away. It's hard to miss so it's probably been searched and looted more than once.

Can't hurt to take a look.
column3: 你靠近了在远处发现的废弃消防车。它太显眼了，所以这可能不止一次被搜刮和抢掠了。看看也无妨。

column2:
As you are about to leave the market, a hooded figure aproaches you.

"You must leave now, or there will be trouble for all of us." he whispers as he goes past you, vanishing from sight between the crowd.

You look around as you gather yourself and notice some folk staring at you. You suddenly realize what you just did. Of course selling DMC equipment is trouble here! Things could go wrong really fast...
column3: 当你正要离开市场时，一个戴兜帽的人向你走来。"你必须马上离开，否则我们会有麻烦的。" 他从你身边走过时低声说着，消失在人群中。你聚精会神地环顾四周，发现有些人在盯着你看。你突然意识到你刚刚做了什么。在这里卖DMC装备当然会有麻烦!事情可能很快就会变糟...

column2:
You decide to take the hooded man's advice and leave the market, at least for three days or more.

As you walk back to the exit, you start to feel like your are being watched so you hasten your pace.
column3: 你决定接受兜帽男子的建议，离开市场至少三天或更久。当你走回出口时，你开始觉得有人在监视你，所以你加快了步伐。

column2:
As you make your way around the sprawl trying to get your bearings, you hear a commotion. Something is wrong...
			
"Drones!" someone shouts in the distance. "It's the cops, a lot of them!" you hear as everyone starts to run and scatter.

This is clearly some sort of raid or ambush and you know they are here for you. You quickly feel surrounded as you start hearing radio chatter from all directions.
column3: 当你在杂乱的人群中穿行，并试图确定你的位置时，你听到一阵骚动。有什么不对劲…… "无人机!"远处有人喊道。"是条子，很多条子!" 你听到每个人都开始奔跑散开。这显然是某种突袭或伏击，你知道他们是为你而来的。当你开始听到来自四面八方的无线电通讯时，你感到很快要被包围了。

column2:
As soon as you step forward, you hear something open with a creaking sound. You then hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You back away and brace yourself as you realize something is coming for you.
column3: 刚踏前一步，就听到有什么东西打开了，发出咯吱咯吱的声音。然后你听到脚步声在向你快速接近。你意识到有什么东西要来了，不过你已经退后并做好准备。

column2:
As soon as you step forward, you hear noise coming from different locations. You then hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You back away and brace yourself as you realize you are being ambushed.
column3: 你刚踏前一步，就能听到来自不同位置的声响。然后你听到了快速向你跑来的脚步声。当你意识到自己被伏击时，你向后退并做好准备。

column2:
There is little left to explore in this burnt, toxic swamp. This particular barren field, however, is littered with old remains of past scavengers.

Getting to them, however, is going to be a trick. There's caustic liquid pools here and there, and there might be traps deployed to protect hidden caches.

The good news? You suspect little scavenging competition in this blasted swamp.
column3: 在这片燃烧殆尽的毒沼泽中，几乎没什么可探索的了。然而，这片特别贫瘠的土地上还散落着过去拾荒者的遗骸。然而，要接近它们会很冒险。到处都有腐蚀性液体池，并且可能有保护陷阱部署在隐藏储存点。好消息呢?你怀疑这该死的沼泽里几乎没有其他拾荒者跟你抢。

column2:
There is little left to explore in this burnt, toxic swamp. However, you spot a vehicle from a distance. It's clearly damaged on the outside but it seems the interior is intact, preserved, even.

Unfortunately, it's in the middle of a caustic liquid pool so getting to it might be tricky.

The good news? There's rocks and rotten planks over them leading to it... maybe someone tried to get to it at some point? It could be a trap too.
column3: 在这片烧焦的有毒沼泽里，几乎没什么可探索的了。然而，你从远处发现了一辆车。它的表面明显受损但里面似乎挺完整，甚至完好如初。不幸的是，它位于腐蚀性液体池的中央，所以要到它那可能很棘手。好消息呢?这有腐烂的木板在岩石上通往那……也许有人曾经试图接近过它?也可能是陷阱。

column2: <us> is heading just outside the sprawl and is about to end their shift.
column3: <us> 正前往城郊并即将结束他们的行动。

column2: <us> is heading just outside Zom Zom's and is about to end their shift.
column3: <us> 正前往僵僵镇外并即将结束他们的行动。

column2: <us> arrived near the ATN enclave and is ending their shift.
column3: <us> 到达 ATN 飞地附近，并结束他们的行动。

column2: <us> is a pilgrim that arrived at Saginaw and will inspire Blue Frogs to take action.
column3: <us> 是一位抵达萨吉诺的朝圣者，他将鼓舞蓝蛙实施行动。

column2: <us> is a pilgrim that inspired a Blue Frog Preacher to go out and spread the word.
column3: <us> 出发朝圣并启发了一位蓝蛙传教士外出四处布教。

column2: <us> is a pilgrim that inspired a couple of Blue Frog Cultists to go out and wander the wilderness.
column3: <us> 出发朝圣并启发了几个蓝蛙教徒漫步荒野。

column2: <us> is deciding where to spread the word of the Blue Frog cult.
column3: <us> 正决定在哪里布道蓝蛙邪教。

column2: <us> is heading towards the ATN to spread the word of the Blue Frog cult.
column3: <us> 正前往 ATN 布道蓝蛙邪教。
蓝蛙, 到 僵僵镇

column2: <us> is heading towards Zom Zom's to spread the word of the Blue Frog cult.
column3: <us> 正前往僵僵镇布道蓝蛙邪教。

column2: <us> is heading towards the DMC to spread the word of the Blue Frog cult.
column3: <us> 正前往 DMC 布道蓝蛙邪教。

column2: <us> arrived to the DMC gates and is ending their shift.
column3: <us> 到达 DMC 大门并结束他们的行动。

column2: <us> arrived to Zom Zom's and is ending their shift.
column3: <us> 到达僵僵镇并结束他们的行动。

column2:
You approach the trader outside. He notices you and nods as you close in.

Pick up items to purchase them, or drop items to sell them.
column3: 你走近外面的商人。当你靠近他时，他注意到了你并点点头。拿起物品购买它们，或放下物品出售它们。

column2:
Inside, you see wooden baskets and crates with flour, charcoal, produce and other general goods. You soon realize it's fairly cold in here. The trader soon joins you.


The goods are sold in "bulk" here and prices are high.
column3: 在里面，你看到装着面粉、木炭、农产品和普通商品的木篮和板条箱。你很快就发觉这里相当冷。商人很快就来接待你了。商品是 "散装" 出售的并且价格很高。

column2:
You ask for wood planks. There are many lying in a corner.

The trader grabs the eight and leaves them by the entrance.


"I hope you have a cart with you. Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你想要木板。有许多平放在角落里。商人抱起8块并将它们留在入口处。"我希望你有一辆手推车。还需要什么吗?" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
You point at one of the many bags of charcoal lying in a basket.

The trader nods and grabs the one you pointed at and leaves it by the entrance.


"Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你指着放在篮子里的许多木炭袋中的一袋。商人点点头，抓住你指着的那个，把它留在了入口处。"还需要什么吗？" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
You ask for mushrooms. The trader grabs a flour bag and starts filling it with mushrooms from a wooden crate next to him.

He soon finishes and leaves it by the entrance.


"Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你想要蘑菇。商人抓起一个面粉袋，开始从他旁边的木箱里装蘑菇。他很快就装满了，并把它留在了入口处。"还需要什么吗?" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
You ask for carrots. The trader calls one of the people working there and signals them to grab a bag. She nods and leaves it on one of the pallets on the ground.


"There you go," the trader says as he walks to a group of workers to order them around.
column3: 你想要胡萝卜。商人喊在那工作的人并示意去拿一袋来。她点了点头，将它放在地上的一个托盘上。"拿好," 这位交易员边说边走到一群工人面前监督他们干活。

column2:
You ask for eggs. You can already see them just behind him. The trader turns and grabs one of the egg boxes stacked behind him. Some of the boxes are open, so you spot most of them seem to be chicken eggs but there are a few that seem to be from other sources.

The trader opens the box he grabbed for you and checks if all eggs are ok, then closes it. He leaves the egg box by the entrance once finished.


"Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你想要蛋。你已经能看到它们就在他的身后。商人转过身，拿起身后堆着的一个鸡蛋盒。有些盒子是打开的，所以你发现大部分似乎都是鸡蛋，但也有少数好像来自其它来源。商人打开为你拿来的盒子，检查所有的鸡蛋是否都是好的，然后关上盒子。最后他把蛋盒留在入口处。"还需要什么吗?" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
You ask for berries. The trader grabs a flour bag and walks towards a basket containing both black and red berries.

He sinks the bag in the berries and then continues to add handfuls until the amount needed is reached. He then lifts the bag and leaves it by the entrance.


"Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你想要浆果。商人抓起一个面粉袋，走向一个装有黑色和红色浆果的篮子。他把袋子铺在浆果上，然后继续一把一把地装进去，直到装够所需的量。然后他提起袋子，将它放在入口处。"还需要什么吗?" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
As soon as you enter the building, you hear the noise of food cans, echoing in the building. You look down... a trip wire.

You soon hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You brace yourself as you realize you fell into a trap.
column3: 你一进入建筑，就听到食品罐头的响声在大楼里回荡。你往脚下看……有绊线。你听到脚步声在向你快速接近。当你意识到自己被伏击时，你已经做好准备。

column2:
As soon as you force the door open, a vehicle alarm goes off.

This catches you off guard. This vehicle has been abandoned for years, it's impossible for its alarm to go off... unless.

You brace yourself as you realize you triggered a trap.
column3: 当你强行打开车门时，汽车警报就响了。这让你猝不及防。这辆车已经废弃多年了，它的警报器不可能响起…除非。当意识到你触发了一个陷阱时，你做好准备。

column2:
As soon as you force the door open, a vehicle alarm goes off.

This catches you off guard. This vehicle has been abandoned for years, it's impossible for its alarm to go off... unless.

You brace yourself as you realize you triggered a trap.
column3: 当你强行打开车门时，汽车警报就响了。这让你猝不及防。这辆车已经废弃多年了，它的警报器不可能响起…除非。当意识到你触发了一个陷阱时，你做好准备。

column2:
Just as you walk around a corner, you notice a number of buildings and streets encased within crude barricades. It seems this compound of sorts stretches around a large portion of this town.

There are no patrols or guards in sight. The compound looks deserted but you have the feeling this is definitely not the case. You slowly walk towards one of the buildings being used as wall and look inside a window. The room inside is dark but you can see there's no furniture inside, just more barricades.

As you walk by the makeshift wall, maybe hoping for an easy entrance, you can't shake the feeling you are being watched. Eventually, you come across something that resembles a gate but it's closed and locked tight.

You weight your options.
column3: 当你走到拐角处时，你注意到许多建筑和街道被简陋的路障围着。似乎这种类型的建筑群环绕着这个城镇的大部分地区。这里没有巡逻队或警卫。这个围场看起来很冷清，但你感觉情况绝非这样的。你慢慢走向其中一栋被用墙围住的建筑，向窗户里看。里面的房间很暗，但你可以看到里面没有家具，只有更多的路障。当你走过这堵临时搭建的墙时，也许希望能轻松进入，但你无法摆脱被监视的感觉。最后，你来到一个类似门的东西前，但它是关闭并锁紧的。你权衡你的选择。

column2:
You stand, yet again, outside the makeshift compound encased within crude barricades.

Everything is still eerily quiet. The gate, still closed and locked tight, towers over you.

You weight your options.
column3: 你再一次站在被简陋路障围起来的临时围场外。一切依旧出奇地安静。大门仍然关闭并紧紧地锁着，耸立在你的上方。你权衡你的选择。

column2:
Deciding to try the least hostile option you can think of, you call out towards the compound.

In return, you get nothing. You try again but the echo of your own voice is all you get back.
column3: 决定尝试你能想到的最不具敌意的选择，你对着围场大喊。你得不到任何回应。你又试一次，但你只得到自己声音的回声。

column2:
As you run out of options or simply not wanting to try anything else, you start to walk backwards while looking at windows and rooftops for any type of sign.
			
Nothing. You finally turn around and make your way to the wilderness, away from the compound.
column3: 当你别无选择，或者只是不想尝试其他方法时，你开始往后走，同时观察窗户和屋顶上是否有任何类型的标志。什么也没。最后你转过身，离开围场并向荒野走去。

column2: Force your way past the barricades.

Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

As soon as you start to pry open one of the barricades, you hear running behind you. You react and quickly turn around, ready to fight whatever is coming for you.
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。你刚开始撬开其中一个路障。你就听到身后有奔跑声。你迅速转身作出反应并准备与任何为你而来的东西战斗。

column2:
You blink. A horrible headache suddenly assaults you. You blink several times more but everything stays blurry. Confused and in pain, you realize you are inside a room, sitting and tied to a chair.

Eventually, your vision starts to get better. You look around. A hooded figure stands guard next to a window, armed with a shotgun. He pays little attention to you.

You try to look up but you hit your head on a wooden surface, ow. There's a pillar behind you, and you are tied to that, not the chair.
column3: 一眨眼的功夫。剧烈的头痛就突然袭来。你又眨了几次眼，但一切都变得模糊。在疑惑和痛苦中回过神来，你已在某个房间里绑在椅子上坐着。终于，你的视力开始好转。你环顾四周。一个戴着兜帽、手持猎枪的人站在窗户旁。他不怎么注意你。你试着抬起头，但你的头撞到了木质表面，哎哟。你身后有根柱子，你被绑在柱子上，而不是椅子。

column2:
Several minutes pass. You still feel dizzy but the sudden sound of keys and then someone unlocking a door behind you wakes you up from your current state.
			
Whoever is behind you is taking their sweet time, and a sense of anxiety is starting to take hold of you.

The guard in front of you stands in a less relaxed manner now and you see him throw some subtle hand movements before gripping his weapon and focusing his attention on you.
column3: 几分钟过去了。你仍然感到迷迷糊糊，但突然传来开锁的声音，然后有人在你身后开门并将你惊醒。无论你身后的人是谁，他们都在不慌不忙地等待着，一种焦虑感开始占据你的心。你面前的守卫现在站得不那么放松了，你看到他做出一些微妙的手部动作，然后握紧他的武器，将注意力集中在你身上。

column2:
"Welcome to Lakeview Arbor, mate... who are you and why are you here?" A voice behind you asks.
			
Before you can even answer, however, he continues. "We don't take kindly to strangers messing with our walls," he says, as you hear him pace from one side of the room to the other.

"This area is home to all kinds of dangerous critters yet you came here alone," he states. "So... who are you and why are you here?"
column3: "欢迎来到湖景树丛，伙计……你是谁，为什么来这里?？"一个声音在你身后问道。然而，在你还没来得及回答之前，他继续说。"我们不喜欢陌生人乱弄我们的墙," 他说，你听到他从房间的一边踱步到另一边。"这片地区是各种危险生物的定居地，而你却独自一人来这," 他说。"那么... 你到底是谁，为什么来这里?"

column2:
"Philip," you quickly answer, resting your head on the pillar. "Philip Kindred."
			
The guard stares at the interrogator for a long second and then back at you. "Well then, Philip. Why were you trying to get in here?" the voice asks.
column3: "菲利普,"你迅速回答，把头靠在柱子上。"菲利普金狄。"警卫盯着审讯者看了很长时间，然后转身看着你。"那么，菲利普。你为什么要试图进来？" 那声音问到。

column2:
"Philip," you quickly answer, resting your head on the pillar. "Philip Kindred."
			
The guard stares at the interrogator for a second and nods. "Well then, Philip. What's the business with this cryo facility adress mentioned in here?" the voice asks as the hospital wrist strap you woke up with lands on your lap.
column3: "菲利普,"你迅速回答，把头靠在柱子上。"菲利普 金狄。"警卫盯着审讯者看了一会儿并点了点头。"那么，菲利普。这里提到的冷冻设备地址是做什么的?" 当你醒来时戴着的医院腕带落在你的腿上时，那个声音问道。

column2: Be vague about who you are.

"I'm just a scavenger," you answer, avoiding the gaze of the guard. "I was just looking for scraps," you finish.
			
The guard stares at you for a second and throws some hand signals, still looking at you. "Alright, 'just a scavenger'," the voice mocks, "Why were you trying to get in here?"
column3: "我只是个拾荒者," 你回答并避开警卫的目光。"我只是在找废品," 你说完。警卫盯着你看了一会儿并做了一些手势，仍然看着你。"行吧, '就捡破烂的'," 声音嘲讽道, "为什么来这里?"

column2:
"I am Isaac Hall," you answer, avoiding the gaze of the guard. "Isaac Hall," you repeat.
			
The guard stares at you for a long second and throws some hand signals, still looking at you. "Alright, 'Isaac Hall'," the voice mocks, "Tell me, then. Why were you trying to get in here?"
column3: "我是艾萨克·霍尔," 你回答并避开守卫的目光。"艾萨克·霍尔," 你再次重复道。警卫盯着你看了很久并做了一些手势，仍然看着你。"行吧, '艾萨克·霍尔'," 声音嘲讽道, "那就告诉我。你为什么要试图进来?"

column2:
"I am Isaac Hall," you answer, avoiding the gaze of the guard. "Isaac Hall," you repeat.
			
The guard stares at you for a long second and throws some hand signals, still looking at you. "That so? What's this, then?" the interrogator asks as he circles forward and throws something at your lap. You manage to see the interrogator but he's wearing a hood as well.

You look down. It's the hospital wrist strap you woke up with. You raise your head, the guard intently looking at you. "Alright, you got me," you concede. "My name is Philip. Philip Kindred."

"Well then, Philip. What's the business with this cryo facility adress mentioned in here?" the voice asks.
column3: "我是艾萨克·霍尔," 你回答并避开守卫的目光。"艾萨克·霍尔," 你再次重复道。警卫盯着你看了很久并做了一些手势，仍然看着你。"这样吗?那这是什么?" 审讯者一边问一边绕过来，把什么东西扔到你腿上。你设法瞄了眼审讯者，但他也戴着兜帽。你往下看。这是你醒来时戴着的医院腕带。你抬起头，警卫目不转睛地看着你。"好吧，被你发现了," 你承认道."我叫菲利普。菲利普 金狄。" "那么，菲利普。这里提到的冷冻设备地址是做什么的?" 那个声音问道。

column2:
"I guess I'm a looter," you answer. "I know my way around mechanical locks and I can run faster than most," you explain.
			
The guard looks at the interrogator and tilts his head, doing some movements with his eyes. "Well, you certainly look like one," the interrogator spits.
column3: "我想我是个劫掠者," 你回答道。"我对机械锁了如指掌，而且我跑得比大多数人都快," 你解释道。警卫看着审讯者，歪着头并用眼睛做了一些动作。"嗯，你看起来确实像," 审讯者啐了口唾沫。

column2:
"I guess I'm a handyman," you answer. "I can repair and create useful items using scrap," you explain.
			
The guard looks at the interrogator and bobs his head. "Well, that actually sounds pretty useful," the interrogator states.
column3: "我想我是个杂工," 你回答道。"我能用废料修复和创造有用的物品," 你解释道。警卫看着审讯者并点了点头。"嗯，这上听起来很有实际帮助," 审讯者说。

column2:
"Just a scavenger, yes," you answer. "The place looked deserted so I thought I could just get in," you explain.
			
The guard looks at you and tilts his head. He then raises his gaze and stares at the interrogator. "A scavenger, you say?" the interrogator asks in a mocking manner. "Real scavengers usually carry more than just a crowbar," he states.
column3: "只是一个拾荒者, 没错," 你回答道."这个地方看起来空无一人，所以我想我可以进去," 你解释道。警卫歪着头看着你。然后他抬了抬眼盯着审讯者。"一个拾荒者, 你说?" 审讯者嘲讽地问道。"真正的拾荒者通常携带的不仅仅是撬棍," 他说道。

column2:
"I guess I'm a tinkerer," you answer. "I'm a mechanic, electrician and a hacker," you explain.
			
The guard looks at the interrogator and bobs his head. "Well, that actually sounds pretty damn useful," the interrogator states.
column3: "我想我是一个修补匠," 你回答道。"我是机械师、电工和黑客," 你解释道。警卫看着审讯者并点了点头。"嗯，这上听起来很有实际帮助," 审讯者说。

column2:
"Hold on," the interrogator interrupts as you are about to answer. "You look nothing like a random survivor, mate. In fact, you look like one of those cannibalistic fucks that live south of here," the interrogator spits.
			
The guard stares at you for a moment. He then raises his eyes to look at the interrogator and shakes his head slowly.

"We have killed many of you up here," he warns. "The only reason you are still alive is because this this the first time we caugh one of you alive."
column3: "等等," 当你正要回答时，审讯者打断了你。"你看起来一点都不像幸存者，伙计。事实上，你看起来就像住在南边的那些吃人的混蛋之一。," 审讯者啐了口唾沫。守卫盯着你看了一会儿。然后他抬眼看着审讯者，缓缓摇头。"我们在这里杀了很多你的同伴," 他警告道。"你还活着的唯一原因是因为这是我们第一次活捉你们。"

column2:
"I am a mercenary," you answer with confidence. "I do small jobs for enclaves and the DMC," you explain.
			
You look at the guard. He seems to be staring at something in the distance. He then nods and looks at the interrogator. "So, a merc?" the interrogator muses.
column3: "我是名雇佣兵," 你自信地回答。"我为飞地人和底特律人干些小活," 你解释道。你看着那警卫。他似乎在注视着远处的什么东西。然后他看向审讯者并点了点头。"所以, 一个佣兵?" 审讯者沉思着。

column2:
"I am just a drifter," you answer. "I travel around from place to place, just trying to survive," you explain.
			
The guard looks at you and bobs his head. He then raises his gaze and stares at the interrogator. "A drifter?" the interrogator repeats.
column3: "我只是一个流浪者," 你回答道。"为了活着，我四处漂泊," 你解释道 警卫看着你并摇了摇头。然后他抬眼看着审讯者。"流浪汉?"审讯者重复道。

column2:
"I am a survivalist," you answer with confidence. "I can survive on my own in the wilderness for a long time," you explain.
			
The guard looks at you and bobs his head. He then raises his gaze and stares at the interrogator. "A survivalist?" the interrogator repeats.
column3: "我是个生存专家," 你自信地回答。"我可以在荒野中独自生存很长时间," 你解释道。警卫看着你并摇了摇头。然后他抬眼看着审讯者。"生存专家?" 审讯者重复道。

column2:
"I guess, I'm a hunter," you answer. "I know how to track and butcher game," you explain.
			
The guard looks at you and tilts his head. He then raises his gaze and stares at the interrogator. "Hmm... well, those are skills useful of other types of game, too," the interrogator states.
column3: "我想我是一个猎人," 你答道。"我知道如何追踪和宰杀," 你解释道。警卫看着你并摇了摇头。然后他抬眼看着审讯者。"嗯... 很好, 这些技能也不止能用于猎捕动物上," 审讯者说。

column2: Tell them about the Gyges cryo facility.
column3: 告诉他们有关 盖吉兹 冷冻设施的信息.

column2:
You take a big breath. You begin explaining your situation, starting with the cryo facility, your amnesia, and how you reached this place.
			
The guard looks at you for a second and then stares at the interrogator for a moment. He then has what appears to be a hand signal conversation with the interrogator.

"Well, that's quite the tale, mate. We might send an expedition there. Definitely sounds like an interesting place," the interrogator considers.

"Alright, so what's your business these days?" he asks, as you hear him continue his pacing.
column3: 你深吸一口气。你开始解释你的情况，从冷冻设施开始，你的失忆，以及你是如何到达这里的。警卫看了你一会儿，然后盯着审讯者看了一会儿。然后，他似乎用手势与审讯者交流。"很好，那真是精彩，伙计。我们会派一支探险队去那里。听起来那绝对是个有趣的地方," 审讯者考虑道。"好吧，你这些天在忙什么?" 他问道，你听到他在继续踱步。

column2: Be vague about who you are.

"I'm just a scavenger," you answer, avoiding the gaze of the guard. "I was just looking for scraps," you finish.
			
The guard stares at you for a second and throws some hand signals, still looking at you. "Alright, 'just a scavenger'," the voice mocks, "I'm guessing this is you, right?" the interrogator asks as he circles forward and throws something at your lap. You manage to see the interrogator but he's wearing a hood as well.

You look down. It's the hospital wrist strap you woke up with. You raise your head, the guard intently looking at you. "Alright, yeah," you concede. "That's me. Philip Kindred."

"Well then, Philip. What's the business with this cryo facility adress mentioned in here?" the voice asks.
column3: "我只是个拾荒者," 你回答并避开警卫的目光。"我只是在找废品," 你说完。警卫盯着你看了一会儿并做了一些手势，仍然看着你。"行吧, '就捡破烂的'," 声音嘲讽道, "我猜这是你的，对吧?" 审讯者一边问一边绕过来，把什么东西扔到你腿上。你设法瞄了眼审讯者，但他也戴着兜帽。你往下看。这是你醒来时戴着的医院腕带。你抬起头，警卫目不转睛地看着你。"啊对，没错," 你承认道。"那是我。菲利普 金狄。" "那么，菲利普。这里提到的冷冻设备地址是做什么的?" 那声音问道。

column2: Explain you killed one in self defense.
column3: 说明你在自卫中杀了一个。

column2:
"I had to kill one of them. They call themselves Bad Muthas." you explain. "I've tried to reason with them but it's no use," you finish.
			
The guard gives you an stare, giving you more time to continue. "Alright, yeah. Clothing is in short supply in the wilderness," you explain.

You hear a loud, annoyed sigh behind you. "What's your business here? Just scavenging?"
column3: "我不得不杀死其中一个。他们称自己为摇滚帮。" 你解释道。"我试过跟他们讲道理，但没用，" 你说完。警卫给了你一个眼神，让你有更多的时间继续。"没错，你瞧。野外可没多少衣服," 你解释道。你听到身后响亮而恼怒的叹息声。"你在这里做什么？只是拾荒么？"

column2: Explain you killed one in self defense.
column3: 说明你在自卫中杀了一个。

column2:
"I had to kill one of them," you explain. "I've tried to reason with them but it was no use," you finish.
			
The guard gives you an stare, giving you more time to continue. "Alright, yeah. Clothing is in short supply in the wilderness," you explain.

You hear a loud, annoyed sigh behind you. "What's your business here? Just scavenging?"
column3: "我不得不杀死其中一个," 你解释道."我试过跟他们讲道理，但没用," 你说完。警卫给了你一个眼神，让你有更多的时间继续。"没错，你瞧。野外可没多少衣服," 你解释道。你听到身后响亮而恼怒的叹息声。"你在这里做什么？只是拾荒么？"
说明你是捡到了这些衣服。

column2:
"Oh, these? I scavenged these pieces," you explain. "I had no idea dressing a certain way would cause problems," you finish.
			
The guard gives you an stare for a moment. He then looks at the interrogator and slowly shakes his head.

You hear a loud, annoyed sigh behind you. "What's your business here? Just scavenging?"
column3: "哦，这些？是我搜刮得来的衣服，" 你解释道。"我不知道这么穿会有这种问题，" 你说完。守卫盯着你看了一会儿。然后他抬眼看着审讯者，缓缓摇头。你听到身后响亮而恼怒的叹息声。"你在这里做什么？只是拾荒么？"

column2:
"I'm a medic," you answer. "I can properly deal with wounds and, as a plus, I know what the fancy words in pill bottles mean," you joke.
			
The guard looks at the interrogator and bobs his head. "Well, that actually sounds pretty damn useful," the interrogator states.
column3: "我是名医生," 你回答道。"我能妥善处理伤口，而且，我还知道药瓶里那些花哨的字眼是什么意思," 你开玩笑道。警卫看着审讯者并点了点头。"嗯，这上听起来很有实际帮助," 审讯者说。

column2:
"I guess, I'm a fighter," you answer. "It's the main reason I made it here alive," you state.
			
The guard looks at the interrogator and bobs his head. "Yeah, we can tell that. It's why we used extra rope to tie you down," the interrogator jokes.
column3: "我想我是一名战士," 你回答道。"这是我能活着来这的主要原因," 你说完。警卫看着审讯者并摇了摇头。"是的，我们能看出来。所以我们用了更多的绳子来绑住你," 审讯者开玩笑道。

column2: Tell them to let you go.

"You know what? Fuck this," you quickly blurt out, looking at the guard in the eyes. You ask them to let you go and that you will not cause any trouble.
			
The guard shakes his head in disapointment and then nods at the interrogator. "Well then, mate. We will actually let you go this time but never come back here again, you hear?" the interrogator commands as he puts a bag over your head.

"If you do, we will blow your head off," he warns as you hear him open the door. They make you walk from room to room, then you climb down stairs. Eventually you reach outside, the familiar weather and the sound of desolation greet you as they make you walk away from the compound. The bag is removed and you turn as your eyes adjust. You see your escorts moving away, some of them dissapearing around street corners and buildings. They all wear potato bag hoods but you recognize the guard from the interrogation room.

You find yourself alone in the ruins. You take a big breath and prepare to face the wilderness.
column3: "你知道吗？去他妈的," 你迅速脱口而出，看着警卫的眼睛。你要求他们放你离开，这样你不会引起任何麻烦。警卫失望地摇了摇头，然后向审讯者点头。"那好吧，伙计。这次我们会放你走，但不要再回来了，懂吗?" 审讯者一边将袋子套在你头上一边命令道。"如果你再来，我们会把你脑袋给炸了," 当你听到他开门时警告道。他们让你从一个房间走到另一个房间，然后你爬下楼梯。最后你到外面了，熟悉的天气和荒凉的声音迎面而来，他们让你远离围场。袋子被取下，你适应好自己的眼睛。你看到你的护送者离开了，他们中的一些人消失在街角和建筑周围。他们都戴着土豆袋兜帽但你还是认出了审讯室的警卫。你发现自己孤零零地在废墟上。你深吸一口气并做好面对荒野的准备。

column2:
"The place looked deserted. I thought nobody was here," you explain. "I'm running low on resources," you finish.
			
The guard gives you an stare. "Right, so a boarded up town with a huge gate looked pretty promising," the interrogator spits.

You hear a loud, annoyed sigh behind you. "Alright, mate. What's your business here? Just scavenging?"
column3: "这个地方看起来很冷清。我以为没人在这里," 你解释道。"我没多少资源," 你说道.警卫看了你一会。"是啊，所以一个有大门的封闭城镇看起来很有希望," 审讯者啐了口唾沫。你听到身后响亮而恼怒的叹息."好吧，伙计。你在这里做什么？只是拾荒？"

column2: Explain you were trying to hide.

"I was running away from something. This place looked like it could be safe," you explain. "I'm running low on resources so hiding was my best option," you finish.
			
The guard bobs his head and makes a signal with his hand. "This area is pretty dangrous alright, I can understand that," the interrogator says.

You hear a loud, annoyed sigh behind you. "Alright, mate. What's your business? Just a scavenger?"
column3: "我在逃避某些东西。这个地方看起来挺安全," 你解释道。"我没多少资源，所以躲起来是我的最佳选择," 你说完。警卫摇了摇头并用手做了个手势。"这片区域确实很危险好吧，我能理解," 审讯者说道。你听到身后响亮而恼怒的叹息."好吧，伙计。你在这里做什么？只是拾荒？"

column2:
"I guess, I'm just a traveler," you answer. "I'm used to walk long distances and explore locations," you state.
			
The guard looks at the interrogator and bobs his head. "Yeah, you kinda look like one," the interrogator says.
column3: "我想我是一个旅行者," 你回答道。"我习惯长途跋涉," 你说完。警卫看着审讯者并摇了摇头。"是啊，你挺像他们，" 审讯者说道。

column2:
You see the guard adopting a more confortable stance. The interrogator steps forward and receives the shotgun from the guard. "Welcome to Lakeview Arbor, Philip," the guard says.
			
Both men remove their hoods and the interrogator begins to untie your bindings. "Sorry about this but we don't get visitors often, and when we do, they usually shoot first and we end up putting them down," he explains.

"By the way, name's Morgan," he says as he gives your belongings back to you. "That's Paul. He was the one that knocked you out." Morgan jokes as the three of you walk outside the room and head towards a staircase.

"We usually mind our own business but we occasionally allow strangers that could prove useful to our little community here," Paul says as he opens the door for you.
column3: 你看到警卫换了一种更舒服的站势。审讯者上前接过警卫手中的猎枪。"欢迎来到湖景树丛，菲利普," 警卫说道。两人都摘下了兜帽，审讯者开始解开你的绑绳。"对此我很抱歉，但我们很少有访客，即使我们有，他们通常也会先开枪，最后我们会把他们干掉," 他解释道。"顺便说下，我叫摩根," 他边说边把你的东西还给你。“那是保罗。"那位是保罗，那个把你放倒的人。"当你们三个走出房间走向楼梯时，摩根开玩笑说。"我们通常会管好自己的事，但偶尔也会允许对我们这个小社区有帮助的陌生人进来," 保罗边说边为你开门。

column2:
"So, are you gonna tell us your real name or what?" the interrogator asks as he looses his hood. "You are a terrible liar, by the way."

You look up at the guard. He looks back at you and nods making you feel reasured, somehow.

"I'm Philip, Philip Kindred." you concede.
column3: "所以，你到底要不要告诉我们你的真名?" 审讯者脱下兜帽问道。"顺便说下，你真的不会装糊涂。"你抬头看警卫。他回头看着你点了点头，不知何故，这让你感到安心。"我是菲利普，菲利普 金狄。" 你承认道。

column2:
You see the guard shake his head and throw some hand signals at the interrogator. You swear you saw him drawing his hand across the throat, which is a bad hand signal gesture.
			
"Well then, mate. We will actually let you go this time but never come back here again, you hear?" the interrogator commands as he puts a bag over your head.

"If you do, we will blow your head off," he warns as you hear him open the door. They make you walk from room to room, then you climb down stairs. Eventually you reach outside, the familiar weather and the sound of desolation greet you as they make you walk away from the compound. The bag is removed and you turn as your eyes adjust. You see your escorts moving away, some of them dissapearing around street corners and buildings. They all wear potato bag hoods but you recognize the guard from the interrogation room.

You find yourself alone in the ruins. You take a big breath and prepare to face the wilderness.
column3: 你看到警卫摇了摇头并向审讯者做了一些手势。你发誓你看到他用手划过喉咙，这可不是什么好手势。"那好吧，伙计。这次我们会放你走，但不要再回来了，懂吗?" 审讯者一边将袋子套在你头上一边命令道。"如果你再来，我们会把你脑袋给炸了," 当你听到他开门时警告道。他们让你从一个房间走到另一个房间，然后你爬下楼梯。最后你到外面了，熟悉的天气和荒凉的声音迎面而来，他们让你远离围场。袋子被取下，你适应好自己的眼睛。你看到你的护送者离开了，他们中的一些人消失在街角和建筑周围。他们都戴着土豆袋兜帽但你还是认出了审讯室的警卫。你发现自己孤零零地在废墟上。你深吸一口气并做好准备面对荒野。
欢迎来到湖景树丛 续。

column2:
You finally find yourself inside the compound. Things aren't too different in here. There's barely any activity but you can see there's people inside buildings. "As you can imagine, the streets aren't safe around here, even inside our settlement. We adapted ourselves a network of tunnels that now connect most of our buildings," Morgan explains.
			
You walk to one of the tunnel access shafts and climb down a ladder. "There are maps all around these tunnels but visitors are only allowed in the trading post aaand here, the inn," Morgan continues as he shows you the map.

"Alright, boss. I'm heading the opposite direction. I need to go back with security," Paul interrupts. Morgan nods and throws some hand signals. "Paul is the head of security in here. He's also one of our best spotters in the walls." Morgan says as you two continue walking.

The two of you eventually arrive at the entrance to a building basement. "Here we are. This is our city hall or something like it. It's where you can find me, most of the time. Come visit me here if you have any questions or are in need of something to do for our community." Morgan says as he taps your shoulder.
