column3: 你终于发现自己进入了围场。这里的情况并没有太大不同。几乎没有什么动静，但你可以看到建筑里有人。“你可以想象，这里的街道不安全，即使是在我们的定居点。我们改造了一个自己的地道网络，它能连接我们的大部分建筑物," 摩根解释道。你走到其中一个地道入口并爬下梯子。"这些地道周围都有贴有地图，但游客只允许进入这里的贸易站和客栈," 摩根继续向你展示地图。"好了,老板。我已经走得太远。我需要和保安一起回去了," 保罗打断道。摩根点点头并挥了挥手。"保罗是这里的安全主管。他也是城墙内最好的侦察员之一。"摩根边走边说道。你们俩最终来到了地下室的入口。"这就到了。这是我们的市政厅或类似那样的地方。大多数时候你都能在那里找到我。如果你有任何问题或需要为我们的社区做些什么，请到这里来找我。"摩根拍着你的肩膀说道。
湖景树丛, 主要地区。

column2:
You find yourself in the safety of Lakeview Arbor. You can use the tunnels to safely travel around the compound.
			
Unlike the surface, things are pretty lively down in the tunnels. The people of Lakeview are better dressed than the average rubble scum. They seem weary and quite reserved but not at all hostile.

They have a sort of law enforcement in here. They generally dress in brown colors and look a bit informal but they are easy to tell apart from the normal Lakeview enclaver. The wall guards all wear those potato bag hoods.

Now, where to go next.
column3: 你走进湖景树丛，一股安全感在心中升起。通过隧道，你可以悠闲地在大院周围穿行。与地表的荒凉相比，隧道里非常热闹。湖景的人穿得比一般的幸存者都要好。他们看上去很疲倦，很矜持，没有一点恶意。他们在这里也有执法部门。他们通常穿着棕色的服装，看起来有些随意，但很容易把他们和普通的湖景游客区分开。墙上的警卫都戴着土豆袋兜帽。现在，下一步该去哪里。

column2: Gathering your things, you set off for the ruins, and the wilderness beyond.
column3: 你收拾好自己的东西，向远处的废墟和荒野前进。

column2:
The trading post situated in a parkade. The traders use the parking spaces in the ground floor to place their tents and wares outside. This is one of the few places where eclavers and travelers interact with eachother.
			
Travelers can resupply and offload items which may be of use to the settlement. The goods are varied and most of them seem to be looted or makeshift but all in good condition.

Lakeview seems to be prosperous enough to produce their own goods. The trading post offers these goods in bulk in the upper floors of the parkade.
column3: 贸易站位于一个停车场内。商人们利用一楼的停车位把他们的帐篷和货物摆在外面。这是为数不多的几个能让清道夫和旅行者相互交流的地方之一。旅行者可以补给和售卖可能对定居点有用的物品。商品五花八门，其中大多数似乎是掠夺来的或临时制作的，但都完好无损。湖景镇似乎繁荣到能自产自销商品。在停车场上层贸易站大量供应这些货物。

column2: Browse the goods offered by the traders.

You find yourself in the ground floor of the parkade. You notice the temperature to be quite warm in here. They must have a working HVAC system in the building. You approach each of the trader tents to browse.


Pick up items to purchase them, or drop items to sell them.
column3: 你发现自己在停车场的底层。你发觉这里的温度相当舒适。他们肯定有个在工作中的暖通空调系统。你接近并浏览每个交易员的帐篷。拿起物品购买它们，或放下物品出售它们。

column2:
You stand in one of the floors used to store the goods they have in bulk. You soon realize it's fairly cold in here compared to the ground floor. They probably have the HVAC system off or lower the temperature up here for better storage, maybe. The trader in charge soon joins you. "Can I help you?" the man asks politely.


The goods are sold in "bulk" here and prices are high.
column3: 你站在其中一层用来储存散装货物的楼层里。你很快就会意识到这里比底楼要冷得多。他们可能关掉了暖通空调系统，或者降低了这里的温度，也许是为了更好地储存。负责这里的交易员很快就来到你身边。"你需要帮助吗?" 男人礼貌地问道。货物是 "散装"出售的并且价格很高。

column2:
You ask for a bag of flour. There is an entire parking spot filled with flour in bags.

The trader signals one of the people working there to grab one. She nods and leaves it on one of the pallets on the ground.


"There you go," the trader says as he walks to a group of workers to order them around.
column3: 你想要面粉。这一整个停车位都是袋装面粉。商人示意其中一个工作人员去拿一袋。她点了点头并把它放在地板的一个托盘上。"拿好了," 这位交易员边说边走到一群工人身边并监督他们工作。

column2:
You ask for potatoes. The trader calls one of the people working there and signals them to grab a bag. He nods and leaves it on one of the pallets on the ground.


"There you go," the trader says as he walks to a group of workers to order them around.
column3: 你想要土豆。商人示意其中一个工作人员去拿一袋。她点了点头并把它放在地板的一个托盘上。"拿好了," 这位交易员边说边走到一群工人身边并监督他们工作。

column2:
You find yourself in the safety of Lakeview Arbor. You can use the tunnels to safely travel around the compound.
			
Unlike the surface, things are pretty lively down in the tunnels. The people of Lakeview are better dressed than the average rubble scum. They seem weary and quite reserved but not at all hostile.

They have a sort of law enforcement in here. They generally dress in brown colors and look a bit informal but they are easy to tell apart from the normal Lakeview enclaver. The wall guards all wear those potato bag hoods.

Now, where to go next.
column3: 你走进湖景树丛，一股安全感在心中升起。通过隧道，你可以悠闲地在大院周围穿行。与地表的荒凉相比，隧道里非常热闹。湖景的人穿得比一般的幸存者都要好。他们看上去很疲倦，很矜持，没有一点恶意。他们在这里也有执法部门。他们通常穿着棕色的服装，看起来有些随意，但很容易把他们和普通的湖景游客区分开。墙上的警卫都戴着土豆袋兜帽。现在，下一步该去哪里。

column2:
You aproach a river. The current looks strong enough to force fish to seek refuge in the calmer backwater areas. You look around and after a while, you spot fish in one of these areas.

This might be tricky if you don't know what you are doing. Spotting fish is a lot easier than hunting them.
column3: 你靠近一条河流。水流强劲到足以迫使鱼类在平静的水域寻求庇护。你在周围看了一会儿，你在其中一个水域发现了鱼。这可能会很棘手，如果你不知道你要做什么。发现鱼比捕鱼要容易得多。

column2: Scavenge with a crude fishing tool.
column3: 用粗糙的钓鱼工具搜刮。

column2: Use a spear or fishnet to increase the chances to properly fish something.
column3: 使用矛或渔网来增加捕鱼的机会。

column2: Scavenge with a proper fishing tool.
column3: 使用真正的钓鱼工具搜刮。

column2:
Use a fishing rod to increase the chances to properly fish something. In addition, you are a skilled fisherman so a catch is almost guaranteed.


You are also going to need bait or a lure. If you have none, then trust in your fishing skills is your last option.
column3: 使用钓鱼竿来增加捕鱼的机会。此外，你是一名熟练的钓鱼佬，所以你的收获有保证。你还需要鱼饵或诱饵。如果都没有，那么你只能相信你的钓鱼技术了。

column2: Scavenge with a proper fishing tool.
column3: 使用真正的钓鱼工具搜刮。

column2:
Use a fishing rod to increase the chances to properly fish something.
			
You are not a skilled fisherman so you know very little about what you are doing.
column3: 使用钓鱼竿来增加捕鱼的机会。你不是一个熟练的渔夫，所以你对钓鱼所知甚少。

column2:
Fell into water!

You slipped on loose terrain and fell into the water. The sudden coldness wakes you up a little. You soon manage to drag yourself away from the cold water.

The only thing you are gonna catch now is a cold.
column3: 掉进水里！你在疏松的地形上滑倒并落入水中。突如其来的寒冷让你有点清醒。你很快就设法将自己从冷水中脱离。现在你肯定要感冒了。

column2:
Fell into water!

You lunged at a fish but slipped and fell into the water. The sudden coldness wakes you up a little. You soon manage to drag yourself away from the cold water.

At least you managed to catch that fish, though.
column3: 掉进水里！你扑向一条鱼，却滑倒在水里。突如其来的寒冷让你有点清醒。你很快就设法将自己从冷水中脱离。不过，你至少捉到那条鱼了。

column2:
Stepped into water!

You slipped on loose terrain and stepped into the water. The sudden coldness wakes you up a little. You were lucky you didn't completely fall.

The only thing you are gonna catch now is a cold.
column3: 踏入水中！你在疏松的地面上滑倒并踏入水中。突如其来的寒冷让你有点清醒。走运的你没有完全摔倒。现在你肯定要感冒了。

column2:
Fell into the stream!

You slipped on loose terrain and fell into the strong current. You fight to swim out of the water but you soon reach a shallow section in the river and managed to get out.

The adrenaline starts to go down and you notice cuts and bruises. You probably hit rocks or something when you fell.
column3: 掉进了溪流！你在疏松的地形上滑倒并落入急流。你挣扎着游出水面，但很快你就游到了河流浅水区并设法游了出来。肾上腺素开始下降后，你注意到伤口和瘀伤。你摔倒时可能撞到石头或别的什么。

column2:
You approach the shoreline. The lake is vast and there are spots with patches of aquatic vegetation. You look around and after a while, you spot fish in one of these areas.

This might be tricky if you don't know what you are doing. Spotting fish is a lot easier than hunting them.
column3: 你靠近了岸边。湖面辽阔还长有一片片的水生植物。你环顾四周一会儿后，在其中一片水域发现了鱼。这可能会很棘手，如果你不知道你要做什么。发现鱼比捕鱼要容易得多。

column2:
You aproach the shoreline. These wetlands are hard to navigate due to the vegetation and spots with unstable soil conditions. You look around and after a while, you spot fish in an area with aquatic vegetation.

This might be tricky if you don't know what you are doing. Spotting fish is a lot easier than hunting them.
column3: 你靠近了岸边。由于植被和土壤状况不稳定，这些湿地难以航行。你环顾四周一会儿后，在一片有水生植物的水域发现了鱼。这可能会很棘手，如果你不知道你要做什么。发现鱼比捕鱼要容易得多。

column2: Use knowledge of fishing to increase the chances to find fish.
column3: 利用钓鱼知识增加找到鱼的机会。

column2: A proper bait will increase the chances to catch fish the most.
column3: 合适的鱼饵能最大限度地增加捕鱼的机会。
仅使用钓鱼知识进行搜刮。

column2: Use knowledge of fishing to increase the chances to find fish while lacking bait or a lure.
column3: 使用钓鱼知识来增加在没有鱼饵或诱饵的情况下找到鱼的几率。

column2: A proper lure will increase the chances to catch fish and won't be used up in one use.
column3: 合适的诱饵可以增加捕鱼的机会，而且不会一次就用完。

column2:
You aproach the shoreline. The lake is vast and you can't really see movement in the water but fishing is not a common activity these days. Fish should be plentiful.

This might be tricky if you don't know what you are doing. Spotting fish is a lot easier than hunting them.
column3: 你靠近了岸边。湖面一望无际，你看不到水下的动静，但现在钓鱼已经不是一项常见的活动了。鱼应该很丰富。这可能会很棘手，如果你不知道你要做什么。发现鱼比捕鱼要容易得多。

column2:
You aproach the docks of the abandoned port. The lake is vast and you can't really see movement in the water but fishing is not a common activity these days. Fish should be plentiful.

This might be tricky if you don't know what you are doing. Spotting fish is a lot easier than hunting them.
column3: 你接近废弃港口的码头。湖面一望无际，你看不到水下的动静，但现在钓鱼已经不是一项常见的活动了。鱼应该很丰富。这可能会很棘手，如果你不知道你要做什么。发现鱼比捕鱼要容易得多。

column2:
As you turn to leave the parkade, you are quickly approached by a couple of hooded guards. You spot a third person marching your way. You recognize her, the butcher that was buying meat. She joins the guards and points at you, meat cleaver still in hand.

Everyone else stops, turning. Craning their necks to see around the crowd at the commotion.

"Flesh peddler!" she shouts. "Cannibal!"
column3: 当你转身离开停车场时，两位戴兜帽的警卫迅速地靠近你。你发现第三个人朝你走来。你认识她就是那个买了肉的屠夫。她跟上警卫并指着你，手里还拿着切肉刀。其他人都停了下来，转过身。伸长他们的脖子去看周围人群的骚动。"人肉贩子!" 她大喊。"食人族!"

column2:
You plead with the guards and the butcher, and explain that it must be some mistake. You don't kill humans for meat, honest!

Giving you a sidelong stare, the guards consider your plea. "If we ever, and I mean EVER, see you in here offloading that stuff again..." one of them warns.

"Now get yourself out of our sight, or else!" the other guard spits as Paul, the head of security, arrives. They nod at Paul and walk back to their posts.

"You should leave now, lad." Paul advices. Folk here have a special hatred against cannibals... I hope this was a misunderstanding and you aren't one, right? Paul asks but continues without waiting for an answer. "You should leave now. Come back in at least a few days or in a week. Things should be calmer by then."
column3: 你恳求警卫和屠夫，解释说一定是搞错了。你不会为了肉而杀人,千真万确!警卫们斜眼看着你，考虑着你的请求。"如果我们，我是说以后，再看见你在这卖那玩意..."其中一名警卫警告道。 "现在滚出我们的视线，否则!"另一个保安怒斥着，这时保安主管保罗来了。他们向保罗点头致意，然后回到各自的岗位。"你现在应该离开，小伙。"保罗建议道。这里的人们对食人族有着特殊的仇恨......我希望这是个误会，你不是食人族，对吧?保罗问道，但没等回答就继续说。"你现在该离开了。至少过几天或一周再来。到时候事情应该会平息下来。 "

column2:
"Hey!" a voice booms. The butcher's voice.

"Didn't they tell you?" The market quiets to a murmur.

"Guards!" she screams as she points her knife at you. "Flesh peddler!" someone else screams.
column3: "嘿!" 一声响起.屠夫的声音."他们没跟你讲吗?"市场静悄悄的。"警卫!" 她尖叫着用刀指着你。"卖人肉的!" 有人尖叫道。

column2:
People begin shouting, some exchanging glances, while others closing rank.

Fabric suddenly covers your head but you can still see. Your arms are grabbed by a couple of hooded guards, and you're dragged away. The crowd immediately starts calling you names and throwing trash at you as you're dragged outside of the compound. You see both Paul and Morgan join the scene, disappointment in their faces.

You are soon dragged some distance away from the compound. The hood is forcefully removed in a split second. Then, you're thrown to the ground, the muck "splurping" as you land.

You get up and look back. You see hooded figures dissapearing inside building and around each corner. Even though their faces are covered, you recognize two of them, Paul and Morgan, staring at you from the distance. They eventually join the others and you are left completely alone.
column3: 人们开始喊叫，一些人互相交换眼神，而另一些人则聚集在一起。布料突然盖住了你的头，但你仍然能看见。你的手臂被几个戴兜帽的警卫抓住并被拖走。当你被拖到院外时，人群立即开始指名辱骂你并向你扔垃圾。你看到保罗和摩根也来到了现场，他们一脸失望。你很快就被拖出一段距离。头套在一瞬间被猛地摘下。然后，你被扔到泥地上，当你落地时烂泥发出 "啪叽一声" 。你起身回头看。戴兜帽的人在建筑物内和各个角落中消失。尽管他们的脸都被遮住了，你还是认出了其中两个人，保罗和摩根，他们正从远处盯着你。他们最终加入了其他人的行列，而你已被完全孤立了。

column2:
You ask for scrap metal sheets. The trader calls one of the people working there and signals them to grab a six scrap metal sheets. He nods and grabs some from the designated area. He then leaves them on one of the pallets on the ground.


"There you go," the trader says as he walks to a group of workers to order them around.
column3: 你想要废金属板。商人喊在那工作的人并示意去拿六张废金属板来。他点了点头，从指定的地方拿来一些。然后将它们放在地上的一个托盘上。"拿好了," 这位交易员边说边走到一群工人面前监督他们干活。

column2:
You arrive to an entrance surrounded by people in different states of inebriation chatting or sitting by themselves. There's a sign that reads "The Tipsy Bear Inn" just above. You walk past these people and climb the stairs into the building. Inside, you see everything illuminated by red or blue neon tube lights around corners and pillars in the ceiling. There's no windows, just horizontal slits in their place, probably for ventillation.
			
There's music but it can barely be heard. Patrons seem to vary between travelers and a few Lakeview enclavers, which are easy to distinguish since they are not overloaded by gear and bags. As you still look around the place, the bartender waves at you.

You walk up to the girl behind the counter. "A new face!" she exclaims. "Take a seat. Name's Clarice."
column3: 你来到入口，周围都是各种醉醺醺的人，他们正在聊天或独自坐着。有一块牌子上写着 "醉熊酒馆" 挂在上面。你从这些人身边走过，爬上楼梯进入建筑。在里面，你看见天花板上的柱子和角落里的红蓝两色霓虹灯照亮了所有。这里没窗户，只有横缝，估计是为了通风。这有音乐但几乎听不到。似乎顾客在旅行者和湖景飞地人之间有所不同，这些飞地人很容易被区分，因为他们没有超重的装备和行李。当你环顾四周时，酒保向你招手。你走到柜台后面的女孩前。"生面孔!" 她惊呼道。"请坐吧。我叫克拉丽丝。"

column2: Welcome to the The Tipsy Bear.

You nod and sit in front of her. "So, you are the guy that tried to get in with a crowbar?" She jokes. "Word gets around," she continues before you can answer. "First one's on the house," Clarice says as she gets you a beer and a glass.
			
"Thanks... My name is Philip Kindred, by the way," you state. "Welcome to The Tipsy Bear, Philip. We got something stronger than that beer," she continues as she motions towards a shelf with a variety of drinks. "We also got food too, which includes a glass of water," she says as she reaches for a hand drawn menu and leaves it in front of you.

"Oh, there's no such thing as reservations or the like. If you see one of the tables empty, just sit there and either me or Carlos will take your order," she says as she points towards a couple of swinging traffic doors. "He should be getting back out in any moment. He's wearing the same black apron I'm wearing," she explains as she starts to wash the dirty glasses piling up in a sink.
column3: 你点了点头并坐在她前面。"所以，你就是那个试图用撬棍进来的人?"她开玩笑道。"每个人都这么讲," 她在你回答前继续说。"第一杯我请你," 克拉丽丝边说边给你拿了啤酒和一个酒杯。“谢谢……"谢谢... 顺便说下，我的名字是 菲利普 金狄," 你说道。"欢迎来到醉熊, 菲利普。我们这有些比啤酒更带劲的," 她继续说着并向一个摆着各种饮料的架子走去。"我们也有食物，包括一杯水," 她边说边伸手去拿手绘菜单，然后将它放在你面前。"噢，这没有什么预约之类的。如果你看到有桌子是空的，直接坐那就好，我或卡洛斯会帮你点单的," 她指着几扇摇晃摆动的门说。"他应该随时会出来。他穿着和我一样的黑色围裙," 她一边解释一边开始清洗堆积在水槽里的脏玻璃杯。

column2:
You find yourself inside The Tipsy Bear. Everything is illuminated by red or blue neon tube lights around corners and pillars in the ceiling. There's no windows, just horizontal slits in their place, probably for ventillation.
			
There's music but it can barely be heard. Patrons seem to vary between travelers and a few Lakeview enclavers, which are easy to distinguish since they are not overloaded by gear and bags.

There's a notice on a wall you didn't see before. It reads: "Don't even bother asking for booze if you are already drunk! No whiskey if you are dehydrated either!"
column3: 你发现自己在醉熊酒馆里。天花板上的柱子和角落里的红蓝两色霓虹灯照亮了所有。这里没窗户，只有横缝，估计是为了通风。这有音乐但几乎听不到。似乎顾客在旅行者和湖景飞地人之间有所不同，这些飞地人很容易被区分，因为他们没有超重的装备和行李。墙上有个你之前没见过的告示。上面写着:"如果你喝大了，就别再点酒了!另外别想用威士忌解渴，它只会让你脱水！"

column2:
You ask for beer. Clarice grabs a glass and starts to fill it in the dispenser.


"There you go," she says as she leaves it in front of you.


The piss-colored liquid before you in the glass smells very yeasty, likely home-brewn, and only somewhat watered down. Though as it goes down, there's no mistaking that characteristic hoppy taste- it's beer, alright. And it's only half bad.
column3: 你要了啤酒。克拉丽斯拿起玻璃杯并开始用分酒器灌满它。"请享用," 她边说边把它放在你面前。你面前玻璃杯里的尿液颜色的液体闻起来很有酵母味，很可能是自家酿造的，只是稍微淡了些。但当它下肚时，那种特有的啤酒花味是不会错的——这是啤酒，是啊。真就棒极了。

column2:
You ask for wine. Clarice grabs a bottle from a shelf behind her and then one of the wine glasses hanging from a glass rack just above the counter.


"There you go," she says as she leaves the glass in front of you and pours wine in it.
			
			
The wine is hardly of any sort of vintage quality, but it's got a subtle sweetness tucked behind its tart opening flavor that lets the fanciful-feeling alcohol go down smoothly, compared to most other options.
column3: 你要了葡萄酒。克拉丽斯从她身后的架子上拿了一瓶酒，然后从柜台上方的玻璃架上拿了一个酒杯。"请享用," 她边说边把杯子放在你面前，往里倒酒。这款葡萄酒几乎没有任何年份，但与大多数其他选择相比，它的酸味后面隐藏着一种微妙的甜味，让幻想的酒精感平稳地下降。

column2:
You ask for whiskey. Clarice grabs a bottle from a shelf behind her and a short glass, which she leaves in front of you. She then grabs a bucket with ice from under the counter and drops two cubes of ice in the glass.


"There you go," she says as she pours some whiskey in the glass. You feel weirdly nostalgic for a quick second.


The whiskey smells very strongly of nigh-on pure alcohol, almost more akin to Vodka than a grain brew, though it still burns all the same.
column3: 你要了威士忌。克拉丽斯从她身后的架子上拿了瓶酒和一个古典杯并将它们放在你面前。然后她从柜台下面拿了一桶冰块并将两块冰块放进杯子里。"请享用," 她边说边往杯子里倒了些威士忌。你感到有种奇怪的怀旧感。这种威士忌闻起来有强烈几乎是纯酒精的味道，几乎更像伏特加而不是谷物酿造的酒，尽管它也一样那么烈。

column2:
You ask for fish sticks. Clarice scans for Carlos and motions some hand signals at him. Carlos nods as he carries dirty dishes back to the kitchen.


After some minutes, Carlos arrives with your order. "There you go," he says as he leaves it in front of you.


The fried fish sticks are about exactly as you anticipated, if a bit soggy with grease; A nice crunchy breaded outer layer, and a soft flakey inner of greasy fish meat, the flavor of which has been enhanced with a generous portion of salt. The overt fattiness of the oil is definitely welcome, after so many lean meals out in the wild. 
The small pile of fried goodness before you is gone near as quickly as it came.
column3: 你要了鱼棒。克拉丽斯扫了眼卡洛斯，并向他做了一些手势。卡洛斯点点头，把脏盘子端回厨房。 几分钟后，卡洛斯端着你点的食物来了。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。炸鱼条和你预期想的差不多，只是油有点多;它的外面裹着松脆的面包屑，里面是油腻的鱼肉，里面放了充足的盐，味道更好了。在野外吃了太多脂肪不多的食物后，这油香四溢的绝对更受欢迎。在野外吃了这么多瘦肉后，这种油明显的脂肪含量绝对是受欢迎的。摆在你面前的那一小堆油炸食品来得快，去得也快。

column2:
You ask for fried shrimps. Clarice scans for Carlos and motions some hand signals at him. Carlos nods as he carries dirty dishes back to the kitchen.


After some minutes, Carlos arrives with your order. "There you go," he says as he leaves it in front of you.


The shrimps smell marvelous, and taste even better- first, a hearty crunch, before the fried morsels seem to literally melt in your mouth. You devour the contents of the small bowl quickly, before setting it aside, empty, with a small satisifed belch.
column3: 你要了炸虾。克拉丽斯扫了眼卡洛斯，并向他做了一些手势。卡洛斯点点头，把脏盘子端回厨房。 几分钟后，卡洛斯端着你点的食物来了。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。这虾闻起来很香，吃起来就更是美味——首先是爽脆的嘎吱声，然后炸过的小块虾似乎真的在你嘴里融化了。你迅速地吃完一小碗，然后将它放在一边，吃干抹净，心满意足地打了个小嗝。
点份海鲜炖菜 - 11 美元

column2:
You ask for seafood stew. Clarice scans for Carlos and motions some hand signals at him. Carlos nods as he carries dirty dishes back to the kitchen.


After some minutes, Carlos arrives with your order. "There you go," he says as he leaves it in front of you.


The small bowl of steaming soup before you seems rather meager at a glance- more broth than anything, though with occasional bits of chopped potato, carrot, or boiled fish floating within the briney depths of the dish. The taste is quite strong, the broth base likely having been on broil for weeks, if not longer- and fortified by a generous helping of salt and the so-called "catch of the day". 
It's not long before the bowl lies empty before you, your stomach a little bit more full than it were before.
column3: 你要了海鲜炖菜。克拉丽斯扫了眼卡洛斯，并向他做了一些手势。卡洛斯点点头，把脏盘子端回厨房。 几分钟后，卡洛斯端着你点的食物来了。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。炸鱼条和你预期想的差不多，只是油有点多;它的外面裹着松脆的面包屑，里面是油腻的鱼肉，里面放了充足的盐，味道更好了。你面前的一小碗热气腾腾的汤乍一看似乎很少——肉汤比什么都多，尽管偶尔会有一些切碎的土豆、胡萝卜或煮鱼漂浮在菜肴的盐水深处。味道很浓，肉汤可能已经烤了几个星期，如果不是更久的话——并通过大量的盐和所谓的“每日捕获物”来强化。它的味道很浓，汤底很可能已经炖了几周，如果不是煮了那么久而且还加入了大量的盐和所谓的“每日味精”。 没过多久，碗就空着摆在你面前，你的胃比刚刚饱了点。

column2:
You ask for french fries. Clarice scans for Carlos and motions some hand signals at him. Carlos nods as he carries dirty dishes back to the kitchen.


After some minutes, Carlos arrives with your order. "There you go," he says as he leaves it in front of you.


The fries come on a tiny platter, more appropriate for serving a cup of tea than any sort of food. Still, the fried sticks of heavily salted potato are delicious, and your mind settles on the idea of potentially ordering another helping, as they're gone near as soon as they're placed upon the table before you.
column3: 你要了炸薯条。克拉丽斯扫了眼卡洛斯，并向他做了一些手势。卡洛斯点点头，把脏盘子端回厨房。 几分钟后，卡洛斯端着你点的食物来了。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。炸鱼条和你预期想的差不多，只是油有点多;它的外面裹着松脆的面包屑，里面是油腻的鱼肉，里面放了充足的盐，味道更好了。薯条装在一个小盘子里，比任何食物都更适合用来喝茶。尽管如此，咸炸薯条还是很美味，你脑子里想着要不再点一份，因为它们一摆在你面前的桌子上就被吃光了。
点份炸鱼和薯条 - 14 美元

column2:
You ask for fish and chips. Clarice scans for Carlos and motions some hand signals at him. Carlos nods as he carries dirty dishes back to the kitchen.

After some minutes, Carlos arrives with your order. "There you go," he says as he leaves it in front of you.

You look at the small plate set before you, laden down with strips of greasy fried breaded fish, and a generous portion of french fries. Just before you begin to devour the meal, saliva flooding your mouth as you grab for the first salty stick from the assortment, you pause for a moment to utter a question to the server. 

"Wait. What's with the fries?"

Carlos looks to you for a moment with a look of bemusement which quickly changes to one of amusement. "Old colloquialism, man."

"Oh." Right. You knew that. You give a small sheepish shrug, before returning to your meal, enjoying every last crunchy bite. Chips, fries. It's all potatoes, right?
column3: 你要了鱼棒和薯条。克拉丽斯扫了眼卡洛斯，并向他做了一些手势。卡洛斯点点头，把脏盘子端回厨房。 几分钟后，卡洛斯端着你点的食物来了。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。"请慢用," 他一边说一边将它放在你面前。你看着摆在你面前的小盘子，里面装满了油腻的炸鱼棒，还有一大份薯条。在你开始狼吞虎咽前，口水就涌入嘴巴里了， 你从各式各样的食物中抓起第一根咸棒时，你停下来向服务员问了个问题。"等下，这为啥叫薯条?"卡洛斯用困惑的表情看了你一会儿，但很快就变得乐呵起来。“老俗话，伙计。” “噢。”对啊。你明白了。你不好意思地耸了耸肩，然后继续品味美食，享受着每一口松脆。薯片,薯条。那都是土豆，对吧?

column2:
The workforce center is as busy as you imagined it to be. It's close enough to Gate 11 to be hard to miss. Most of the traffic in the streets seem to be sprawlers, and probably travelers like yourself.

This is a government building from the Department of Skill and Labor or "DSL", as it's often called. These offices are posted in nearly all Gates, probably because the DSL offers work-related services to everyone, including outsiders carrying only a visitor pass.

Permanent residents can find stable employment here, but visitor passes such as yours can only receive temporary work.
column3: 劳动力中心和你想象中一样忙碌。它离11号大门很近所以很难错过。街上的大部分交通似乎都是杂乱无章的，可能还有像你这样的旅行者。这栋政府大楼属于技术劳动部，它通常被称为“DSL”。这些寻求工作者在所有靠近门口的地方投简历，可能是因为DSL为每个人提供与工作相关的服务，包括只持有访客通行证的外人。永久居民可以在这里找到稳定的工作，但像你这样的通行证游客只能得到临时工作。

column2:
You cross the street, and make your way into the center. You soon find yourself part of a river of people walking in the same direction. 

As you can't walk freely anymore you slow down to the pace everyone is moving, looking at those around you. Their clothing is varied but most wear workgear. Most of these people already do work for the center, probably.

The building has automatic doors but there's so much traffic you only see the door lights flicker from green to red for a second, and then back to green.
column3: 你穿过街道，向中心走去。很快你就发现自己已是茫茫人海中的一员，大家都朝着同一个方向前进。当你不能再行动自由时，你放慢了脚步并看看周围的人。他们的服装各种各样，但更多的人穿着工装。这些人中的大多数可能已经为中心工作了。这些人中的大多数可能已经在为该中心工作了 这栋大楼有自动门，但由于人流量太多，你只能看到门上的绿灯闪到红灯才一秒就又变回绿色的了。

column2: You decide to leave the center.

These offices offer a number of employment services for both employers and work seekers, including learning programs, recruitment of workers, pre-screening and job listings. Here, you can see people in groups, some filling out forms, others swamping a staff member with questions, and others still piling up at the elevators or stairs.

Some of the walls and pillars have information brochures, so you take one, but much of what's in there is unhelpful. Some of the facilities and services are free to use but most of them need a proper work permit and probably other documents, which means paperwork - that last part, at least, is made abundantly clear, even if the exact purpose of a lot of the documentation isn't.
column3: 这些办公室为雇主和求职者提供许多就业服务，包括学习计划、工人招聘、预先筛选和工作列表。在这里，你可以看到人们成群结队，一些人在填写表格，另一些人用问题淹没了一名工作人员，还有一些人仍然堆积在电梯或楼梯上。在这，你可以看到一拨又一拨的人，有的在填写表格，有的在向工作人员询问，还有一些人仍然在电梯或楼梯上拥挤着。有些墙上和柱子上挂有信息手册，所以你拿了一本，但里面大部分内容都没什么用。有些设施和服务是可自由使用的，但大多数都需要合适的工作许可证和其他文件，这意味着所有批准文书——至少最后一部分是一清二楚的，即使很多文件的准确目的并不清楚。

column2:
You take a number from the dispenser and sit on whatever surface is free at the moment. As you wait, you look at one of the information screens:

-A DSL form is required for all other paperwork and procedures. You can also fill it again if you become a skilled Mechanic and/or Electrician to update your form.

-Work permits cost $1000 to obtain and $500 to renew. A work permit is not only required for work but also for training programs. Work permits expire after a week.

-Each training program session costs $250 and are closely monitored to supervise learning progress.
column3: 你从自动取号机里拿一个号码，然后坐在随便一块空地上。在等待的过程中，你看到着其中一个信息屏幕上显示:-所有其他批准工作和程序都需要 DSL 表单。如果你是一名熟练的技工和/或电工，你也可以再次填写以更新你的表格。 -获取工作许可证的费用为 1000 美元，续签费用为 500 美元。不仅申请工作需要工作许可证，培训项目也需要。工作许可一周后失效。 -每个培训课程的费用为 250 美元，之后还会受到密切监测以监督学习进度。

column2:
Your number is called and you head to the corresponding window. "DSL form, work permit, skill program, or job," a tired looking office worker behind the window spits without even looking at you.

"DSL form," you quickly answer. The office drone grabs a sheet of paper from one of many towers of paper to the left of the desk. You could swear the towers are just placed on the floor rather than on a table or another proper surface. 

"Hold on," the drone says as you take the paper. A pen is deposited in the slit under the window. You fill most of the paperwork. There are pages with technical questions and requirements. You leave those alone.

You deposit both the paper and the pen in the slit. The worker grabs them, scans the document, and then gives you the copy. Before you can say anything, a curtain drops. looks like that's done.
column3: 你的号码被叫到，你走到相应的窗口。“取DSL 表格、办理工作许可证、参加培训计划或接受工作”;窗户后面一个看起来很疲惫的办公职员甚至看都没看你一眼就吐了一口唾沫。"DSL 表格," 你马上回答道。办公室里的无人机从桌子左侧的一堆纸塔中抓起一张纸。你可以发誓这堆纸塔只是放在地板上，而不是放在桌子或其他合适的表面上。"稍等," 当你拿起文件时无人机说道。一支笔被塞进了窗缝下。你填写了文件的大部分。有技术问题和要求的页面。你留空没填。你把纸和笔都放进了窗缝里。工作人员拿走文件并扫描它们，然后将复印件给你。你还没来得及说什么，窗帘就落了下来。看起来已经搞定了。

column2:
Your number is called and you head to the corresponding window. "DSL form, work permit, skill program, or job," a tired looking office worker behind the window spits without even looking at you.

"work permit," you quickly answer. "your form, please," she says as she taps on the slit under the window. You deposit it and the office drone slides it to the desk. She types on her machine and a printer starts to work somewhere. She grabs a sheet of paper from somewhere under the desk and starts to type on the machine again.

"Have a nice day," the drone says as your papers are deposited in the slit under the window, which is now blocked by a curtain.

You grab your papers and walk past the waiting area.
column3: 你的号码被叫到，你走到相应的窗口。“取DSL 表格、办理工作许可证、参加培训计划或接受工作”;窗户后面一个看起来很疲惫的办公职员甚至看都没看你一眼就吐了一口唾沫。"工作许可证," 你马上回答道。 "表格请给我," 她边说边敲着窗户下的缝隙。你把它放入，办公室无人机就将它滑到桌子上。她在机器上打字并且某处的打印机开始工作。 她从桌下的某个地方抓起一张纸然后又开始在机器上打字。"祝你有美好的一天," 当你的文件被塞进窗户下的缝隙时办公无人机说道，同时窗户也被窗帘遮住了。你拿起自己的文件并走过等候区。
更新工作许可证 - 500 美元

column2:
Your number is called and you head to the corresponding window. "DSL form, work permit, skill program, or job," a tired looking office worker behind the window spits without even looking at you.

"work permit," you quickly answer. "your form, please," the worker drone says as he points towards the slit under the window. You deposit both your DSL form and your expired work permit, as indicated in the information brochure you grabbed earlier. The drone grabs the documents and gives them a quick scan. You hear the familiar sound of those cheap, mushy keyboard switches and a printer starts to work somewhere. The worker grabs a sheet of paper from the printer and types on the machine one last time.

"Have a nice day," the office drone says as your documents are deposited in the slit under the window, which is now blocked by a curtain.

You grab your papers and walk past the waiting area.

"Here," the worker says as you grab the paper. A pen is deposited in the slit under the window. You start reading the form. There are pages with technical questions and requirements. You manage to do the entire paperwork.

You deposit both the paper and the pen in the slit. The worker grabs them, scans the document, and then gives you the copy. Before you can say anything, a curtain drops. looks like that's done.
column3: 你的号码被叫到，你走到相应的窗口。“取DSL 表格、办理工作许可证、参加培训计划或接受工作”;窗户后面一个看起来很疲惫的办公职员甚至看都没看你一眼就吐了一口唾沫。"DSL 表格," 你马上回答道。办公室里的无人机从桌子左侧的一堆纸塔中抓起一张纸。你可以发誓这堆纸塔只是放在地板上，而不是放在桌子或其他合适的表面上。"这里," 当你拿起文件时无人机说道。一支笔被塞进了窗缝下。你填写了文件的大部分。有技术问题和要求的页面。你也都完整地填完。你把纸和笔都放进了窗缝里。工作人员拿走文件并扫描它们，然后将复印件给你。你还没来得及说什么，窗帘就落了下来。看起来已经搞定了。

column2:
You take a number from the dispenser, along with an empty clipboard for any documents you might need and sit on whatever surface is free at the moment. As you wait you look at one of the information screens:

-A DSL form is required for all other paperwork and procedures. You can also fill it again if you become a skilled Mechanic and/or Electrician to update your form.

-Work permits cost $1000 to obtain and $500 to renew. A work permit is not only required for work but also for training programs. Work permits expire after a week.

-Each training program session costs $250 and are closely monitored to supervise learning progress.
column3: 你从自动取号机里拿一个号码, 以及一个空剪贴板，用于存放你可能需要的任何文件，然后随便坐在一块空地上。 在等待的过程中，你看到着其中一个信息屏幕上显示:-所有其他批准工作和程序都需要 DSL 表单。如果你是一名熟练的技工和/或电工，你也可以再次填写以更新你的表格。 -获取工作许可证的费用为 1000 美元，续签费用为 500 美元。不仅申请工作需要工作许可证，培训项目也需要。工作许可一周后失效。 -每个培训课程的费用为 250 美元，之后还会受到密切监测以监督学习进度。

column2:
Your number is called and you head to the corresponding window. "DSL form, work permit, skill program, or job," a tired looking office worker behind the window spits without even looking at you.

"Mechanic skill program," you quickly answer. "your form and work permit, please," The office drone asks as he taps the glass over a metal slit under it. You provide the required documents and the worker grabs them. 

He starts to type on his machine and gives you a small piece of paper. "That's a seat and classroom numbers. Elevators and staircases are that way," the drone spits and points at a direction before you can say anything.

You make your way to the classroom, which is nothing more than a room filled with office cubes, each with a computer and a bunch of mechanical parts and manuals.
column3: 你的号码被叫到，你走到相应的窗口。“取DSL 表格、办理工作许可证、参加培训计划或接受工作”;窗户后面一个看起来很疲惫的办公职员甚至看都没看你一眼就吐了一口唾沫。"技工技能计划," 你马上回答道。 "请出示您的表格和工作许可证," 办公无人机打开窗口下方的缝隙时问道。你提供所需的文件,职员一起拿走。他开始在他的机器上打字并给你一张小纸条。"那是教室的座位号。电梯和楼梯在那边," 无人机在你说什么之前,指向一个方向。你来到教室,这只不过是一个布置满办公室板块的房间,每个隔间内都有一台电脑和一堆机械部件和手册。

column2:
You enter the room and look for your spot. All the other spots are busy with people wearing headphones and messing around with the manuals and mechanical parts.

You get to your cube and sit on the office chair. The computer is already on and the screen displays a number of learning entries that range from training videos to written tests and schematics.

You wear the headphones and start to go through all the material you can. You take pauses to mess with parts lying around and the manuals on the desk. After a while, the computer locks and displays a prompt to let you know the session is over.

You pick up your things but before leaving, you see movement in the screen. It's clear someone else is there remotely so these sessions seem to be indeed monitored as advertised. You make your way back to the main hall.
column3: 你进入房间寻找你的座位。其他地方的人都在忙着戴着耳机和摆弄手册和机械部件。你到达你的隔间并坐在办公椅上。电脑已经开机了,屏幕显示了许多学习条目，从培训视频到笔试和示意图。你戴上耳机,开始阅读所有材料。你会停下来摆弄周围的零件和桌子上的手册。过了一会儿,计算机锁定并显示提示让你知道课程结束了。你拿起你自己的东西，但在离开前，你看到屏幕上有动静。很明显，还有别的人在远程监控，所以这些课程似乎确实像宣传的那样受到了监控。你回到大厅。

He starts to type on his machine and gives you a small piece of paper. "That's a seat and classroom numbers. Elevators and staircases are that way," the drone spits and points at a direction before you can say anything.

You make your way to the classroom, which is nothing more than a room filled with office cubes, each with a computer and a bunch of electrical parts, tools and manuals.

column3: 你从DSL表格中输入序列号。屏幕显示你的信息:姓名：菲利普·金狄 帐单信息：不适用 群组:FWP-S 工作许可：已过期 用户可用于劳动力培训的项目:不适用 用户可用于劳动力的临时工作:勘探者、机械师和电工。

column2:
You access the website in your device. The screen takes a moment to load but it eventually displays the following information:

-A DSL form is required for all other paperwork and procedures. You can also fill it again if you become a skilled Mechanic and/or Electrician to update your form.

-Work permits cost $1000 to obtain and $500 to renew. A work permit is not only required for work but also for training programs. Work permits expire after a week.

-Each training program session costs $250 and are closely monitored to supervise learning progress.

There's also a number of options below the previous information but they require a DSL form serial number.
column3: 你用自己的设备访问该网站。屏幕需要一些时间来加载，最终它会显示以下信息:-所有其他批准工作和程序都需要 DSL 表单。如果你是一名熟练的技工和/或电工，你也可以再次填写以更新你的表格。 -获取工作许可证的费用为 1000 美元，续签费用为 500 美元。不仅申请工作需要工作许可证，培训项目也需要。工作许可一周后失效。 -每个培训课程的费用为 250 美元，之后还会受到密切监测以监督学习进度。在前面的信息下还有一些选项，但它们都需要DSL表格序列号。
你结束了使用这个设备。

column2:
You stand in the sector that offers services for those in the prospecting work. Prospectors come here to exchange their loot for ration stamps.
			
The DSL will not take just anything, though. As described in the brochure, they are interested in electronic scrap and specific devices, these include military equipment like thermal goggles, or medical devices like nanorobot kits and their refills.

There isn't really a list of things they need but if they are interested in something you have, they will let you know.
column3: 你站在为那些从事勘探工作者提供服务的办公室内。勘探者们来这里用他们的战利品换取配给粮票。不过，DSL并不是什么都要。正如手册中所描述的，他们对电子废料和特定设备感兴趣，这些设备包括军事设备如头戴式热成像仪，或医疗设备如纳米机器人包以及补水包。他们没有真正所需物品的清单，但如果他们对你身上的东西感兴趣，他们会跟你讲的。

column2: A stack of electronic scrap will only grant you a single ration stamp, but that's enough for an MRE.
column3: 一堆电子废料只能给你一张配给粮票，但这对换取一个MRE来说已经足够了。

column2: Military micro cells are rare but not really valuable in informal markets but the DSL will pay four ration stamps for one.
column3: 军用微型电池很少见，但在非正式市场上并没有真正价值，DSL却可以用4张配给粮票换取其中一个。

column2: Night vision goggles are uncommon military equipment, more likely to be found in informal markets than scavenged. It seems scavengers prefer credits than ration stamps. The DSL will pay eight ration stamps for one of these.
column3: 夜视目镜是不常见的军事装备，比起搜刮得来，在非正规市场上更有可能找到。拾荒者似乎中意信用点胜过配给粮票。DSL将支付8张配给粮票为换取其中一个。

column2: Thermal vision goggles are rare military equipment, more likely to be found in informal markets than scavenged. It seems scavengers prefer credits than ration stamps. The DSL will pay ten ration stamps for one of these.
column3: 热成像目镜是稀有的军事装备，比起搜刮得来，在非正规市场上更有可能找到。拾荒者似乎中意信用点胜过配给粮票。DSL将支付10张配给粮票为换取其中一个。
交换纳米机器人医疗包。

column2: Nanorobot medical kits used to be really common in hospitals but only available for those with enough to afford them. Most prospectors will at least keep one of these and sell the spares. The DSL will pay six ration stamps for one of these.
column3: 纳米机器人医疗包曾经在医院里很常见，但只有那些有足够能力的人才能买到。多数勘探者至少会自留一个并出售备用的。DSL将支付6张配给粮票为换取其中一个。
交换纳米机器人悬浮液。

column2: Nanorobot medical kit suspension refills are extremely priced, which means prospectors will rarely exchange these. The DSL will pay three ration stamps for each of these you bring.
column3: 纳米机器人悬浮液的价格非常高，这意味着勘探者很少用它们交换。DSL将为你带来的每一件支付3张配给粮票。

column2: Exchange small electronic device labeled Galton 'Dog-Be-Gone'
column3: 交换标有 高尔顿 '狗-无-踪'的小型电子设备

column2: A device supposedly made to scare off dogs. The compensation for it is two ration stamps, which is actually nice for busted device.
column3: 据说是用来吓跑狗的装置。作为补偿它可换取2张配给粮票，这对于损坏设备来讲已经很不错了。

column2: Nobody knows what this thing is. Even the DSL worker doing the appraising is confused. They will probably scrap the thing but at least they say they will compensate you with seven ration stamps for it, for some reason.
column3: 没人知道这玩意是什么。甚至连评估的DSL工作人员也一头雾水。他们可能会报废这个东西，但出于某种原因，他们至少说会给7张配给粮票补偿你。

column2: As soon as you deposit the RTG cell, you hear the unmistakable sound of a geiger counter. The sound attracts the attention of everyone. The appraiser is soon replaced by someone wearing a hazmat suit. After a moment the worker puts the object in a metal container and removes his hood. The compensation for this device is just nine ration stamps.
column3: 当你放下RTG电池时，你毫无疑问听见盖革计数器发出声音。那声音引起了每个人的注意。评估师很快就被一个穿着防护服的人取代了。过了一会儿，工作人员把这个物件放进一个金属容器里，然后取下了他的头罩。这个装置只能换取9张配给粮票。

column2: You present the electronic scrap to the appraiser. "Space scrap, eh?" the worker says, unimpressed. It appears it's not as uncommon as you thought. Still, the compensation for a stack is twenty ration stamps.
column3: 你将电子废品交给评估师。"航空废料, 嗯?"这名工作人员不为所动地说。这一堆仍然能换取20张配给粮票。

column2: Exchange small, orange box with screw mounts and a makeshift power cell.
column3: 交换带有螺丝安装座和临时电池的橙色小盒子。

column2: A small orange transponder. The compensation for this device is fourteen ration stamps.
column3: 一个小的橙色转发器。这个装置可换取14张配给粮票。
交换 DMC 无人机零件。

column2:
The appraiser just stares at you for a moment and sighs. "How did you get this?" the worker asks but before you can even answer, a couple of workers arrive, along with a DMC guard.
			
"We are not allowed to offer compensation for this material, and we are required to confiscate it. Hope you understand," he explains as the workers take the DMC drone parts. It could have been a lot worse.
column3: 评估师只是盯着你看了一会儿，然后叹了口气。"你是怎么得到这个的?" 工作人员问道，但你还没来得及回答，几个工作人员还有一位底特律警卫就到来了。"我们不允许为这些材料提供补偿，我们要求没收这些材料。希望你能理解," 他在工作人员拿走DMC无人机部件时解释道。情况可能会更糟。

column2:
You stand in the area where ration stamps are exachanged for food and equipment. These facilities are underground and appear to use a wider space than the above building.
			
Most of this place is only accessible for authorized personnel only. The rest of you are only here to redeem your ration stamps for stuff.
column3: 你站在用配给粮票换取食物和设备的地方。这些设施位于地下，这的空间似乎比上面的建筑更宽阔。这里大部分地方只有授权人员才能进入。剩下的人只是来兑换配给粮票来换东西的。

column2: DMC-issued. These are also given to DMC guards and operatives but we have to pay for these. They only cost a single ration stamp.
column3: DMC发布。DMC-发行。这些也提供给底特律的警卫和特工，但我们就必须要为此付费。它们只需要1张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamp for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with the packaged food.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着包装好的食物给你。

column2: Rubber gloves are one of the most basic pieces of worker equipment. They have decent insulation and offer some protection for your hands. The Depot offer these in pairs for three ration stamps.
column3: 橡胶手套是工作者最基本的装备之一。它们有很好的绝缘性，可为你的手提供一些保护。仓库提供一对需3张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a box and the pair that is for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一个盒子和一双给你。

column2: Rubber boots are one of the most basic pieces of worker equipment. They have decent insulation and offer some protection for your feet. The Depot offer these in pairs for six ration stamps.
column3: 橡胶靴是工作者最基本的装备之一。它们有很好的绝缘性，可为你的脚提供一些保护。仓库提供一对需6张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a pair of new rubber boots for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一对全新橡胶靴给你。

column2: Hard hats offer a decent amount of protection against damage. The high visibility color makes it harder to hide, though. These are only available to skilled mechanics. The Depot offer these for five ration stamps.
column3: 安全帽提供了相当程度的防护以防止损伤。不过，高能见度的颜色使其更难隐藏。这些只有熟练的技工才能获取。仓库提供这个需5张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a bunch of hard hats and leaves one for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一大叠安全帽并给你留了一个。

column2: Hard hats offer a decent amount of protection against damage. The high visibility color makes it harder to hide, though. These are only available to skilled electricians. The Depot offer these for five ration stamps.
column3: 安全帽提供了相当程度的防护以防止损伤。不过，高能见度的颜色使其更难隐藏。这些只有熟练的电工才能获取。仓库提供这个需5张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a bunch of hard hats and leaves one for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一大叠安全帽并给你留了一个。

column2: Standard workgear cargo pants with high visibility stripes. These are available to any worker. The Depot offer these for four ration stamps.
column3: 带有高能见度条纹的标准工作装工装裤。任何工作者都可以获取。仓库提供它们需4张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a pair of new workgear cargo pants.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一条全新的工作装工装裤给你。

column2: Standard workgear jacket with high visibility stripes. These are only available to skilled mechanics. The Depot offer these for two ration stamps.
column3: 带有高能见度条纹的标准工作装夹克。这些只有熟练的技工才能获取。仓库提供这个需2张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a box and leaves a bunch on a surface. A new workgear jacket is taken out of the bunch for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一个盒子到来并在地板留下一大叠。一件全新的工作装夹克从一大叠取出给你。

column2: Standard workgear vest with high visibility pads. These are only available to skilled electricians. The Depot offer these for two ration stamps.
column3: 带有高能见度衬垫的标准工作装背心。这些只有熟练的电工才能获取。仓库提供这个需2张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a box and leaves a bunch on a surface. A new workgear vest is taken out of the bunch for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一个盒子到来并在地板留下一大叠。一件全新的工作装背心从一大叠取出给你。

column2: XM54 gas mask. A must if you are dealing with a gas leak. The Depot offer these for six ration stamps.
column3: XM54 防毒面具.当你要应对毒气泄漏时必备。仓库提供这个需6张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a new gas mask for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一个全新的防毒面具给你。

column2: XM54 gas masks can take two filters so the Depot offer these in pairs for three ration stamps.
column3: XM54 防毒面具能装两个滤芯，因此仓库成对提供这些滤芯需3张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a couple of gas mask filters for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一对防毒面具滤芯给你。

column2: Check your things in the main hall.
You rummage through your things. Better make sure you didn't leave something behind.
column3: 你翻找自己的东西。最好确保你没落下什么东西。

column2: The SCBA equipment includes both the breathing mask and chest rig. The Depot offer these for sixteen ration stamps.
column3: SCBA 装备包括呼吸面罩和胸部装束。仓库提供这个需16张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with SCBA gear for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一套 SCBA 装备给你。

column2: Chemico o2 canister. SCBA equipment requires one of these to work. The Depot offer these for seven ration stamps.
column3: 化工氧气罐。SCBA 装备需要这些中的一个才能工作。仓库提供这个需7张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a single canister of o2 for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着一罐氧气给你。

column2: A set of DMC-issued hazmat suit. Rubber gloves and boots not included. The full set and a working SCBA gear qualify as level A hazard protection. The Depot offer this for twenty ration stamps.
column3: 一套 DMC-分配的防护服。橡胶手套和靴子不包括在内。全套和一个工作中的SCBA装备符合A级危险保护。仓库提供这个需20张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the stack of ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with a box containing the suit pieces for you.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着装有服装的盒子给你。
索要 T 恤和帽子。

column2: DMC-issued t-shirt and cap with the DSL logo in them. The best way for others to tell you do work for the DSL. The Depot offer these for a single ration stamp.
column3: DMC-分配的带有DSL 标志的T恤和帽子。告诉别人你在为DSL工作的最好方式。仓库提供这个需1张配给粮票。
兑换 T 恤和帽子。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamp for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with the t-shirt and the cap on top of it.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着它们的T恤和帽子来了。

column2: DMC-issued backpack with a big DSL logo at the back. The best way for others to tell you do work for the DSL. The Depot offer these for four ration stamps.
column3: DMC-分配的背面带有大DSL标志的背包。告诉别人你在为DSL工作的最好方式。仓库提供这个需4张配给粮票。

column2: The worker at the other side of the glass inspects the ration stamps for a moment. Soon enough, another one arrives with the backpack assigned to your stamps.
column3: 在玻璃窗另一边的工作人员检查了一会儿配给粮票。之后另一个人带着用粮票分配的背包来了。

column2:
Your number is called and you head to the corresponding window. "DSL form, work permit, skill program, or work," a tired looking office worker behind the window spits without even looking at you.

"Work," you quickly answer. "Work, then. Lets see," she mumbles to herself as she practically smashes a keyboard button, and the light from the screen paints her face blue.
column3: 你的号码被叫到，你走到相应的窗口。“取DSL 表格、办理工作许可证、参加培训计划或接受工作”;窗户后面一个看起来很疲惫的办公职员甚至看都没看你一眼就吐了一口唾沫。"找工作," 你马上回答道。“那就工作吧。"工作，那我们来看看吧," 她一边喃喃自语道一边几乎按下一个键盘按钮，屏幕光将她的脸染成蓝色。

column2:
"work... work, wooork, here, wait no," The office drone continues to mumble as she leans closer into the screen of her machine. "Here. We sent a mechanic to repair an underground water pipe in the sprawl. He called some time ago requesting help. Go and see what needs to be done." the drone says as she picks up her ringing smartphone.

Just as you are about to ask how to even find this person, the worker interrupts. "Just look for work in progress signs around a manhole. Look, there's only one mechanic doing that kind of work today. It'll be hard to miss," the drone finishes as she answers her phone and closes her curtain.

You sigh and leave.
column3: "工作... 工作, 工...作, 在这, 等下，不," 当她更靠近她的机器屏幕时，办公无人机继续喃喃自语。"在这。我们派了一名技工去修理延展区的地下水管。他前段时间打电话来请求帮助。去看看需要做什么。" 无人机一边说着，她一边拿起响起的智能手机。正当你正要问如何才能找到这个人时，工作人员打断了你。"只需寻找下水道井口周围正在施工的标志就知道了。听好，现在只有一名技工在干这种活。不会错过的," 当她拉上窗帘并接听电话时无人机说完了。你叹着气离开了。

column2:
As you walk through the sprawl, you come across a working area setup around a manhole, just as the office drone foretold. There's a mechanic sitting over a crate, typing something in his smartphone.

He scans the area as you get close and both of you look at eachother akwardly for a couple of seconds. "You must be the help that lady from the center told me about," he says as he stands up.

You nod at him. "So, what do you need me to help with?" you ask as he starts to position at one side of the crate he was using as seat. "We need to replace a pipe section with the new one in here. The people that delivered this crate just left and I can't lower this on my own," the mechanic explains as you both carry the crate to the side of the manhole.
column3: 当你穿过这片延展区时，你看到一个围绕下水道口设置的工作区，就像办公无人机预先说的那样。有个技工坐在板条箱旁，正用智能手机输字。当你靠近他时，他扫了一眼周围，然后你们两面面相觑了几秒。"中心的那位女士告诉我的那个帮手肯定是你了," 他说着并站了起来。你朝他点头。"那，你需要我帮什么忙?"你在问的时候他开始指着刚才正坐着的板条箱上 "我们需要把这里的一段管子换成新的。运送这个板条箱的人刚走了，我无法单独一人换下它," 技工一边解释道，你们俩一起把板条箱搬到下水道口旁。

column2:
As you walk through the sprawl, you suddenly get a notification in your device. Unknown contact but it's about that pipe repair job you got from the center. They tracked your device to put you in contact with the other worker.
			
You follow the directions and you get to a mechanic sitting over a crate, typing something in his smartphone.

He scans the area as you get close and stands up as he notices you. "You must be the help that lady from the center told me about. Don't ask me how they can just get our numbers or send us messages but at least it makes things easier," he says as you both shake hands.

"So, what do you need me to help you with?" you ask as he starts to position at one side of the crate he was using as seat. "We need to replace a pipe section with the new one in here. The people that delivered this crate just left and I can't lower this on my own," the mechanic explains as you both carry the crate to the side of the manhole.
column3: 当你穿过这片延展区时，你突然在你的设备上收到一个通知。联系人未知但是是关于你从中心接到的管道维修工作的。你按照指示找到一个坐在板条箱前正用智能手机输字的技工。当你靠近时，他扫视周围注意到你，然后他站了起来。"中心的那位女士告诉我的那个帮手肯定是你了.不要问我他们是怎么弄到我们的电话号码或怎么给我们发信息的，但至少这让事情变得简单了," 他一边说一边和你握手。不要问我他们如何得到我们的号码或给我们发信息，但至少这让事情变得更容易，”他在你们握手时说道。"那，你需要我帮什么忙?"你在问的时候他开始指着刚才正坐着的板条箱上 "我们需要把这里的一段管子换成新的。运送这个板条箱的人刚走了，我无法单独一人换下它," 技工一边解释道，你们俩一起把板条箱搬到下水道口旁。

column2:
"Any ideas on how we could take this thing down?" he asks as he puts on some old leather gloves.
			
"I thought about just throwing the crate down the manhole since it's just a pipe section, but maybe the DSL has people watching or something. I might be just paranoid but I don't wanna risk my work permit."
column3: "有什么办法能搞定这东西吗?" 他边戴上旧皮手套边问道。"我想把板条箱直接扔进下水道，因为那只是个管道部件，但也许有DSL的人在看着或什么的。可能是我有点多疑，但我不想拿我的工作许可冒险。"

column2:
"That's gonna be real bad for you. I've got some straps so we can at least have a better grip of the crate," he says as he starts to work on the box.
			
After a moment, you go down the ladder first and get ready to recieve the box. The mechanic caefully hands you the crate while he grips the straps to help lightening the weight. You both slowly climb down the ladder and place the box on the ground.

"Phew! Now to open this thing," he says while forcing the crate open with a crowbar. "Alright, now we need to replace the damaged section with this one. Got your wrench at hand? If not, then you hold the pipe in place while I work on it," he says as you both place the pipe on a sleed he had down here already.
column3: "这对你来说真的很糟糕。我有一些带子，这样我们至少可以更好地抓牢箱子," 他边说边开始在盒子上干活。片刻之后, 你先爬下梯子，准备去接那箱子。技工小心翼翼地把板条箱递给你，同时他紧抓带子以助减轻重量。你们俩慢慢地爬下梯子并将箱子放在地上。"唷!现在打开这玩意," 他边说边用撬棍强行撬开板条箱。"好了，现在我们需要用这个替换损坏的部分。手头有扳手吗?如果没有，那你就把管道抓稳，我去弄," 他一边说你们俩一边把管道放在他提前放下来的雪橇上。

column2:
"That's gonna be real bad for you. I've got some straps so we can at least have a better grip of the crate," he says as he starts to work on the box.
			
After a moment, you go down the ladder first and get ready to recieve the box. The mechanic caefully hands you the crate while he grips the straps to help lightening the weight. You both slowly climb down the ladder and place the box on the ground.

"Phew! Now to open this thing," he says while forcing the crate open with a crowbar. "Alright, now we need to replace the damaged section with this one. Got your wrench at hand? If not, then you hold the pipe in place while I work on it," he says as you both place the pipe on a sleed he had down here already.
column3: "这对你来说真的很糟糕。我有一些带子，这样我们至少可以更好地抓牢箱子," 他边说边开始在盒子上干活。片刻之后, 你先爬下梯子，准备去接那箱子。技工小心翼翼地把板条箱递给你，同时他紧抓带子以助减轻重量。你们俩慢慢地爬下梯子并将箱子放在地上。"唷!现在打开这玩意," 他边说边用撬棍强行撬开板条箱。"好了，现在我们需要用这个替换损坏的部分。手头有扳手吗?如果没有，那你就把管道抓稳，我去弄," 他一边说你们俩一边把管道放在他提前放下来的雪橇上。

column2:
"I've got some straps we can use," you say as you take them out. "I've got some too. We could use it to lower the crate with less effort," the mechanic says as he takes yours and starts to strap the crate.
			
After a moment, you go down the ladder first and get ready to recieve the box. The mechanic caefully lowers the crate using the straps and you safely grab the crate and help taking it to the ground. The mechanic climbs down the ladder and joins you.

"Phew! Now to open this thing," he says while forcing the crate open with a crowbar. "Alright, now we need to replace the damaged section with this one. Got your wrench at hand? If not, then you hold the pipe in place while I work on it," he says as you both place the pipe on a sleed he had down here already.
column3: "我有些我们能用到的带子," 你边说边把它们拿出来。"我也有一些。我们可以用它来更省力地降下板条箱," 技工边说边拿起你的带子并开始系到箱子上。片刻之后, 你先爬下梯子，准备去接那箱子。机械师使用带子小心翼翼地降下板条箱，你安全地接住板条箱并连忙将它放到地上。技工爬下梯子来到你身边。"唷!现在打开这玩意," 他边说边用撬棍强行撬开板条箱。"好了，现在我们需要用这个替换损坏的部分。手头有扳手吗?如果没有，那你就把管道抓稳，我去弄," 他一边说你们俩一边把管道放在他提前放下来的雪橇上。

column2:
"Alright, then. Lets head there. I already took a look so I know where this thing is," he says as you both drag the sled. "These sewers can lead into the DMC but the tunnels leading there are blocked and heavily guarded," the mechanic speaks as you both make your way.

"Here we are. Now lets finish this so we get our stams and call it a day," he says. The mechanic starts to remove the bolts of the old pipe while you get ready to do the heavy lifting. Eventually, the old piece falls to the ground, the metallic tud echoing erily.

You both position at each side of the pipe. "You ready? One, two and..." he counts as you both lift the piece and place it on your shoulder. You move into position and the mechanic starts to work on it as soon as he can. He places enough bolts for you to go and rest your shoulder.

"And done. Lets give them a call so we can see if things are alright," he says as he types in his smartphone.
column3: "好了,那么。我们过去那儿吧。我已经看过那了，所以我知道这东西在哪," 他一边拖着雪橇一边说。"这些下水道可以通往底特律，但那里的隧道被封锁并有重兵把守。你们俩走在路上时技工说道。"我们到了。现在让咋们搞定它然后去领粮票，今天就到此为止收工了," 他说道。当你准备搬起重物时，机械师开始拆除旧管道上的螺栓。终于，旧部件落在地上，沉闷的金属声回荡着。你们俩分别站在管道的两边。"你准备好没?一，二，还有……" 他一边数数一边和你举起这部件并放在你的肩膀上。你就位后技工开始尽其所能地工作。他安装好足够的螺栓去放松你的肩膀。"搞定。让我们通知一下他们，看看一切是否安好," 他边说边在智能手机上输字。

"And done. Lets give them a call so we can see if things are alright," he says as he types in his smartphone.

"Alright, then. Lets head there. I already took a look so I know where this thing is," he says as you both drag the sled. "These sewers can lead into the DMC but the tunnels leading there are blocked and heavily guarded," the mechanic speaks as you both make your way.

"Here we are. Now lets finish this so we get our stams and call it a day," he says. You start to remove the bolts of the old pipe while the mechanic gets ready to do the heavy lifting. Eventually, the old piece falls to the ground, the metallic tud echoing erily.

You both position at each side of the pipe. "You ready? One, two and..." he counts as you both lift the piece and place it on his shoulder. He moves into position and you start to work on it as soon as you can. You place enough bolts for him to go and rest his shoulder.

"Looks like we are done here. Lets give them a call so we can see if things are alright," he says as he types in his smartphone.
column3: "好了,那么。我们过去那儿吧。我已经看过那了，所以我知道这东西在哪," 他一边拖着雪橇一边说。"这些下水道可以通往底特律，但那里的隧道被封锁并有重兵把守。你们俩走在路上时技工说道。"我们到了。现在让咋们搞定它然后去领粮票，今天就到此为止收工了," 他说道。当技工准备搬起重物时，你开始拆除旧管道上的螺栓。最终，旧部件落在地上，沉闷的金属声回荡着。你们俩分别站在管道的两边。"你准备好没?一，二，还有……" 他一边数数一边和你举起这部件并放在他的肩膀上。技工就位后你开始尽其所能地工作。你安装好足够的螺栓去放松他的肩膀。"看来我们搞定这事了。让我们通知一下他们，看看一切是否安好,"他边说边在智能手机上输字。

column2:
After a moment, you start to hear the underground pipes vibrate and the section starts to leak a bit. "Alright, that's fine... errr, here, help me with the compression couplings," he says as you both start to adjust the fittings. Soon enough, the leaking starts to decrease.
			
"Well, the leaking seems to be fixed. I see leaking in some of the other sections but that's not our problem." he says as he loads the damaged pipe in the sled. "Time to call the DSL. They will send someone to check out our work and pay us in the spot." he explains.

Eventually, the sound of footsteps start to fill the relative quitness of these tunnels. It's a DSL overseer along with a DMC guard. You both nod at them and the overseer gets to work. He calls someone and start to talk about water pressure and how there's always something else that break. You get paid three ration stamps.

You all walk towards the exit and arrive at the ladder. The damaged pipe section stays here. It's someone's else problem now. You shake hands with the mechanic and nod at the DMC people before making your way into the dirt streets of the sprawl.
column3: 片刻之后，你听到地下管道震动并且该部分开始有点泄露。"行吧, 这还好... 呃..., 这, 帮我弄一下压缩接头," 他说着你们就一起调整起配件。很快，泄漏开始变少。"很好, 漏水的地方似乎已经修好了。我看到一些其他的部件泄露，但那不管我们事。" 他边说边把损坏的管道装到雪橇上。"该通知给DSL了。他们会派人来检查我们的工作并当场支付报酬给我们。"他解释道。 终于, 脚步声开始充斥在相对安静的隧道。是一名 DSL 监工和一名 DMC 警卫。你们俩朝他们点头，然后监工开始工作。他打电话给某人并开始交谈关于水压和这总是有东西会破裂。你得到三张配给粮票。你们都向出口走去，来到梯子处。损坏的管道部件留在这里。现在这是别人的事情。你与技师握手并向DMC的人点点头，然后进入延展区肮脏的街道。
24小时圣詹姆斯停车场通行证

column2:
Soon enough, you see someone in a work vest pushing a cart coming your way. "Oi, here's your pass. If you are interested in extending it or whatever, go to the ticket office opposite of the main entrance," he says as he pushes his cart towards one of the other vehicles.
			
You look at the pass for a moment and then pocket it.
column3: 很快, 你看到一个穿着工作背心的人推着手推车向你走来。"喂, 这是你的通行证。如果你想延长时间还是啥的，就去正门对面的售票处," 他一边说一边把手推车推向另一辆车。你看了一会儿通行证，然后将它装进口袋里。
圣詹姆斯停车场 网站

column2:
You access the address in your device. The screen takes a moment to load some of it but it eventually displays the website.

The St. James Parkade website has been clearly repurposed, so most of the information it displays is of no use. The first option available is the parking status, which requires a parking number as login.

There's also the option to extend the parking duration but it requires credit card information.
column3: 你用自己的设备访问该网站。屏幕需要一些时间来加载，最终它会显示网站。圣詹姆斯停车场 网站 已经明显被改变用途, 因此它显示的大部分信息都没用。第一个选项是停车状态，登录时需要一个停车号码。你也可以选择延长停车时间，但这需要信用卡信息。

column2:
Using PC cleaning software or anything that deletes cookies could also delete saves.

Never save and quit the game while having a Laptop or similar device on. It's likely the devices will be off and some apps and/or data lost when you load the game.

Sometimes using items will result in invisible items on the floor instead of the proper drops. This fixes itself when you switch screens.

The game will delete the excess of items if too many of them drop onto the ground and campsite area.

Changing resolutions might cause a weird inventory issue, in which items might be off-screen or outside inventory spaces.
column3: 使用 PC 清理软件或任何删除 cookie 的工具也可能会删除存档。切勿在使用旧笔记本电脑或类似设备时保存并退出游戏。当加载游戏时，设备可能会关闭并且某些应用程序和/或数据会丢失。有时使用物品会导致地板上出现无形的物品而不是正常掉落。当你切换屏幕时它会自行修复。游戏将删除过多的物品，如果它们掉到地面和营地区域里过多。改变分辨率可能会导致奇怪的库存问题，其中物品可能会出现在屏幕外或库存空间之外。

column2:
You hear a faint sound that seems to come from a distance. You recognize it as the sound of a plane but the loud noise of an explosion startles you. The engine sound starts to get louder and it prompts you to look around at the sky. You see a smoky fireball coming your way and you start to retreat, still looking at it.

You eventually turn around and start to run away from the area. The loud engine sound is soon replaced by the horrible sound of a crash and crunching metal. You look back and see the thing engulfed in flames and on the ground but still coming your way.

You look back again and stop running when you notice it's not actually going after you and is slowing down. There's flames on the path it took when it crash-landed in the distance and an already-tall plume of dark black smoke rising above the site.

You just witnessed a plane crash. Is it worth checking it out? Maybe there's survivors or something of value, but it could also be dangerous.
column3:
You hear a faint sound that seems to come from a distance. You recognize it as the sound of a plane but the loud noise of an explosion startles you. The engine sound starts to get louder and it prompts you to look around at the sky. You see a smoky fireball coming your way and you start to retreat, still looking at it.

You eventually turn around and start to run away from the area. The loud engine sound is soon replaced by the horrible sound of a crash and crunching metal. You look back and see the thing engulfed in flames and on the ground but still coming your way.

You look back again and stop running when you notice it's not actually going after you and is slowing down. There's flames on the path it took when it crash-landed in the distance and an already-tall plume of dark black smoke rising above the site.

You just witnessed a plane crash. Is it worth checking it out? Maybe there's survivors or something of value, but it could also be dangerous.

column2:
The wreckage is still engulfed in flames. It could explode when least expected so you decide to leave.

As you walk, you hear the noise of metal and small explosions in the distance. Suddenly, you feel a push and everything shakes. The sound of the biggest explosion soon follows and you turn around. The wreckage is now a huge fireball.

You are glad you left when you did as you see the fireball die off, leaving only a tower of black smoke and scattered scrap.
column3:
The wreckage is still engulfed in flames. It could explode when least expected so you decide to leave.

As you walk, you hear the noise of metal and small explosions in the distance. Suddenly, you feel a push and everything shakes. The sound of the biggest explosion soon follows and you turn around. The wreckage is now a huge fireball.

You are glad you left when you did as you see the fireball die off, leaving only a tower of black smoke and scattered scrap.

column2:
As you walk closer to the crash site, you notice the shape of the craft is not even close to that of a plane. It's also not a wreck either... at least not yet.

You can hear the sound of sizzling coming from different locations but you can't see any source. You walk towards a metal hatch with the words "Airlock," followed by oriental characters.

You see lights and a panel on the airlock. There's a lockdown on it but it might be possible to force it open.
column3:
As you walk closer to the crash site, you notice the shape of the craft is not even close to that of a plane. It's also not a wreck either... at least not yet.

You can hear the sound of sizzling coming from different locations but you can't see any source. You walk towards a metal hatch with the words "Airlock," followed by oriental characters.

You see lights and a panel on the airlock. There's a lockdown on it but it might be possible to force it open.

column2: Rewire the panel and stop the hatch override.
column3: Rewire the panel and stop the hatch override.

column2:
Everything in the panel is in both english and in another language. The OS is pretty utilitarian but simple to mess with. The panel is already damaged so you just force it open.

You take a look at the wiring and start to mess around with the connections. You manage to remove the override and manipulate the panel into opening the hatch.

Inside, you see a small room with another hatch. The lights in this hatch are green so hopefully that's a good thing.
column3:
Everything in the panel is in both english and in another language. The OS is pretty utilitarian but simple to mess with. The panel is already damaged so you just force it open.

You take a look at the wiring and start to mess around with the connections. You manage to remove the override and manipulate the panel into opening the hatch.

Inside, you see a small room with another hatch. The lights in this hatch are green so hopefully that's a good thing.

column2:
Everything in the panel is in both english and in another language so you leave it alone and reach for your prying tool.

Threading your tool through the hatch opening, you position yourself to maximize your leverage, and pry. It takes a bit of effort but you manage to open it enough go through the opening.

Inside, you see a small room with another hatch. The lights in this hatch are green so hopefully that's a good thing.
