column2:
You move to the hatch opposite the exit one in the airlock and press the open button in it. As the hatch opens you see smoke and flickering lights inside but no fire.

You stand in a room or hallway with what appear to be two rows of batteries all wired to a box with switches. Everything seem to be powered and working without issues in here.

You can either go back inside or leave the area.
column3:
You move to the hatch opposite the exit one in the airlock and press the open button in it. As the hatch opens you see smoke and flickering lights inside but no fire.

You stand in a room or hallway with what appear to be two rows of batteries all wired to a box with switches. Everything seem to be powered and working without issues in here.

You can either go back inside or leave the area.

column2:
You make your way outside from the airlock.

You can hear the sound of sizzling coming from different locations but you can't see any source. You turn around to look back at the airlock.

You can either go back inside or leave the area.
column3:
You make your way outside from the airlock.

You can hear the sound of sizzling coming from different locations but you can't see any source. You turn around to look back at the airlock.

You can either go back inside or leave the area.

column2:
The vehicle stops in a parking space. You see people working on the lines already as you all exit the vehicle. "Alright, you two. The power lines powering this substation are already repaired so the reason the lights are still off must be an issue in one of the junction boxes in the power hubs," the worker says and points towards a section of the building.

"Inspect every box. The other teams reported fried wires so that makes the issue easier to spot but a bitch to fix," he continues as he grabs a box and spare wiring. You both walk into the building. Your partner lights the path around and you spot long hallways with junction boxes.

"Alright, lets not waste any more time. This could take a while, unless you got a EMF reader or something," he says as he lights the way forward and then the first junction box.
column3: 汽车停在个停车位上。当你们下车时，你看到有人已经在电线上工作了。"好了, 两位。为这个变电站供电的电线已经修好了，所以灯仍然不亮的原因一定是电力集线器的一个接线盒有问题," 工人边说边指着大楼的一个地方。"检查每一个箱子。其他团队报告有炸线，所以这使得问题更容易被发现，但解决起来却很麻烦," 他继续说着时抓起一个盒子和备用电线。你们俩一起走进大楼。你的搭档照亮了周围的路，你发现这条长廊里有接线盒。"好了，咋们不要再浪费时间了。这可能要弄好一会, 除非你有EMF读数器或之类的东西," 他一边说一边照亮了前面的路，然后这是第一个接线盒。

column2:
"Wait, I do have an EMF reader, actually," you mention as you show him the powered reader. "Perfect! I forgot mine at home since it's not often I do this kind of work but yours is gonna make this a breeze," he says with a noticeable smile on his face.

You both start to scan junction boxes. Your device allows you to check them much faster and you eventually find a junction box that shows no activity.
column3: "慢着，事实上我有EMF读数器,"你一边向他展示启动的读数器一边提起道。"妙极了!我把我的忘在家里了，因为我不常做这种工作但你的这个会让这事变得很轻松," 他脸上带着明显的微笑说道。你们开始扫描接线盒。你的设备可以让你更快地检查它们，最后你发现一个接线盒显示没有动静。

column2:
You both get in position and start to open the junction box. He hands you his screwdriver and provides light so you can unscrew the front panel.
			
You do so and leave the panel on the ground. "Aight, lets see..." he speaks as he takes the screwdriver and starts to examine the innards of the junction box. "Ahh... it's not this one. This one is fine. Lets try the next one," he says, disapointed.

You look for the next junction box.
column3: 你们俩各就各位然后开始打开接线盒。他把螺丝刀递给你并提供灯光，这样你就可以拧开外板的螺丝。你这么做并将面板放在地上。"很好, 来看看..." 他边说边拿起螺丝刀，开始检查接线盒内部。"啊... 不是这个。这个是好的。我们试试下一个," 他失望地说。你寻找下一个接线盒。

column2:
"Here, help me with this one," he requests as he hands you his flashlight. You shine light on the front panel so he can open it.
			
He eventually unscrews the panel leaves it on the ground. "Aight, lets see..." he speaks as you hand him the flashlight and he starts to examine the innards of the junction box. "Yeah... Not this one either," he says, disapointed.

You both head towards the next junction box.
column3: "这里, 来帮我弄这个," 他一边把手电筒递给你一边请求道。你把灯照在外板上，这样他就能打开了。最后他拧开面板，将它放在地上。"好了, 来看看..." 当你把手电筒递给他时他说道，然后他开始检查接线盒内部。“是啊……"行吧... 也不是这个," 他失望地说。你们俩朝下一个接线盒走去。

column2:
"Aight, let's see what we got here," he says as you both prepare to open the next junction box. "This one looks promising," he says as he hands you his flashlight and starts to unscrew the front panel.

He removes the panel and places it on the ground. "Aight, here. See this?" he asks as he points towards a bunch of burned wires. "Lets fix this so we can go home already," he says as he places the box with wiring on the floor.
column3: "好了, 让我们瞧瞧这有什么," 他边说边准备打开下一个接线盒。"这个看起来很有希望," 他边说边把手电筒递给你，然后开始拧开外板。他拧开面板并将它放在地上。"很好, 是这。看看这个?" 他指着一堆烧焦的电线问道。"让我们一起搞定它，然后我们就能回家了," 他边说边把装有电线的盒子放在地上。

column2:
After a while of removing the burned wiring and rewiring, you place the panel back on its place. "Done, and done. Now, let there be light!" he says as he flips the switch on.
			
The lights in the building immediately assault your eyes, forcing you to close them for a minute. You hear cheering at the distance. Probably a group of people in the sector now happy they can go back to whatever they were doing.

"Aight, man. Lets get out of here," he says as you both gather your things to exit the building.
column3: 经过一段时间的拆除烧毁电线和重新布线，你把面板装回原处。"结束, 搞定了。现在，让这变亮吧!" 他边说边打开开关。大楼里的灯光立刻照到你的眼睛，你不得不闭上了一会眼睛。你听到了远处的欢呼声。可能是这个地方其他的人在为他们可以回去做自己的事情而高兴着。"好了, 伙计。让我们离开这吧," 他边说边收拾东西准备离开大楼。

column2:
Outside, The linemen are sitting on the pavement, eating and having a drink. Someone from their group aproaches you, clipboard in hand. It's a DSL overseer. You both look at eachother and start to head her way.
			
You both report your work to her and answer some questions. You both get paid three ration stamps each. She doesn't stay for long and gets a call while she walks towards a vehicle waiting at the other side of the street. 

You join the group you came here and after some small talk, you all board your vehicle and leave the area. You are all dropped near gate 11, just some blocks away from the work center. You say your goodbyes and shake hands with your temporary coworkers, who head into different directions. Some of them heading back to the work center.
column3: 外面，线路工人们正坐在路上吃吃喝喝。他们那组里有人拿着写字板向你走来。是一名DSL监工。你俩面面相觑然后开始朝她走去。你们俩都向她汇报工作并回答了一些问题。你们每人都得到三张配给粮票。然而还没待多久，她就接到了一个电话然后朝一辆在街对面等着的车走去。你们和一起来的小组汇合并聊了几句后，就全部上车离开这对方了。你们都在11号大门下车，离工作中心只有几个条街。你和你的临时同事握手道别，他们正朝着不同的方向走。其中的一些人正返回工作中心去。

column2: Use a shovel to increase your chances to find plant-based loot and more of it.
column3: 使用铲子可以增加你找到植物类战利品的几率。

column2: Use a shovel to increase your chances to find loot.
column3: 使用铲子来增加你找到战利品的几率。
近地球轨道飞行器残骸

column2:
You hear a faint sound that seems to come from a distance. You recognize it as the sound of a jet plane but the loud noise of an explosion startles you and prompts you to look around at the sky. You see a smoky blast dissipating, and a number of fireballs flying out of it, one of them coming your way. You start to retreat, still looking at it.

As you track its path you immediately tell it's not coming directly at you. You witness the debris crash some distance from you. It's engulfed in flames and on the ground, the loud noise of bending and breaking metal can be heard accompanying the sound of the raging fire.


You just witnessed a plane accident of some kind. It exploded, or was taken out, in mid air and a decent chunk landed near you. Is it worth checking it out? There's no way someone survived this but there might be something of value, but it could also be dangerous.
column3: 你听到一个似乎是从远处传来的微弱的声音。你认出这是喷气式飞机的声音，但巨大的爆炸声吓了你一跳并促使你环顾天空。你看到阵阵烟雾冲击消散，许多火球从里面飞出来，其中一个朝你飞来。你开始退后，但仍然看着它。当你看着它的踪迹时，你立刻就知道它并非直接朝你飞来。你看到残骸在离你很远的地方坠毁。它在地面上被火焰吞没，能听到伴随着熊熊大火的金属弯曲与断裂的巨大响声。你刚刚目睹了一场坠机事故。它一整个或者是一部分爆炸了，在半空中有一大块落在你附近。这值得一看吗?没人能从那生还，但可能会有些有价值的东西，但也可能有危险。

column2:
The wreckage is still engulfed in flames. It could explode when least expected so you decide to leave.

As you walk, you hear the noise of metal and small explosions in the distance. After a while, you turn around to see only some towers of black smoke at the distance.
column3: 残骸仍被火焰吞没。它可能会在最意想不到的时候再次爆炸，所以你决定离开。当你走着的时候，你听到远处的金属噪音和小型爆炸声。过了一会儿，你转过身来只看到远处的浓烟高耸入云。

column2:
As you walk closer to the wreckage, you realize it covers quite an area. You start to see scattered debris all around you.

You eventually arrive at the source of most of the smoke. The wreckage is really damaged but it appears to be a section of the aircraft. You see writing at the side but it is just numbers and oriental characters under it. You spot the remains of what appears to be solar panels. Wait, was this a spacecraft?

You take a look and spot metal crates inside. There's smoke coming out of most of them so the contents are probably destroyed by fire.
column3: 当你走近残骸时，你发现它覆盖了相当大的区域。你开始去看周围散落的残骸。你终于来到了大部分烟雾的源头。残骸损坏确切但它似乎是飞机的一部分。你看到旁边有字，但下面只有数字和东方文字。你发现了似乎是太阳能电池板的残骸。等下，这是航天飞行器吗?你看了一眼并发现里面有金属箱子。它们大部分都冒着烟，所以里面的东西很可能已经被火烧毁了。

column2:
You examine the metal crate, and notice you won't need any tools to open it. For this reason, it seems most of the stuff that was inside is now missing, probably flew away as soon as the crate broke open.
			
Still, anything from the space stations or off-world colonies are probably worth something, right?
column3: 你检查了金属箱子并注意到你不会需要任何工具去打开它。原因是，似乎里面的大部分东西现在都没了，可能是箱子一破开就全飞走了。不过，空间站或太空殖民地的任何东西可能都是值得的，对吧?

column2:
You examine the metal crate, and notice a green light, over an open padlock sign. You raise an eyebrown and press a button near one of the magnetic locks, causing the crate to open a bit. You reach out and open it all the way and reveal the contents.
			
Anything from the space stations or off-world colonies are probably worth something so you wonder if you have enough space to carry space gear.
column3: 你检查了金属板条箱，注意到开着的一个挂锁标志上方有一盏绿灯。你按下其中一个磁性锁附近的按钮并惊讶地发现箱子打开了一点。你伸向它并完全打开露出里面的东西。空间站或太空殖民地的任何东西都可能有价值，所以你想知道你是否有足够的空间去带走太空装备。

column2:
You examine the metal crate, and notice a red light, over an closed padlock sign. You raise an eyebrown and press a button near one of the magnetic locks, causing the light to blink and a taunting 'access denied' blip sound.
			
You consider your options:
column3: 你检查了金属板条箱，注意到关掉的一个挂锁标志上方有一盏红灯。你按下其中一个磁性锁附近的按钮然后惊讶地发现灯光闪烁起来并发出‘拒绝访问’的哔哔声 你考虑你的选择:您考虑您的选择：

column2: After a while of just messing around with the damn thing, you decide to just forget about it and exit the area.
column3: 只是在瞎折腾了这该死的玩意一段时间后，你决定不管它并离开这个地方。

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion. You force the crate open from multiple angles. The lights on it eventually go off but you manage to force it open.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已为这样的场合做好了准备。你从多个角度强行撬开箱子。灯最后熄灭了，但你设法强行将其打开了。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2: Use an RFID spoofer to open the crate.
column3: 使用 RFID 欺骗软件打开箱子。

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion. You access your PDA and launch the software in "brute" mode, and start running codes. After a while, the software registers a hit, the crate light switches from red to green, and the locks click open.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已为这样的场合做好了准备。你打开你的PDA然后启动软件的“暴力”模式并开始运行代码。过了一会，软件运算出答案， 箱子的灯光从红色转换成绿色，锁咔哒一声打开了。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2:
As you get close to the front of the line, one of the heavily armed guards aproaches and pulls you to the side of the line. "Get that thing off your face," the guard spits as he signals the rest to keep moving.

This is a checkpoint, after all. They do require you to show your face.

You only have two options here...
column3: 当你靠近队伍的前头时，一名全副武装的警卫走近并把你拉到队伍的一边。“把那玩意从你脸上拿开”;警卫怒斥道并示意其他人继续前进。毕竟这是个检查点。他们肯定要你露出自己的脸。你只有两个选择...

column2:
You decide to just leave. You cross the muddy square, and stop to survey the area.

What now?
column3: 你决定离开。你穿过泥泞的广场，然后停下来观察这片地方。接下来呢?

column2: Comply and back into the line.
You decide to comply. The guard looks at you for a couple of seconds and then stops the line. You take your new place with the others entering the city.
column3: 你决定服从。保安看了你几秒钟然后停下了队伍。你排进新的位置和其他人一起进城。

column2:
As you get close to the front of the line, one of the heavily armed guards aproaches and pulls you out of the line. "You are not entering like that, buddy," the guard spits as he signals the rest to keep moving.

As you watch him leave, someone from the line calls to you. "Hey! You know the Junk Market, friend? It's actually really close," she says, pointing towards the hard to miss building to the south. "You can sell loot there and buy proper clothing," she continues.

You thank her as she keeps moving forward in line. You cross the muddy square, and stop to survey the area.

What now?
column3: 当你靠近队伍的前头时，一个全副武装的警卫走近并把你拉出了队伍。“你不能这样子进来，老兄。”警卫怒斥道并示意其他人继续前进。当你看着他离开的时候，有人从队伍中叫你。“嘿!你知道旧货市场吗，朋友?其实离这很近。”她说，指着南边那座很难错过的建筑。“你可以在那里卖东西然后买合适的衣服。”她继续讲。当她继续在队伍中向前走时你向她道谢。你穿过泥泞的广场，然后停下来观察这片地方。接下来呢?

column2: You return to the long corridor lined with the familiar harsh xenon lighting. You steadily walk until you eventually join a line of people and vehicles.
column3: 你回到长廊，两旁是熟悉的刺眼氙气灯。你步伐稳健地走着，直到最后你融入了一排人和车之中。

column2: Merging with the crowd and vehicles, you slowly make your way through the exit tunnel into the muddy tent city of the Sprawl.
column3: 人群和车辆渐渐消失，你慢慢地通过隧道出口进入延展城区的泥泞帐篷。

column2:
As you get close to the front of the line, two of the heavily armed guards aproach. The others in the line notice this and step away from you. You are overcome with a sinking feeling. "Are you lost? You, cannibalistic piece of shit," the guard spits he pulls you out of the line pushes you back. You trip and fall to the ground.

"I'm warning you! Get the hell out of here or you will be shot!" He continues as they both train their weapons on you. A drone arrives at the scene, putting you in the middle of a spotlight, literally.

You decide to walk. As you cross the muddy square, you notice the spotlight dissapear. You turn around to see the drone flying away from the area, towards the megacity walls.

What now?
column3: 当你靠近队伍的前头时，两名全副武装的警卫走过来。队伍里的其他人注意到了这一点并且离你远远的。你克服着这种不祥感。“你走丢了吗?”你这吃人的狗屎。”守卫吐了口唾沫，他把你拉出队伍又把你一把推开。你跌了一跤倒在地上。"我警告你!滚出去，不然你就得挨枪子!"他继续说着还都在用他们的武器瞄准你。一架无人机抵达现场，将你置于聚光灯的中心，简直了。你决定走。当你穿过泥泞的广场时，你注意到聚光灯消失了。你转身看到无人机正飞离该区域，飞向城市的超大城墙。接下来呢?
拒绝入境 - 像蓝蛙教

column2:
"Frogger!" a woman behind you screams. The others in the line turn around, notice your blue sash, and step away from you. You are overcome with a sinking feeling as you see them covering their faces with rags or clothing. Suddenly, a stone lands on you. More soon follow, forcing you to cover your face.

"Out of the line, Now!" a guard spits, his gun trained on you, and his presence stopping the stoning. You comply and slowly step away, raising your arms. A drone arrives at the scene, putting you in the middle of a spotlight, literally.

You decide to walk. As you cross the muddy square, you notice the spotlight dissapear. You turn around to see the drone flying away from the area, towards the megacity walls.

What now?
column3: "蓝蛙!" 一个女人在背后尖叫着。队伍中的其他人转过身来，在注意到你的蓝色腰带后离你远远的。当你看到他们用破布或衣服捂着脸时，你克服着这种不祥感。突然，一块石头落在你身上。很快飞来更多，你不得不护住你的脸。"滚出队伍, 马上!" 一名守卫唾骂道，他的枪对准了你，他现身后石头投掷停止了。你服从并慢慢地走开，举起你的双臂。一架无人机抵达现场，将你置于聚光灯的中心，简直了。你决定走。当你穿过泥泞的广场时，你注意到聚光灯消失了。你转身看到无人机正飞离该区域，飞向城市的超大城墙。接下来呢?
拒绝入境 - DMC警卫外观

column2:
Your presence soon starts to draw attention. The others in the line turn around multiple times, confused. You are overcome with a sinking feeling as you see two DMC guards speaking into their comms and blocking the path.
			
You are soon surrounded by better equipped operatives. "Out of the line, Now!" one of the agents screams, his gun aimed at your face. You have no options here but to do as they say.

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows. You are taken into custody for questioning.
column3: 你的出现很快就引起了注意。队伍里的其他人多次回头，很是不解。当你看到两个底特律警卫在用他们的对讲机讲话并封锁了道路时，你克服着这种不祥感。你很快就被装备更好的特工包围。“滚出队伍，马上!”其中一名特工喊道，他用枪指着你的脸。你别无选择只好照他们说的做。你被带到据点南部扶壁下的一扇灰色门前，旁边是一扇窄面窗户。你被拘留盘问了。

column2:
Inside, under pale lighting, you're stripped of stolen DMC property and made to wait in restraints for hours. Drab cubicles divide most of the floor, and stern-looking operatives variously interview detainees, check computers, and disappear into other cubicles.

Your eyes mine every detail of the room, looking for anything interesting to settle on. White foam ceiling tiles, beige filing cabinets, black inbox/outbox trays, pine desktops... it's so sterile that it actually incites frustration.

At the very least, informational posters and propaganda seem to be hung on display to add a splash of color. "DMC Perimeter Services: We Care!" and "Contraband: It hurts all of us."

The "Missing Persons" touchscreen was good for about an hour, but you've memorized all the faces by now.
column3: 惨白的灯光打亮房间内, 你偷来的底特律财产被夺走，并且在拘留中等待数小时。这里都是一个个单调的隔间,神情严肃的特工进行各种细节询问、电脑录入，最后又去了其他隔间。你仔仔细细地观察房间，想找点有趣的东西。塑料泡沫天花板, 米黄色档案柜, 黑色收发箱托盘,松木桌...无聊到令人沮丧。还好, 墙上的信息海报和宣传报还有点意思。"底特律周边服务:交给我们!"和 "走私:害人害己" 那 "寻人启事" 的触屏让你排遣了一小时时光，但你现在已经把他们的脸全记住了。

column2: DMC Questioning - Already exiled II and Wanted
column3: 底特律 盘问 - 已被流放II并被通缉

column2:
Same old ceiling tiles. Same old filing cabinets. Same old missing persons... You were about to fall asleep by the time your case handler arrives.

Your handler leads you to her cubicle, where she sits before you and motions for you to do the same. No word is spoken while she just sits there, scribbling notes, cross-checking a nearby monitor, and a stern glance telling you you're not even worth the effort.

Eventually she stands up, and signals security to come and pick you up. A guard grabs your shoulder, and pushes you into the cinder block room with the blaring speakerphone.

A voice blares, "Subsequent violations of exile, accompanied by other serious crimes are subject to capital punishment. Capital punishment consists of lethal injection, followed by complete body recycling."

You knew coming here was not a good idea but hearing your fate in such a manner still shakes you.
column3: 同样的天花板格子。同样的旧文件柜。同样的失踪人口...同样的失踪人口…处理你案件的人来时你都快睡着了。你的案件处理人将你带到她的隔间，她坐在你面前，示意你也坐下。她只是坐在那里，草草地记下笔记，反复检查旁边的显示器，那严厉的目光像是在告诉你，你在浪费她的时间。最后她站起来，示意安保带你走。一名警卫抓住你的肩膀并将你推进水泥砖砌成的房间，里面的扬声器滋滋作响。一个声音喊道，“违反流放规定，并伴有其他严重罪行随后将处以死刑。”死刑包括注射死刑，然后是回收全尸。你早已知道来到这不是个好主意，但以这种方式得知你的命运仍然让你目瞪口呆。

column2:
A door to your left buzzes, and swings open. Two operatives enter the room, grab your arms and take you outside. You are to be taken into one of many Ecolite Operations recycling centers in the DMC.

An armored, multi-wheeled personnel carrier arrives, bearing the colors of the SkyCorps. Heavily armored operatives emerge from the APC's glaring lights, and escort you up the ramp into the APC's holding area.

Inside, you're strapped into a restraining seat. The guards then step through another bulkhead, and climb a step or two before sealing you in. You're left there, sitting in your restraints, looking around a reinforced room with no windows. The sound of duct fans can be heard, but little else.

Nothing seems to happen for what seems to be an eternity, and then the APC begins moving. The acceleration is surprisingly subtle for such a big machine, though the ride is still pretty rough back here.
column3: 你左手边门嗡嗡作响，然后打开了。两名特工进入房间抓住你的双臂将你带出去。你将被带到底特律众多的生态回收中心之一。一辆装甲的多轮运兵车驶来，上面印着天警部队的颜色。全副武装的特工从APC的耀眼灯光中出现并护送你从斜坡走入APC的等候区中。在车内，你被绑在一个束缚座椅上。警卫在把你关在里面前穿过另一个隔板后两三步就爬了进去。你被留在那里，被坐绑着，环顾这个无窗户的加固单间。可以听到管道风扇的声音，但很小声。似乎毫无动静，时间近似永恒一般，然后APC开始移动。对于这么大一台的机器来说，加速起来却是令人惊讶地不易察觉，尽管路上仍然很艰难。

column2:
When your ride comes to an end, the interior bulkhead opens again, and the guards emerge to unfasten you. You're lead to the exterior doorway, which blinds you when opened. 

The sounds of the city spill in through the door, along with damp exterior air. You're guided down the ramp, and just as your eyes begin to adjust, you're pushed and led towards a huge facility, the EO recycling center 02.

Inside, the great space of the lobby is encased by walls and floors of a soft, green color. The decorative wall fountains mimicking waterfalls and the overall pleasant decor calms you for a moment, which ends as soon as you are pushed inside one of the many elevators.

With a guard at each side, there's not much to do but to wait. You are going downwards, towards the bowels of the facility. The automatic doors open, revealing cold, and mildly lit utilitarian-looking corridors.
column3: 当你的旅程结束时，内部的隔板再次打开，警卫过来解开你的束缚。你被带到出口前，当它打开时你的眼睛还没来得及适应。城市的喧嚣和潮湿的室外空气一起从门外飘进来。你被带着走下斜坡，就在你的眼睛开始适应的时候，你被推向一个巨型的设施，EO回收中心02号。在里面，大厅的大空间被柔和的绿色墙壁和地板包围着。进到里面，大堂的广阔空间被柔和的绿色墙壁和地板包围。墙上模仿瀑布装饰的喷泉，整体的装饰令人感到愉快这让你宁静了一会儿，当你被推进其中一部电梯时，一切戛然而止。你的两边各有一名警卫，除了静待别无选择，你正朝着设施的下方深入。自动门打开了，露出那冰冷柔和的灯光还有实用主义风格的走廊。

column2:
You are taken into what appears to be an examination room, with a stretcher in the middle. Fear starts to build inside you as the guards force you onto the stretcher and bind your limbs to it. You know the end is near. 

Someone in a labcoat arrives. His clothing bears a different logo to that of the DMC or Ecolite Operations. He goes directly into one of the cabinets and gathers a vial, along with a syringe. You stare daggers at him, but he simply ignores your gaze. He injects the vial and extracts the liquid from it.

He then stands right next to you and just like that, he unceremoniously injects you with a lethal dosage of the chemical that will soon take your life away. You soon start to feel dizzy, and all of your strength abandons you. The guards leave as your executioner starts to put everything back.

A worker in a white hazmat suit arrives and without even waiting for you to die, starts to zip you inside of the transparent body bag upon which you were already laid.
column3: 你被带进一间看起来是检查室的地方，中间放着一张担架。当警卫把你逼上担架并将你的四肢绑在担架上时，恐惧感尤然心生。你明白这就是结局了。有个穿白大褂的人来了。他的衣服上有一个不同于DMC或EO的标志。他直接走到一个柜子前从里面拿了一个小瓶，还有一支注射器。你对他怒目而视，但他根本不理会你的目光。他往注射器中抽取小瓶里的液体。然后他站在你旁边就那样粗暴随便地给你注射致死量的化学物质，不久后你将失去生命。很快你就开始感到头晕目眩，所有的力量离你而去。当你的行刑者开始把东西收回去时，警卫离开。一名穿着白色防化服的工作人员来了，甚至没等你死透，就开始把你拉进透明尸体袋里躺着了。

column2:
The worker then starts to push the stretcher, along with you, outside of the office. You are rolled through long corridors, and eventually go directly into one of many of the facility's massive material recycling vats.

Your vision starts to blur but you can see workers throwing a variety of trash and bagged corpses into chutes. The worker finally arrives into a big room, containing rows of bagged bodies. You are placed here and left to die.

As your mind starts to drift away, you realize you never saw cemeteries in the DMC. This must be where everyone here ends up in the end.

Your vision fades to black, but you aren't afraid, not anymore.

You are free.
column3: 工作人员开始把担架和你一同推到办公室外。你被推着穿过漫长的走廊，最后直接来到工厂内众多的大型材料回收桶前。你的视野开始模糊，但你仍能看到工人们将各种垃圾和装袋尸体扔进滑道内。这名工人最后来到一个大房间，里面放着一排排袋装尸体。你被放在这里等待死亡。当你的思绪开始飘走时，你发觉自己从未在底特律见过墓地。这里肯定是每个人的最终归宿。你的视野渐渐暗淡，但你并不害怕，也不再害怕。你已然自由了。

column2: Denied Entry - DMC Guard partial look
column3: 拒绝入境 - 部分DMC警卫外观

column2:
Your presence soon starts to draw attention. The others in the line start to step away from you, knowing what will soon happen. You are overcome with a sinking feeling as you see two DMC guards speaking into their comms and heading your way.
			
You are soon surrounded by them and better equipped operatives. "Out of the line, Now!" one of the agents screams, his gun aimed at your face. You have no options here but to do as they say.

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows. You are taken into custody for questioning.
column3: 你的出现很快就引起了注意。排队的其他人开始远离你并知道很快会发生什么。当你看到两个底特律警卫在用他们的对讲机讲话并朝你走来时，你克服着这种不祥感。你很快就被装备更好的特工包围。“滚出队伍，马上!”其中一名特工喊道，他用枪指着你的脸。你别无选择只好照他们说的做。你被带到据点南部扶壁下的一扇灰色门前，旁边是一扇窄面窗户。你被拘留盘问了。
拒绝入境 - DMC 警卫装备

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAA10816 Authorized."

The guard takes you into a small room with a table in the middle. They confiscate items not allowed in the city, and then give them back. "Alright, put your things on the table," the guard instructs and you comply.

He taps into his comms twice but says nothing. He patiently waits for you to continue. Suddenly, a heavy-gloved hand lands on your shoulder. "Is that some of our gear I see on you?" A new guard asks from behind, prompting you to turn around.

"Alright, buddy, let's go." He continues before you can answer. You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows. You are taken into custody for questioning.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。一阵啁啾声打破了意味深长的沉默, 同时显示屏开始刷新。"访客通行证 N6MAA10816 已授权。"警卫带你进入一个中间有一张桌子的小房间。他们没收武器和其他不允许带进城中的特定物品，之后再物归原主。“好了，伙计，把你的东西都放在桌子上，”警卫命令道，而你照做了。警卫两次打开通讯系统但什么也没讲。他只是继续在耐心地等你。突然，一只戴着沉重手套的手落在你的肩膀上。“那个是我们的装备吗?”有人从后面问道，你促使自己转过身，然后看到检查站其中一名警卫。“好了，老兄，我们走吧。”你还没回答，他就继续说着。你被带到据点南边扶壁底的一扇灰色大门前，旁边镜子般的窗户上有条裂缝。你被拘留盘问了。

column2: Denied Entry - Wanted and Exile II
column3: 拒绝入境 - 通缉并流放 II

column2:
You're not really sure why you're getting back in this line, after all that's happened. It's not like your sentence is up, and you're pretty sure their computer doesn't have faulty memory. Still, maybe there's a chance you'll slip through.

At the front of the line, you're made to stop and submit to a scan. The monitor flashes.

"Exile N6MAA64843 Flagged: Detain for Questioning."

"Are you for real?" the guard asks, incredulous. He pulls you to the side. Then, he pushes you towards another guard. "Take this one to the PS offices." he orders.

"Alright, buddy, let's go." The other guard says as he leads you to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.
column3: 事到如今，你真的不知道自己为什么要回来排队。你的刑期也并未届满，你也确信他们的电脑没有内存故障。不过，也许你仍有机会溜进去。在队伍的前头，你必须停下来接受扫描。那显示屏刷新了。"流放人 N6MAA64843 被标记:拘留审讯" "你是认真的吗?" 警卫难以置信地问道。他把你拉到一边。然后把你推向另一个警卫。"把这人带去嫌疑人员办公处。" 他命令道。"好了，伙计，我们走吧。"另一个守卫一边说一边领着你到据点南边扶壁底的一扇灰色大门前，旁边镜子般的窗户上有条裂缝。
底特律 盘问 - DMC 装备

column2:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.

Your handler leads you to his cubicle, he sits and motions you to do the same. No word is spoken while he just sits there, scribbling notes, cross-checking a nearby monitor, and a stern glance telling you you're not worth the effort.

"How did you get possession of SkyCorps security gear?" The handler suddenly asks, taking you by surprise. A number of related questions follow one after the other, your answers received less than enthusiastically.
column3: 当处理你案件的人到达时, 你已经把天花板分成不同米色块并细数过了，又将失踪人员联系起来编成一个阴谋故事。你的案件处理人将你带到他的隔间，他坐在你面前，示意你也坐下。他只是坐在那里，草草地记下笔记，反复检查旁边的显示器，那严厉的目光像是在告诉你，你在浪费他的时间。"你是怎么得到天警部队的保全装备的?"处理人突然问道, 你有点不知所措。一连串相关的问题接踵而来，你的回答却不太令人满意。

column2:
With the interrogation done and with no real reason to keep you here any longer, you are taken back to gather your stuff. You are then taken into the cinder block room with the blaring speakerphone.

A voice blares, "Possession of contraband and Skycorps equipment is not tolerated. Illegal items will be confiscated."
			
A door on the opposite wall buzzes, and swings open, blinding you temporarily with the light from outside.

When your eyes finally adjust, you see the cold, muddy streets outside the DMC walls, and the huddling throngs of Sprawl inhabitants going about their business.

What now?
column3: 审讯结束后已经没有必要将你留在这了，你被带回去收拾好自己的东西。然后，你被带进水泥砖砌成的房间，里面的扬声器滋滋作响。一个声音喊道, "违禁持有天警部队装备是不得容忍的。非法物品将被没收。"墙对面上的一扇门嗡嗡作响，然后打开了，外面的光线使你暂时失明。当你的眼睛终于适应后，你看到底特律外墙寒冷且泥泞的街道，还有挤在一块的延展区居民们在忙着他们的事情。接下来呢?

column2: DMC Questioning - DMC gear and wanted
column3: 底特律盘问 - DMC 装备并被通缉

column2:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.

Your handler leads you to his cubicle, and you're subjected to a battery of tests, including face scan, retinal scan, DNA sampling, fingerprinting, and a blood sample.

The interview is something of a comedy, with questions like "What is your full name, address, and date of birth?"

The handler isn't amused, however.
column3: 当处理你案件的人到达时, 你已经把天花板分成不同米色块并细数过了，又将失踪人员联系起来编成一个阴谋故事。你被处理人带到他的隔间，进行整套录入, 包括面部扫描、视网膜扫描、DNA采样、指纹采样和血样采样。整个面谈有点像某种喜剧，伴随着像是这样的问题："你的全名叫、住哪的、哪天出生？"然而，处理人还是板着个脸。

column2: DMC Questioning - DMC gear and wanted
column3: 底特律盘问 - DMC 装备并被通缉

column2:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.

Your handler leads you to his cubicle, and you're subjected to a battery of tests, including face scan, retinal scan, DNA sampling, fingerprinting, and a blood sample.

The interview is something of a comedy, with questions like "What is your full name, address, and date of birth?"

The handler isn't amused, however.
column3: 当处理你案件的人到达时, 你已经把天花板分成不同米色块并细数过了，又将失踪人员联系起来编成一个阴谋故事。你被处理人带到他的隔间，进行整套录入, 包括面部扫描、视网膜扫描、DNA采样、指纹采样和血样采样。整个面谈有点像某种喜剧，伴随着像是这样的问题："你的全名叫、住哪的、哪天出生？"然而，处理人还是板着个脸。

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Assault on a Skycorps agent
-Resisting arrest
-Possession of illegal items
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下: -袭击一名天警部队特工 -拒捕 -持有非法物品 -拒绝提供个人信息"

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Possession of illegal items
-First-degree criminal trespassing
-Unauthorized access to a computer with intent to commit an offense
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Consorting with a known felon
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下罪行: -头等非法侵入罪 -访问未经授权的计算机并犯罪未遂 -欺诈并滥用签证 -持有非法物品 -在底特律市行骗 -与一名已知重罪犯来往 -拒绝提供个人信息"

拒绝入境 - DMC 警卫装备

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAA10816 Authorized."

The guard takes you into a small room with a table in the middle. They confiscate weapons and other specific items not allowed in the city, and then give them back. "Alright, man, put your things on the table," the guard instructs and you comply.

The guard taps into his comms twice but says nothing. He just patiently waits for you to continue. Suddenly, a heavy-gloved hand lands on your shoulder. "Is that some of our gear I see on you?" Someone asks from behind, prompting you to turn around and see one of the guards that were on the checkpoint.

"Alright, buddy, let's go." He continues before you can answer. You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows. You are taken into custody for questioning.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。一阵啁啾声打破了意味深长的沉默, 同时显示屏开始刷新。"访客通行证 N6MAA10816 已授权。"警卫带你进入一个中间有一张桌子的小房间。他们没收武器和其他不允许带进城中的特定物品，之后再物归原主。“好了，伙计，把你的东西都放在桌子上，”警卫命令道，而你照做了。警卫两次打开通讯系统但什么也没讲。他只是继续在耐心地等你。突然，一只戴着沉重手套的手落在你的肩膀上。“那个是我们的装备吗?”有人从后面问道，你促使自己转过身，然后看到检查站的其中一名警卫。“好了，老兄，我们走吧。”你还没回答，他就继续说着。你被带到据点南边扶壁底的一扇灰色大门前，旁边镜子般的窗户上有条裂缝。你被拘留盘问了。

column2: DMC Questioning - Already exiled II but not Wanted
column3: 底特律 盘问 - 已被流放 II 但未被通缉

column2:
Same old ceiling tiles. Same old filing cabinets. Same old missing persons... You were about to fall asleep by the time your case handler arrives.

Your handler leads you to her cubicle, where she sits before you and motions for you to do the same. No word is spoken while she just sits there, scribbling notes, cross-checking a nearby monitor, and a stern glance telling you you're not even worth the effort.

Eventually she stands up, and signals security to come and pick you up. A guard grabs your shoulder, and pushes you into the cinder block room with the blaring speakerphone.

A voice blares, "Repeated violation of exile order is cause for term of sentence to be extended by 2 years. Subsequent violations may be subject to penalties including capital punishment, at the discretion of the arresting officer."

A door on the opposite wall buzzes, and swings open to the familiar muddy streets outside the DMC walls.
column3: 同样的天花板格子。同样的旧文件柜。同样的失踪人口...同样的失踪人口…处理你案件的人来时你都快睡着了。你的案件处理人将你带到她的隔间，她坐在你面前，示意你也坐下。她只是坐在那里，草草地记下笔记，反复检查旁边的显示器，那严厉的目光像是在告诉你，你在浪费她的时间。最后她站起来，示意安保带你走。一名警卫抓住你的肩膀并将你推进水泥砖砌成的房间，里面的扬声器滋滋作响。一个声音喊道, "屡次违反流放令将延长2年刑期。之后的违规行为可能导致刑罚，包括死刑，由拘捕人员酌情决定。"对面墙上的一扇门嗡嗡作响，然后打开了，那是底特律墙外熟悉的泥泞街道。

column2:
"A must for everyone visiting Michigan for the first time! Check out our discounts on fair admissions, carnival rides and exhibits! Activities occur at the fairgrounds year-round."
			
You try to locate some landmarks both here and on the map, and trace a route from where you are to Allegan Fairgrounds. (See minimap.)
column3: "所有第一次来密歇根的人都该来观摩!瞧瞧我们优惠又平价的门票，嘉年华摩天轮和展览!游乐场一年一度的活动。"你试着在这和地图上确认一些地标，然后找到从你所在地到阿勒根游乐场的路线。(看小地图)

column2:
The shores of bodies of water like these are the perfect location for wetland flora.

Still, caution must be taken since both animals and survivors are usually attracted to these areas, mainly for water.
column3: 像这样的水体岸边是湿地植物群生长的最佳地点。不过，必须得小心，因为动物和幸存者通常都被吸引到这些地区，主要是为了水。

column2: Use knowledge of plants to find better plant-based loot.
column3: 利用植物知识更好地找到植物战利品。

column2:
Busted knuckles.

While forcing open a promising-looking container, your hand slips, leaving you with a sore hand. 

It's nothing serious, but the container had nothing in it. The entire shack had nothing of use. Well, this place looks like it would make a decent shelter, at least.

You found a campsite!
column3: 指关节受伤。当你强行打开一个看起来很有料的容器时，你的手滑了，手好疼。这没什么大不了的，但是容器里却空空如也。这整个棚屋一无是处。好吧，这地方至少看起来是个不错的避难所。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
As soon as you enter the building, you hear something open with a creaking sound. You then hear footsteps, quickly running outside of the building.

You brace yourself as you realize you are not alone in this place.

You found a campsite!
column3: 刚要进入这建筑，就听到有什么东西打开了，发出咯吱咯吱的声音。然后你听到迅速跑出建筑的脚步声。当你意识到这不止你一个人时，你已经为此做好准备。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
Booby trap!

You spring a hidden trap while trying to enter, and something hits you from the side. Glass shatters loudly as you are pushed. It was a mirrow tied to the ceiling and to a tripwire. It caused some damage but you're lucky it didn't do worse.

Well, this place looks like it would make a decent shelter, at least.

You found a campsite!
column3: 傻瓜陷阱!当你试图进入时蹦出了一个隐藏的陷阱，有东西从侧面打中了你。被你撞开的玻璃碎得很响。那是一面挂在天花板上的镜子和一根绊网。它造成了一些伤害，但你很幸运这并不严重。好吧，这地方至少看起来是个不错的避难所。你找到了一个营地!

column2: Use caution to avoid attracting attention while scavenging.
column3: 在搜刮时要注意避免引起注意。

column2: Use force. Kick doors open, push furniture and debris out of your way to scare off anyone or anything in the building.
column3: 来硬的。一脚踹开门, 推开挡道的家具和杂物，吓跑大楼里的人或东西。

column2:
As soon as you kick the main door open, an arrow whizzes by you. You then hear footsteps, quickly running outside of the building.

You brace yourself as you realize you are not alone in this place.

You found a campsite!
column3: 当你踢开大门时，一支箭嗖地从你身边飞过。然后你听到迅速跑出建筑的脚步声。当你意识到这不止你一个人时，你已经为此做好准备。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
Busted knuckles.

While forcing open a promising-looking container, your hand slips, leaving you with a sore hand. 

It's nothing serious, but the container had nothing in it. The entire shed had nothing of use. Well, this place looks like it would make a decent shelter, at least.

You found a campsite!
column3: 指关节受伤。当你强行打开一个看起来很有料的容器时，你的手滑了，手好疼。这没什么大不了的，但是容器里却空空如也。这整个棚屋一无是处。好吧，这地方至少看起来是个不错的避难所。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
Booby trap!

You spring a hidden trap while trying to examine what looked like a hidden cache, and it causes some damage. You're lucky it didn't do worse.

Well, this place looks like it would make a decent shelter, at least.

You found a campsite!
column3: 傻瓜陷阱!当你试图调查一个看似隐蔽的箱子时弹出了一个隐藏的陷阱，它造成了一些伤害。你很幸运这并不严重。好吧，这个地方至少看起来是个不错的避难所。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
You get to the control panel by the doorway to exam room 14. You press a button and a harsh beep sound answers back. A passcode is required.
			
Guessing the pass would take forever. These automatic doors look way too sturdy to force open.

What else could be done?
column3: 你来到14号检查室门口的控制面板前。你按下了一个按钮并听到刺耳的哔哔声。这需要密码。猜出密码绝无可能。这些自动门看起来太坚固了不可能强行打开。还有什么办法呢?

column2: Use an RFID spoofer to unlock the door.
column3: 使用 RFID 欺骗软件打开门。

column2:
You get to the control panel by the doorway to exam room 14. You launch the software in "brute" mode, and start running codes. After a while, the software registers a hit and the panel's light switches from red to green.
			
You press the access button and a soft beep sound follows, opening the automatic door.
			
(Exam Room 14 has been added to this hex's campsites.)
column3: 你来到14号检查室门口的控制面板前。你启动软件的“暴力”模式，然后开始运行代码。过了一会，软件运算出答案， 面板上的灯光从红色转换成绿色。你按下通道按钮，随着一声柔和的哔哔声，自动门打开了。(14号检查室已被添加到营地中。)

column2:
This exam room is almost identical to room 17. Having a functioning door makes it more secure, and sheltered from the elements.

While there appears to be little worth looting, this room looks like it'd make a great hole-up site.

With a little work, this room could make a better place to hole up in than exam room 17, which could still be used as storeroom, maybe.
column3: 这间检查室和17号检查室大同小异。有一扇功能正常的门保障这里安全并免受外界的影响。虽然这里没什么值得拿走的东西，但这个房间看起来是个很好的藏身之处。只要稍加修缮，这个房间就比17号检查室更适合藏身，17号检查室可以用作储藏室，也许吧。

column2:
The worse place you could think of exploring in the current situation. Who knows what could be nesting inside...

Still, a cave could make an useful campsite. Looters would think twice before going in themselves.
column3: 这是你目前能想到的最糟糕可探索地了。谁知道里面会有什么...尽管如此，洞穴可以成为有用的露营地。拾荒者在进去之前会三思而后行。

column2: Use knowledge of plants to find better plant-based loot.
column3: 利用植物知识更好地找到植物战利品。

column2: Use skill in tracking to be able to find animal-based loot.
column3: 使用追踪技能找到基于动物的战利品。

column2:
Booby trap!

You spring a hidden trap while trying to access a section of the cave, and it causes some damage. You're lucky it didn't do worse.

Well, this place looks like it would make a decent shelter, at least.

You found a campsite!
column3: 傻瓜陷阱!当你试图进入洞穴的某处时弹出了一个隐藏的陷阱，它造成了一些伤害。你很幸运这并不严重。好吧，这个地方至少看起来是个不错的避难所。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
You step on some loose rocks and fall down!
			
While trying to navigate a dangerous section of the cave, you slip and tumble down a small cavern. In the fall, you get banged up and bruised, but thankfully nothing more serious.

Well, this place looks like it would make a decent shelter, at least.

You found a campsite!
column3: 你踩在松动的岩石上并摔倒了!在试图在洞穴的危险部分寻路时，你滑进一个小洞穴里。在跌落中你被撞伤，但谢天谢地没有什么更严重的发生。好吧，这个地方至少看起来是个不错的避难所。你找到了一个营地!

column2:
As you are about to enter the cave, you see something moving fast in the darkness. You quickly move from sight without thinking twice.

You brace yourself as you realize something is coming for you.
column3: 当你正要进入洞穴时，你看到黑暗中有什么东西在快速移动。你想都没想就迅速地避开了它的视线。你意识到有什么东西要来了，不过你已经为此做好准备。

column2:
As you are about to enter the cave, you see something moving fast in the darkness. You quickly move from sight without thinking twice.

You brace yourself as you realize something is coming for you.
column3: 当你正要进入洞穴时，你看到黑暗中有什么东西在快速移动。你想都没想就迅速地避开了它的视线。你意识到有什么东西要来了，不过你已经为此做好准备。

column2: Use a light source to see in darker areas.
column3: 使用光源去观察较暗的区域。

column2: Use night vision to see in dark areas.
column3: 使用夜视去看黑暗的地方。

column2:
You carefully approach the collection of tents. You see mostly trash left behind, the remains of a campfire and otherwise recent signs of activity here. Most of the tents have evident damage and there are things scattered around as if this place was left in a hurry or searched.

Whoever was staying here or did this mess might be close or even still here.
column3: 你小心翼翼地靠近这些帐篷。你看到的主要是被遗弃的垃圾、篝火的残余以及这里最近的活动迹象。大多数帐篷都有明显的损坏，周围还散落着各种东西，好像这个地方是有人匆忙离开或被搜查过的。住在这里或造成这种混乱的人可能就在附近，甚至还在这里。

column2:
As you slowly step towards the area, you hear the noise of food cans, breaking the unconfortable silence. You look down... a trip wire.

You soon hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You brace yourself as you realize you fell into a trap.
column3: 当你慢慢走向这个地方时，你听到了食品罐头发出的噪音，打破了令人不安的寂静。你低头往下看... 是一根绊线。你听到脚步声在向你快速接近。当你意识到自己被伏击时，你已经做好准备。

column2:
As soon as you are about to enter the area, you hear something open with a creaking sound. You then hear footsteps, quickly running towards you.

You brace yourself as you realize something is coming for you.
column3: 刚要进入这建筑，就听到有什么东西打开了，发出咯吱咯吱的声音。然后你听到脚步声在向你快速接近。当你意识到有什么东西朝你靠近时，你做好了准备。

column2:
As you slowly close in, you suddenly hear a pretty bad cough and spluttering behind you. You turn and see at least two figures in the distance. The most noticeable feature in them being blue sashes.
			
"Blasphemer! Heathen!" the one wearing the sash over his head yells and points at you. "Purity brings its light in pain!"

"In pain!" the other one echoes.

You quickly run towards the tents and hide behind one of them. You ready yourself for combat.
column3: 当你慢慢靠近时，你突然听到身后一阵剧烈的咳嗽和噼啪声。你转身看到远处至少有两个人影。其中最引人注目的特征是蓝色腰带。"亵渎者！异教徒！" 头上戴着腰带的人大喊大叫并指着你。"纯洁在痛苦中带来光明！" "痛苦中！"另一个呼应到。 你迅速跑向帐篷，躲在其中一个帐篷后面。你准备好战斗了。

column2:
"Can I just buy the pass instead?" you ask.

Hatter chuckles. "Well... sure, why not. These are not easy to obtain, though," he warns.

Hatter sits back for a few seconds, and contemplates. He starts nodding and leans forward again. "Tell you what, give me three grand and the pass is yours."
column3: "我可以只买通行证吗？" 你问道。哈特轻笑。"好吧……当然，为什么不呢。这些都不容易获得，但是，" 他警告说。哈特向后坐了几秒钟，沉思起来。他开始点头并再次向前倾。"告诉你吧，给我三千美元，通行证就是你的了。"

column2:
Hatter reaches into a desk drawer, and produces a black wristband. "Here's your visitor's pass."
			
"Let me message my contact so they add you to the system. We already have images of your face from the security cameras so that's one thing ready. That way your file actually appears when the guards scan your pass," Hatter says as he types in his device.

After a while, he gets a response. He begins assembling some of his things. "It's a pleasure doing business, Mr. Kindred. Now, I have some business to attend to, so please excuse me."

As you ride the elevator car down through the building's innards once again, you wonder what to expect beyond DMC's massive gates.
column3: 哈特把手伸进书桌抽屉，拿出一条黑色腕带。"这是你的访客通行证。"我们已经从监控摄像头中获取了你的面部图像，所以这方面已经准备好了。这样，当保安扫描你的通行证时，你的档案就会出现，" 哈特一边在设备上打字，一边说道。"很高兴和你做生意，金狄先生。他开始组装他的一些东西。“很高兴做生意，金德雷德先生。现在，我有些事情要处理，所以请原谅。”当你再次乘坐电梯穿过大楼内部时，你不禁想象在 DMC 巨大的大门之外会有什么等着你。

column2:
"That's a lot of money," you admit.

"It is indeed," Hatter agrees. "These are not issued to just anybody. Sprawlers usually take years just to be considered for entry to the city."
column3: "那真的是很多钱，" 你承认。"真的是，" 哈特同意。"这些不是随便发给任何人的。蔓延者通常需要数年时间才有可能被考虑进入城市。"

column2: "So, what'll it be?" Hatter says, picking up a jerry-rigged pocket computer, and thumbing through some list as he waits.
column3: "那么，它会是什么？"哈特一边说，一边拿起一台临时拼凑的口袋电脑，边等待着边用拇指翻阅着某个清单。

column2: Gathering your things, you set off for the forest, and the wilderness beyond.
column3: 收拾好东西，你出发前往森林，及更远的荒野。

column2: Gathering your things, you set off for the forest, and the wilderness beyond.
column3: 收拾好东西，你出发前往森林，及更远的荒野。

column2: Gathering your things, you set off for the forest, and the wilderness beyond.
column3: 收拾好东西，你出发前往森林，及更远的荒野。

column2: Gathering your things, you set off for the forest, and the wilderness beyond.
column3: 收拾好东西，你出发前往森林，及更远的荒野。

column2:
You find yourself in the middle of a forest path, when you suddenly hear a horrible scream in the wilderness beyond.

It stops you right on your tracks. You stand there waiting, feeling your heartbeats about the burst from your chest.

Another screams soon follows. It almost sounds like an old lady.
column3: 你发现自己正走在林间小道上，突然听到远处的荒野里传来一声可怕的尖叫。这声音让你立刻停下脚步。你站在那里，感觉心跳快要从胸口跳出来。不久后，又传来了一声尖叫。这声音几乎听起来像是一位老太太。

column2:
Whatever it is, you decide to move in the opposite direction.
			
The world has become a dangerous place and you feel you shouldn't risk your life. "Lets just focus on staying alive," you tell yourself.
column3: 无论如何，你决定朝相反的方向前进。这个世界变得危险无比，你觉得不应该冒生命危险。"还是专注于活下去吧，" 你对自己说着。
朝着尖叫声的方向前进。

column2:
After some thinking, you decide to investigate. The screams continue as you slowly make your way towards them.
			
You try your best to be stealthy but your presence is eventually noticed. A red fox was the culprit.

It quickly runs away from you. You could hunt it down or just leave it be.
column3: 经过一番思考，你决定去调查。尖叫声持续不断，你小心翼翼地朝声音传来的方向靠近。你尽力保持隐蔽，但最终还是被发现了。原来是只红狐狸在作祟。它很快就从你身边跑开了。你可以追捕它，也可以置之不理。
朝着尖叫声的方向前进。

column2:
After some thinking, you decide to investigate. The screams continue as you slowly make your way towards them.
			
You try your best to be stealthy but your presence is eventually noticed. A red fox was the culprit. It slowly moves towards you from tree to tree, staring at you the whole time.

You freeze in place. You swear you heard it uttered a creepy giggle as it closes in.
column3: 经过一番思考，你决定去调查。尖叫声持续不断，你小心翼翼地朝声音传来的方向靠近。你尽力保持隐蔽，但最终还是被发现了。原来是只红狐狸在作祟。它从一棵树到另一棵树缓慢地向你靠近，整个过程中一直盯着你。你僵在原地。你发誓你听到了它在靠近时发出了一声令人毛骨悚然的 “咯咯 ”的笑声。

column2:
You notice tracks on the ground. You recognize them as fox tracks.

This reminds you that red foxes do make creepy screams like the ones you are hearing right now.

You are not completely sure, though. Something still feels off but you definetely need to decide now.
column3: 你注意到地上的痕迹。你认出它们是狐狸的足迹。这让你想起红狐狸确实会发出类似你现在听到的那种恐怖尖叫声。不过你还不能完全确定。你还是觉得有些不对劲，但你现在肯定需要做出决定。

column2:
These screams... They could be red fox noises.

You remember red foxes do make creepy screams like the ones you are hearing right now.

You are not completely sure, though. Something still feels off but you definetely need to decide now.
column3: 这些尖叫声...这些尖叫声……它们可能是红狐狸发出的声音。这让你想起红狐狸确实会发出类似你现在听到的那种恐怖尖叫声。不过你还不能完全确定。你还是觉得有些不对劲，但你现在肯定需要做出决定。

column2:
Your eyes open in surprise. You are not alone. No matter how hard you try, you can't lift a finger or even move your head.

As your eyes adjust, you notice a presence. A pitch-black figure towers over you. You start to hear whispers all around you. You realize other shadowy figures are circling around past the trees.

A scream in the distance jolts you up. You can move now!
column3: 你惊讶地睁开眼睛。你并不孤单。无论你怎么努力，你都无法动弹一根手指，甚至连头也无法转动。随着眼睛的适应，你注意到了一个东西。一个漆黑的身影在你头顶耸立。你开始听到周围传来缕缕鼾声。你意识到其他朦胧的身影正在树丛中盘旋。远处的尖叫声让你猛地清醒过来。你现在可以动了！

column2:
Your eyes open in surprise. You are not alone. No matter how hard you try, you couldn't lift a finger or even move your head.

As your eyes adjust, you notice a presence. A pitch-black figure towers over you. You start to hear whispers all around you. You realize other shadowy figures are circling around past the trees.

The voices suddenly stop. You feel relieved to see the figures vanish right in front of you, but the feeling of dread lingers.
column3: 你惊讶地睁开眼睛。你并不孤单。无论你怎么努力，你都无法动弹一根手指，甚至连头也无法转动。随着眼睛的适应，你注意到了一个东西。一个漆黑的身影在你头顶耸立。你开始听到周围传来缕缕鼾声。你意识到其他朦胧的身影正在树丛中盘旋。声音突然停止了。看到这些身影在你面前消失，你松了一口气，但恐惧的感觉却挥之不去。

column2:
You notice a path in the forest so you decide to follow it to see where it leads. You suddenly hear whistling from the distance.

You keep walking and soon notice the whistling is coming from some trees beyond a clearing, away from the path.
column3: 您注意到森林里有一条小路，于是决定沿着这条路走，看看它通向哪里。您突然听到远处传来口哨声。你继续前行，很快发现口哨声来自一片空地之外离小路很远的树林。

column2:
After some thinking, you decide to investigate. You traverse the clearing and go past the trees.
			
As you make your way, you notice the whistling suddenly stops. There is no bird chirping or other forest sounds other that the faint sound of the breaking of twigs all around you.

You turn to leave but a presence startles you. There is a deer standing in the way. You freeze in place as you notice it is smiling at you.
column3: 在经过一番思考后，你决定进行调查。你穿过空地，走过树林。走着走着，你发现口哨声突然停止了。除了周围微弱的树枝折断声，没有鸟叫声或其他森林声音。你转身准备离开，却被眼前的景象吓了一跳。有一只鹿挡住了你的去路。当你注意到它正在对你微笑时，你愣在了原地。

column2:
After some thinking, you decide to investigate. You traverse the clearing and go past the trees.
			
As you make your way, you notice the whistling suddenly stops. There is no bird chirping or other forest sounds other that the faint sound of the breaking of twigs all around you.

You turn to leave but a presence startles you. There is a black dog standing in the way. It is not growling or wagging its tail so maybe it is best to back away. As soon as you do, it screams words you don't understand in a human voice.
column3: 在经过一番思考后，你决定进行调查。你穿过空地，走过树林。走着走着，你发现口哨声突然停止了。除了周围微弱的树枝折断声，没有鸟叫声或其他森林声音。你转身准备离开，却被眼前的景象吓了一跳。一只黑狗挡住了你的去路。它没有咆哮，也没有摇尾巴，所以你最好还是退开。当你后退时，它用人类的声音尖叫出你听不懂的话。

column2: The beer is really cheap and it shows. Hopefully it's actual watered down beer.
column3: 啤酒真的很便宜，这一点显而易见。希望那是真正的淡啤酒。
拒绝入境 - 被盗的通行证

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAS22857 Flagged: Detain for Questioning."

Your gut suddenly feels like a vacuum. The guard places a heavy-gloved hand on your shoulder. "Alright, buddy, let's go."

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。先是片刻的沉默，然后监视器闪烁起来，发出令人满意的响声。"访客通行证 N6MAS22857 标记：拘留审问。"你的内脏突然感觉像真空一样。警卫用重重的手套抓住你的肩膀。"好吧，伙计，走吧。"你被带到南墙根部的一扇灰色门前，门旁有一条狭长的镜面窗户。
DMC 审问 - 被盗的通行证

column2:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.

Your handler leads you to his cubicle, and you're subjected to a battery of tests, including face scan, retinal scan, DNA sampling, fingerprinting, and a blood sample.

The interview is something of a comedy, with questions like "What is your full name, address, and date of birth?"

The handler isn't amused, however. He then asks about the bracelet and where you found it. You tell him you found it lying around next to a body, which should be pretty plausible these days. You can't tell if he believes you or not.
column3: 当你的办案人员到达时，你已经数好了天花板上的瓷砖，把它们归类成深浅不一的米色，并精心策划了一个将所有失踪人员联系起来的阴谋。你被处理人带到他的隔间，进行整套录入, 包括面部扫描、视网膜扫描、DNA采样、指纹采样和血样采样。整个面谈有点像某种喜剧，伴随着像是这样的问题："你的全名叫、住哪的、哪天出生？"然而，处理者并不感到高兴。接着他问起手镯的事，问你在哪里找到的。你告诉他是在一具尸体旁发现的，这在如今的环境下应该算得上比较可信。你无法判断他是否相信你的说法。

column2: Denied Entry - Wanted by Police and DMC Guards
column3: 拒绝入境 - 被警方和 DMC 警卫通缉

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAA10816 Suspect Flagged: Detain for Questioning."

Your gut suddenly feels like a vacuum. The guard places a heavy-gloved hand on your shoulder. "Alright, buddy, let's go."

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。先是片刻的沉默，然后监视器闪烁起来，发出令人满意的响声。"访客通行证 N6MAA10816 嫌疑人标记：拘留审问。"你的内脏突然感觉像真空一样。警卫用重重的手套抓住你的肩膀。"好吧，伙计，走吧。"你被带到南墙根部的一扇灰色门前，门旁有一条狭长的镜面窗户。

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Assault on a Skycorps agent
-Resisting arrest
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Consorting with a known felon
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的呲呲声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下罪行： -袭击天军特工 -拒捕 -欺诈和滥用签证 -密谋欺骗底特律市 -与已知重罪犯勾结 -未披露个人信息"

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Assault on a Skycorps agent
-Resisting arrest
-First-degree criminal trespassing
-Unauthorized access to a computer with intent to commit an offense
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Consorting with a known felon
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下罪行: -袭击一名天警部队特工 -拒捕 -头等非法侵入罪 -访问未经授权的计算机并犯罪未遂 -欺诈并滥用签证 -在底特律市行骗 -与一名已知重罪犯来往 -拒绝提供个人信息"

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Resisting arrest
-First-degree criminal trespassing
-Unauthorized access to a computer with intent to commit an offense
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Consorting with a known felon
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下罪行： -拒捕 -一级非法入侵罪 -未经授权访问计算机并意图实施犯罪 -欺诈和滥用签证 -密谋欺骗底特律市 -与已知重罪犯勾结 -未披露个人信息"

column2: Gather water from lake with pot
The water is cold to the touch and doesn't look visibly contaminated.
column3: 水摸起来很冷，看起来没有明显的污染。

column2: Gather water from marsh with pot
This water looks ok enough to be used for purposes other than drinking.
column3: 这种水看起来可以用于饮用以外的用途。

column2: Gather water from river with pot
The stream is pristine and cool. It makes you want to cup your hands and get a drink from it.
column3: 溪流纯净而清爽。它让你想用手捧着喝上一口。

column2: Use a strap or rope to reduce chance of accident.
column3: 使用带子或绳子来减少事故的机会。

column2:
Suddenly, your heart starts to pound, as you find yourself back in a place you never thought you would see again.

You stand before the silhouette again. You clutch your fists as you prepare to lift your head and face it... but as soon as you do, you find yourself back where you were.

This vision felt so real you can't shake the feeling someone is still watching you.
column3: 突然，你的心开始怦怦直跳，因为你发现自己回到了一个你从未想过会再见到的地方。你再次站在剪影前。你紧握拳头，准备抬起头面对它...但是一旦你这样做了，你会发现自己又回到了原来的地方。这种景象感觉如此真实，你无法摆脱有人仍在看着你的感觉。

column2:
A sudden scream startles you. You get down and turn around trying to find the source.

There's someone walking erratically towards you, sobbing and mumbling something you can't quite understand. You notice this person is trying to remove a sack over their head. Your heart sinks as you identify the burlap sack strangling them.

You ready yourself as they close in.
column3: 突然的尖叫吓了你一跳。你趴下，转身试图找到源头。有人不稳定地向你走来，抽泣着，喃喃自语着一些你不太明白的话。你注意到这个人正试图移除他们头上的一个袋子。当你发现麻袋勒死了他们时，你的心沉了下去。当他们逼近时，你做好准备。

column2:
You find yourself walking down a path in these woods when you start to feel a growing sense of unease. You realize the natural sounds of the woods are no more, instead an eerie stillness hanging in the air, broken only by the soft rustle of wind whispering through the trees. Each step you take on the dirt ground covered in sticks and fallen foliage echoes loudly, making your presence known.

Suddenly, a gust of wind lifts an impossible amount of dead leaves and throws them in your direction, forcing you to cover your face with your arms.

As you recover, you realized your hand caught something. A sense of dread overcomes you when you stare at the familiar burlap sack. You let go of it in surprise and step away, wondering if you should take it with you or leave it where it fell.
column3: 当你开始感到越来越不安时，你发现自己走在树林里的一条小路上。你意识到树林里的自然声音不再存在，取而代之的是一种诡异的寂静悬挂在空中，只有风穿过树林的轻柔沙沙声打破了它。你在布满树枝和落叶的泥土地上迈出的每一步都会发出响亮的回声，让人们知道你的存在。突然，一阵风吹起数量不可能的枯叶，向你的方向扔去，迫使你用手臂捂住脸。当你恢复时，你意识到你的手抓住了什么东西。当你盯着熟悉的麻袋时，一种恐惧感征服了你。你惊讶地放开它，走开了，不知道是应该把它带走，还是把它留在掉落的地方。

column2:
You ask for apples. The trader grabs a flour bag and walks towards a wooden crate filled with apples.

He quickly grabs four of them and puts them in the bag. He then leaves the bag by the entrance.


"Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你要苹果。商人抓起一个面粉袋，走向一个装满苹果的木箱。他迅速抓起其中的四个，放进袋子里。然后他把包放在入口处。"还需要什么吗？" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
You ask for nuts. The trader grabs a flour bag and walks towards a closed wooden crate.

He opens it and shoves the bag in it, filling it with nuts. He then lifts it and leaves it by the entrance.


"Anything else?" he asks as he goes back outside.
column3: 你要坚果。商人抓起一个面粉袋，走向一个封闭的木箱。他打开盒子，把袋子塞进去，装满坚果。然后他提起袋子，将它放在入口处。"还需要什么吗？" 他边走回外面边问道。

column2:
Knowing Hatter is the only way to get a new visitor's pass to enter the DMC, you decide to see if you can buy a new one. One of the guards nods at you and lets you in the elevator. You soon begin the trundling passage to the upper floors.

Stepping off the lift, you see Hatter's already sitting in his chair, busy writting something in his device.

"How hard would it be for you to get me another visitor's pass?" you suddenly ask.

Hatter chuckles. "Why, what happened with the other one?" he asks but continues before you can answer. "You know these are not easy to obtain so I would require the usual three grand but also time... three days at most," he warns.
column3: 知道Hatter是获得新访客通行证进入DMC的唯一途径，你决定看看是否能买一张新的。一个警卫向你点点头，让你进了电梯。你很快就开始了通往上层的滚动通道。走下电梯，你看到哈特已经坐在椅子上，忙着在他的设备上写东西。“你再给我弄一张访客通行证有多难？”你突然问。哈特轻笑。“怎么，另一个怎么了？”他问，但在你回答之前继续。“你知道这些不容易获得，所以我需要通常的三千美元，但也需要时间……最多三天，”他警告说。

column2:
Hatter nods as he receives the payment. "Your visitor's pass will be ready in three days. You have my word," he says.
			
"Now, let me message my contact to let them know. We already have your information so that's a lot of work done already," Hatter continues as he types in his device.

After a while, he gets a response. He begins assembling some of his things. "Pleasure doing business, Mr. Kindred. Remember to check back with me in three days."

You ride the elevator car down through the building's innards once again. You wonder what to do next.
column3: 帽匠收到付款时点点头。“您的访客通行证将在三天内准备好。我向你保证，”他说。“现在，让我给我的联系人发消息让他们知道。我们已经有了你的信息，所以已经做了很多工作，”哈特继续在他的设备上打字。"很高兴和你做生意，金狄先生。他开始组装他的一些东西。“很高兴和你做生意，金德雷德先生。记得三天后再来找我。”你再次乘坐电梯轿厢穿过大楼的内部。你想知道下一步该做什么。

column2:
"That's a lot of money," you admit.

"It is indeed," Hatter agrees. "Give it a thought, Mr. Kindred. You know where to find me."

You ride the elevator car down through the building's innards once again. You wonder what to do next.
column3: "那真的是很多钱，" 你承认。"真的是，" 哈特同意。“想一想，金德雷德先生。你知道在哪里可以找到我。”你再次乘坐电梯轿厢穿过大楼的内部。你想知道下一步该做什么。

column2: Return to Hatter and recieve your new visitor's pass
column3: 返回Hatter并领取新的访客通行证

column2:
As you arrive at Hatter's place, one of the guards sees you and starts to walk towards you.

"Mr. Kindred," he nods. "Hatter said you were coming so he left your package with us so you don't have to go all the way up there," he informs you as he hands you your order.
column3: 当你到达帽匠的住处时，一个警卫看到了你，开始向你走来。“金德雷德先生，”他点点头。“哈特说你要来，所以他把你的包裹留给了我们，这样你就不用大老远跑到那里了，”他在递给你订单时告诉你。

column2: Return to Hatter after being paid for big Blue Rot deal, no contact
column3: 在获得big Blue Rot交易报酬后返回Hatter，没有联系

column2:
Hatter's guards treat you differently now. Instead of the stand-offishness of yore, they greet you as if a regular.

"Mr. Kindred," he nods. "Hatter's not in. May not be for a while, in fact. I'll let him know you stopped by, though," he informs you.

"Vacation, perhaps?" You ask casually. "Perhaps," he answers as he gives you a card. "If you have important matters to discuss, send a message to that contact," he says as he goes back to his post.
column3: 哈特的警卫现在对你不一样了。他们不再像以前那样冷漠，而是像常客一样问候你。“金德雷德先生，”他点点头。“哈特不在。事实上，可能暂时不会。不过，我会让他知道你来过，”他告诉你。“也许是度假？”你随便问。“也许吧，”他一边回答，一边递给你一张卡片。“如果你有重要的事情要讨论，给那个联系人发一条信息，”他一边回到自己的岗位上一边说。

column2:
"Free barbecue! Grab your free skewer now, before the next fight! A chance once in a lifetime!" you hear as you get closer to the crowd. It seems handouts are not common in here.
			
You wade through dirty patrons, intent on manhandling some ribs, or beans and rice, or whatever it is they've got cooking over there. The fervor you see for this barbecue creeps you out. Are these people really this desperate for food? Maybe the meat is spiked with drugs or something.

You decide to avoid the food in this place... at least for now.
column3: "免费烤肉!现在就拿起你的免费烤肉串，在下一场比赛之前!一生中只有一次的机会!"当你走近人群时，你会听到这样的声音。看来施舍在这里并不常见。 你挤过人群，只想找点排骨或者豆子、米饭什么的。你看到的对烧烤的热情让你毛骨悚然。这些人真的这么渴望食物吗？也许肉里掺了毒品什么的。你决定不吃这个地方的食物...至少现在是这样。

column2:
You gingerly open the door to the mine antechamber. It appears to be empty. No sign of Gertrude... at least at first.

As soon as you make your way to the door at the other side, You see the metal creature heading your way but it starts to slow down and stop. It suddenly shuts down.

You see a red light from a security camera flickering on and off just above the doorway and soon after, the door opens.
column3: 你小心翼翼地打开矿井前厅的门。它似乎是空的。没有格特鲁德的踪迹...至少一开始是这样。当你走到另一边的门时，你看到那个金属生物向你走来，但它开始减速并停下来。它突然关闭了。你看到一个安全摄像头发出的红灯在门口上方忽明忽暗，不久之后，门打开了。

column2:
You gingerly open the door to the mine antechamber. It appears to be empty. No sign of Gertrude... at least at first.

Your heart suddenly sinks as you spot the metal creature sitting in a corner, staring at you, menacingly.

You see a red light from a security camera flickering on and off just above the doorway and soon after, the door opens, signaling you to make your way to Bob. Gertrude follows you with a soulless stare the whole time.
column3: 你小心翼翼地打开矿井前厅的门。它似乎是空的。没有格特鲁德的踪迹...至少一开始是这样。当你发现那个金属生物坐在角落里，威胁地盯着你时，你的心突然沉了下去。你看到门口上方的安全摄像头发出的红灯忽明忽暗，不久之后，门打开了，示意你去找鲍勃。格特鲁德一直盯着你。
辐射鲍勃-准备以物易物

column2:
"Hey there, fella. Still kicking, I see?" Bob asks as he signals you to sit in the usual metal chair for customers.

"Here for more bartering, I 'spect?" He continues as he sits next to a big metal crate.

"So tell me, fella, whatchu wonna trade for?"
column3: “嘿，伙计。我明白了，还在踢？”鲍勃一边问，一边示意你坐在顾客常用的金属椅子上。“我猜是来交换东西的吧？”他继续坐在一个大金属板条箱旁边。“那么，告诉我，伙计，你想换什么？”

column2: "Alright, then. Something else?" Bob asks as he goes back to his chair next to the big metal crate.
column3: "好了,那么。还有别的事吗？”鲍勃一边问，一边回到大金属板条箱旁边的椅子上。

column2:
"Well, I reckon that's that, then," Bob says as he gets up from his chair.

"Come again, will ya?" Bob gushes as he shakes your hands. "Always welcome. Let me walk you out, fella," Bob says as he actually walks you ouside the mine.
column3: “嗯，我想就这样了，”鲍勃从椅子上站起来说。“再来，好吗？”鲍勃和你握手时滔滔不绝。总能成功。让我送你出去，伙计，”鲍勃一边说，一边真正带你走出矿井。

column2: You keep walking along the ravine trail until you've lost sight of the Isotope Mine.
column3: 你继续沿着峡谷小径走，直到你看不见同位素矿。

column2: You keep walking along the ravine trail until you've lost sight of the Isotope Mine.
column3: 你继续沿着峡谷小径走，直到你看不见同位素矿。

column2:
"Want one of my hot bricks, Huh?"

"Whatchu got ta offer?"
column3: “想要一块我的热砖吗？”“你得到了什么提议？”

column2: "Another satisfied customer. Not that I get many 'round here!" Bob jokes as he hands you a hot brick.
column3: “又一位满意的顾客。并不是说我在这里有很多人！”鲍勃一边开玩笑，一边递给你一块热砖头。

column2: Radiation Bob - Ready to barter for first time
column3: 辐射鲍勃-准备第一次以物易物

column2:
"Hey there, fella. I knew ye would be back," Bob says as he signals you to sit in the most unconfortable-looking metal chair you have ever seen.

"Here, hold on a minute," he says as he gets up and walks towards a panel on the wall. It's a circuit breaker. He flips one of the switches on and you hear a distant buzz.

"I use the room outside as beedroom sometimes, ye are welcome to store things. Maybe even use some of the stuff there if ya give me something!" Bob bursts into a fit of yet another wheezing, asthmatic laughter.

"Speaking of; here for more bartering, I 'spect?" He continues as he sits next to a big metal crate.

"So tell me, fella, whatchu wonna trade for?"
column3: “嘿，伙计。我就知道叶会回来，”鲍勃一边说，一边示意你坐在你见过的看起来最不舒服的金属椅子上。“这里，等一下，”他说着站起来，走向墙上的一块嵌板。这是一个断路器。他打开其中一个开关，你听到远处的嗡嗡声。“我有时把外面的房间用作卧室，欢迎你们存放东西。如果你给我一些东西，也许甚至可以用那里的一些东西！”鲍勃突然又发出一阵喘息、气喘吁吁的笑声。“说到这个，我猜是来交换东西的吧？”他继续坐在一个大金属板条箱旁边。“那么，告诉我，伙计，你想换什么？”

column2:
"Want access to my ol' workbench, Huh?"

"Whatchu got ta offer?"
column3: “想使用我的旧工作台吗？”“你得到了什么提议？”

column2:
"Much obliged, fella," Bob says as he gets up and walks towards the circuit breaker.

"Give those ol' tools a good use. Oh, and don't lose any, I still use 'em!" he says as he flips the switch that unlocks and powers his workbench.
column3: “非常感谢，伙计，”鲍勃说着站起来，走向断路器。“好好利用这些旧工具。哦，别丢了，我还在用！”他一边说，一边拨动打开工作台并为其供电的开关。

column2:
"Want to store and power yer devices ta the wild? Get one of these. Just remember that this thing doesn't generate its own power."

"Whatchu got ta offer?"
column3: “想要在野外存储和供电您的设备吗？拿一个。请记住，这东西不会产生自己的能量。”“你得到了什么提议？”

column2: "Done and done, fella," Bob says as he hands you the contraption.
column3: “搞定了，伙计，”鲍勃一边说，一边把这个装置递给你。

column2:
"Found ta perfect mancave but it's dark as shit? Get one of these puppies."

"Whatchu got ta offer?"
column3: “找到了完美的曼卡夫，但它黑得像狗屎？养一只这样的小狗。”“你得到了什么提议？”

column2: "Looks like my hard work is finally payin' off!" Bob jokes as he hands you the contraption.
column3: “看来我的努力终于有回报了！”鲍勃一边开玩笑，一边递给你这个装置。

column2:
You scan your surroundings for a few moments, watching carefully for movement. Nothing, though, not even the sound of wind or creaking from the old structure.

You consider your next step.
column3: 你扫视周围一会儿，仔细观察动静。然而，什么也没有，甚至没有风声或旧建筑的吱吱声。你考虑你的下一步。

column2: Use your athletic skill to safely scavenge hard to reach locations.
column3: 使用你的运动技能安全地清除难以到达的地方。
蓝蛙目击者 (僵僵, 早晨)
树林中的扼杀者兜帽（日）
